loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yovana; ella tiene 31 años de edad, soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de picantería lugar donde venden comida típica también venden chicha hecha a base de maíz, también vende cerveza, siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento la socia es una persona muy alegre y con ganas de seguir adelante.   

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos como carne,arroz,azúcar entre otros mas para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the village bank "San Valentin".  The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.  

Yovana is 31 years old, single, and has two children.  She has a food stall where she sells typical foods as well as chicha, a fermented corn-based beverage.  They also sell beer.  This is the only business that she currently operates.  Yovana is a very happy person and wants to get ahead.

She requests a loan to buy ingredients such as meat, rice, sugar and other things for her business.

She is very happy because of the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as meat, rice, sugar and other things for her business

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo ha nacido el 23 de Abril de 1968 en la comunidad Kaspicancha Baja en la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba.
La actividad que se dedica el señor Gerardo es la agricultura que produce papa, haba y cereales, las siembras que realiza son temporales en el lugar prácticamente es la parte alta del Municipio.
La vivienda donde vive es muy económico sus características de la vivienda de techo de paja con paredes de barro sus pisos de tierra, vive con su familia  es responsable con sus obligaciones en su casa como también en la comunidad.
El crédito que solicito es para comprar terreno agrícola en el lugar donde vive, según don Gerardo sus terrenos que tienen es muy poco no alcanza como para sembrar suficiente para abastecer su familia, es por esa razón decidió solicitar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Gerardo was born April 23, 1968 in the Kaspicancha Baja community, located in the Tiraque Province in the Department of Cochabamba.

Gerardo’s area of work is agriculture and he grows potatoes, beans, and cereals. He plants seasonally and the place where he grows is practically the high altitude area of the municipality.

The house where he lives is very inexpensive and it has a straw roof, mud walls, and an earthen floor. He lives with his family and he is responsible with his household as well as his community obligations.

The loan that he is requesting is to purchase farmland where he lives. According to Gerardo, he has few lands and they aren’t enough to plant sufficient crops to support his family. This is why he decided to request the loan.

loans.use: To purchase land for farming

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en:
Sorm S. H., 28, is a married woman who sells fish as well as vegetables in and around the province Kompong Tom province. 

Her husband is a motor taxi driver in and around his village. Before he begins his taxi service, Sorm S. H.’s husband always assists her in buying fish and vegetables from their regular supplier at a reasonable price. After that, they use his motorbike to take their products to the busy market for resale.

Recently, she has wished to pick up her items in a bigger amount than at present. So Sorm S. H. has decided to seek a loan in order to purchase a trailer to connect to the motorbike so that she can use it to pick up more fish and vegetables. 

The family usually generates a profit of about $4.30 per day. They have two children living under their care.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for the motorbike to haul more products

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is a 42-year-old mother of three daughters and two sons who are school and college students. The oldest is 21 years old while the youngest is 6 years old. Wafa's husband drives a taxi car in the city of Gaza in Gaza Strip. He bought the car a few years ago through his friend and agreed with the owner to pay a fixed amount. He needs to pay the last $3000 and took out a loan from FATEN to be able to pay smaller amounts of money every month.

Wafa's husband, Abdul Hafeez, appears in the photo as Wafa is a conservative woman and doesn't want her picture posted on the web.

loans.use: To make the last payments on a taxi car

loans.name: Zuura's Group

texts.en:
Zuura J., 59, is a leader of this group. Her whole life was spent in a hometown of Balykchy, which is translated from Kyrgyz language as “fisherman”. The town used to be a major industrial and transportation center, but most of its activities stopped after the collapse of the Soviet Union. Zuura is one of 40 000 people, who stayed in a town regardless of the difficult economic times. Zuura pursued a major in medicine and has been curing people for a major portion of her life. She works in a diagnostic center of a local hospital, and gets paid 2,000 soms monthly, and receives additional help of 2,700 from social fund. Zuura lives with her husband and a 13 year old son. She applied for this loan to help push forward her husband’s business. It was started six years ago, when her husband invested all his return from driving a cab in acquisition of raw material for his new business. Zuura’s husband is very handy and makes various types of furniture, household appliances and trailers for trucks. Business is well-advanced now and the family already opened its own workshop. It made her husband’s work more comfortable and effective. The proceeded return of 8 000 soms unfortunately is not enough to accomplish all orders that he is receiving now. Therefore Zuura asks for a loan in order to purchase raw materials such as ironmongery, pipes, plywood and planks. 

       --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is married and has 5five dependents. She has received junior high education. Joyce sells eggs and bread at Abura near Watreso, which she has done for three years. Her husband is a chain saw operator. 

Joyce uses the income she generates from her sales to help in the upkeep of the home. She needs a loan to enable her to expand the sales of the bread and eggs. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to save towards buying a shop.

loans.use: to expand her sales of bread and eggs.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, es natural del distrito de San Francisco, tiene 43 años de edad, es un hombre muy  comprometido con su trabajo, convive con Vilma de 38 años y fruto de esa relación hoy tienen 05 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa  donde reina la compresión y el apoyo mutuo entre si. Juan, empezó su aventura como carpintero desde muy niño en el taller de sus padres. Su pasión  por el oficio lo llevó adquirir sus propias herramientas de trabajo donde viene puliendo madera desde hace 22 años en su taller. Asimismo es proveedor de sus servicios trabaja con colegios e instituciones y municipalidades de la zona realizando el trabajo de mesas, sillas, andamios, roperos, escritorios, entre otros. Cuenta con 03 ayudantes, quienes se encargan de terminar con el trabajo; se siente muy comprometido con su labor, su lema es la puntualidad en la entrega del mueble que le piden. Sin embargo parte del riesgo de su trabajo es tener que absorber el polvo de la madera pulida, por ello tiene que ir cada cierto tiempo al médico hacerse un chequeo. Su mayor problema es no tener capital para poder comprar más madera, por ello recurre a MFP, para que le facilite el crédito. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar sus maderas ya que es el factor principal de su producción. Este es su primer crédito de Juan con MFP,  se siente comprometido a cumplir con sus cronogramas de pago ya que posteriormente desea acceder a otro crédito. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará bloques de madera.
texts.en:
Juan, a native of the district of San Francisco, is 43 years old. He is a man who is very dedicated to his work. He lives with Vilma, age 38, and they have 5 children. They live together in their own home where understanding and mutual support reign.

Juan began working as a carpenter at a very young age in his father’s shop. His passion for the work led him to acquire his own tools, and since the age of 22 he has been working with wood in his own shop. He also provides his services working for high schools, institutions, and municipalities in his area making tables, chairs, scaffolding, closets, and desks, among other things. He has three helpers who are charged with doing finishing work. He is very involved with his work. His main goal is the punctual delivery of furniture that is ordered.

One of the risks associated with his work is that he has to breathe the dust from working wood. That’s why every so often he goes to the doctor for a checkup. His biggest problem is that he does not have the capital needed to buy more wood. That’s why he has gone to MFP to obtain a loan. Now, his greatest priority is to buy wood since this is the principal factor for his production. This is Juan’s first loan with MFP. He is committed to meeting his payment schedule since he wants to acquire another loan later. With the 1500 new soles applied for he will buy bundles of wood.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wood.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Gemma B. works hard to support her family. She sells dried fish and also earns additional income from a manicure and pedicure business.

Gemma has sustained her business through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 11,000 PHP more through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell in her stall.

Gemma hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Concepcion

texts.en: Ma. Concepcion works hard to support three children. She is married and has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Ma. Concepcion requested a 1,500-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy a Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the cookstove because she wants to lessen firewood consumption when cooking. Ma. Concepcion is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a cleaner, more efficient cookstove

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. She sells eggs and bread at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast, which she has done for 12 years. Cecilia assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Cecilia will use the loan to purchase additional crates of eggs and to bake extra quantities of bread for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to save toward building a snack bar.

loans.use: to purchase additional crates of eggs and to bake extra quantities of bread for sale.

loans.name: Celidonia

texts.es: Celidonia tiene 50 años, es viuda  y vive en compañía D. su menor hijo en su casa que es propia. Casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura y la ganadería, actividades que le han proporcionado el sustento para ella y su hijo. En su establo cría principalmente oveja y 2 vacas que lleva diariamente al campo, en espacios abiertos para que puedan pastear, pero cuando el tiempo le es poco, ella se queda a pernoctar en una pequeña estancia que tiene a lo ellos del monte para que cuiD. D. sus animales y pueda aprovechar ellos el pasto necesario, hay veces en que se queda semana enteras en ese lugar. Del mismo modo, siembra papa, habas, oca entre otros productos alimenticios sobre sus terrenos que posee. La mayoría D. veces es su hijo quien la apoya, pero cuando son temporadas que requiere D. mucho esfuerzo tiene que contratar a jornaleros para que le ayuden con el trabajo. Actualmente la venta D. animales le es rentable, por ello desea que ustedes la apoyen con un préstamo para que pueda comprar más animales. Este será su crédito número 3 que tiene con MFP, manifiesta que formar parte D. su banco comunal le ha permitido crecer y mejorar en su actividad por lo que esta muy agradecida, a su vez se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. semillas D. pastos que será D. alimento para sus animales sobre todo en tiempo D. escasez D. pastizales, sacos D. abono y una parte en la compra D. alimento balanceado para sus vacas.
texts.en: Celidonia is 50 years old, a widow and lives with her youngest son in her own home. She has spent almost all of her life working in agriculture and stock breeding, work that has provided her and her son what they need to live. Celidonia in her stable mainly breeds a sheep and 2 cows that she takes each day to pasture in the open fields so that they can eat. However, when there is little time she lets them pass the night in a small farm that she has on a hill to take care of her animals and they can enjoy the grass, sometimes she spends weeks in this place. Celidonia also grows potatoes, broad beans, oca (an Andean tuber) and other food products on her land. Most of the time her son helps her take care of the land, but during the harvest season she needs extra labor and hires day laborers. At present, selling animals is profitable which is why she needs your support for a loan that will allow her to buy more animals. This is Celidonia’s third loan with MFP and says that being a member of her communal bank has allowed her to grow and improve in her work which is why she is very grateful; she is committed to meeting all of her payments. The loan will be used to buy grass seeds that will feed her animals especially during the dry season, sacks of manure and a balanced diet for her cows.

loans.use: buy grass seeds, sacks of manure and food for her cows.

loans.name: Et

texts.en:
Mrs. Et resides in Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. She owns a kiosk, a wooden store at Baray market. She sells goods in the store, for example cooking ingredients, soft drinks, cakes and sweets and other necessary items. She is able to make around US$ 2 in revenue each day for the family’s needs. 

To generate extra income, her husband works in fishing activity, earning about US$ 2 each day also. In order to make her sales business more successful and increase her profit, Mrs. Et has asked for some funds from Kiva to buy additional items for resale. In the future, she thinks she can enlarge her selling size, building a new and bigger house to live in and supporting her two children till they graduate with a university degree.

loans.use: to buy additional items for resale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 23 years old and lives in the West Point area.  She did not attend school.  She’s married and her husband is a driver.  They have 2 children who live at home and attend school. For the past 10 years Hawa has been involved in buying and selling charcoal.

Her main challenge is the long distances she has to travel to buy the charcoal, and many delays and problems due to the rainy season. What she likes about this business is selling to customers.  She is proud to be able to send her children to school.  Hawa has requested this loan to purchase charcoal in bulk so that it is cheaper. In the future, she would like to give her children somewhere nice to live.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina nos cuenta que nació en la comunidad del Tambo Real (provincia de Anta, departamento Cusco, Perú), tiene 44 años de edad y está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cinco hijos. Actualmente, Alejandrina vive en la comunidad de Santa Barbará y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Alejandrina se dedica a varias actividades como por ejemplo la agricultura y ganadería. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella también se dedica la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y vende en la feria de Inquilapata a 15 minutos de donde vive la socia. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para construir más galpones y comprar cuyes reproductores. 

Alejandrina es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Alejandrina tells us that she was born in the community of Tambo Real (Anta Province, Cusco Department, Perú).  She’s 44 years old, married and has five children.  Currently, Alejandrina lives in the community of Santa Bárbara and that’s where she carries out her economic activities.  Alejandrina is engaged in several activities, for example, farming and raising livestock.  She’s been in these lines of work for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She also raises small farm animals like guinea pigs that she sells at the Inquilapata market that’s fifteen minutes from where she lives.  On this occasion she needs the loan to build more animal enclosures and to buy breeding guinea pigs.

Alejandrina is a very hard working, responsible person and because of those qualities her fellow members invited her to join Asociación Arariwa’s “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” (Tambo Real’s Solidarity) communal bank.

loans.use: to build more animal enclosures and to buy breeding guinea pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Arlene

texts.en:
Ma. Arlene is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has four children.
 
Ma. Arlene  has a retail shop that sells canned goods, breads and snacks. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Ma. Arlene is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mirian Esperanza

texts.en: Mirian, who lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras with her two children, operates a small grocery stand at the local market and sells basic grains and beef itinerantly via motorcycle. She is requesting a loan of HNL 12,000 to purchase beef and basic merchandise. Mirian hopes to keep working with Prisma in the future in order to expand her small business.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, juices, milk, eggs, beef, corn, cornmeal, beans, rice, cooking oil, lard, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad, 58, is married with six children. She lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Felicidad has a junk metal shop. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately 20000. She has requested a loan for 7,000 to purchase plastic, bottles, bronze, G.I sheeting, and bronze to sell. Felicidad has been a member of PMPC for over a year. In the future, Felicidad hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy plastics, bottles, G.I (metal) sheeting, and bronze to sell

location.town: Liloy-La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Sara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sara Elizabeth tiene 39 años de edad es soltera vive con los tres hijos de 10, 8,3 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Sara se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder comparse una casa para poder vivir tranquila con los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Sara Elizabeth, 39, is single living with her three children who are 10, 8 and 3 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” (Heading towards the Future) communal bank located in Jesús de Gran Poder in Ventanas Canton are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Sara is a corn and rice farmer.  She buys her supplies at the Marlín supply center and does her sales there too and in Ventanas.

She is asking for the loan to buy seeds, supplies, liquids, urea and fertilizer for her crops.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  She faces challenges like infestations and diseases.  Her dream is to be able to buy herself a house where she can live in peace with her children.  In her spare time she enjoys going on excursions and dedicating more time to work.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 59 years old and widowed. She supports a family of four. Her primary business is dairy farming and she has been in business for the past 20 years. Her monthly income from the business is KES 29,000.

This is her third loan with KADET. She paid her previous loans successfully. The loan will help her pay school fees for her children. Her dream and hope is to ensure that her family is stable and her children study and get good jobs.

loans.use: To educate her children.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a food vending business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour and establish a selling stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour and establish a selling stall.

loans.name: Tun

texts.en: Mrs. Tun is a 58-year-old woman who has been living in Kompong Chhnang province. She is involved in an agricultural business, cultivating rice crops. Her husband has the same business as her. During the rainy season of the year, this couple has a lot of to do on their farmland from dawn to dusk. Together, they typically earn about $2.5 USD per day. This income is not enough to cover the household's financial needs, no matter how hardworking they are. To increase their income, Mrs. Tun has decided to send her two daughters to work in a garment factory from which they can get a salary of around $50 USD per person. Currently Mrs. Tun is seeking a loan from Kiva to buy some fishing tools (net, lines, poles, hooks) to use for catching fish during the rainy season. Mrs. Tun said that this loan would help the family cut down on some food expenses. For the future, Mrs. Tun wants her two daughters to become tailors and own a small store in the village.

loans.use: to buy some fishing tools (net, lines, poles, hooks) for the use of catching fish.

loans.name: M.m.h.u Group

texts.en:
Greetings from M.M.H.U Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the M.M.H.U SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rose will buy more livestock assets. 

In 2012, the members of M.M.H.U SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is applying for another loan to expand her clothes-selling business. She will use this 100,000 KES loan to purchase more clothes and cosmetics for resale. In the future, Jane aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Jane has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
This is Minerva, 49, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines, married to Clorito, an overseas contract worker, and the mother of four children. Her eldest is currently working as a call center agent; the second one is a nursing graduate; the third is in high school and her youngest is a special child who is now in Grade 4 studying in a special school for autistic children. While attending to her family, Minerva has also kept herself busy with her business to help her husband in sustaining daily expenses.

Minerva owns a variety store that sells groceries such as canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, and other household commodities. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Minerva is requesting a Php10,000 loan to buy more grocery items for her store. The more items displayed at the store the better, as they help to attract more customers and thus increase her profits, some of which she will use for her children's school expenses.

Minerva hopes that her business will continue to earn sufficient income for the needs of her family. She dreams of maintaining her youngest in the special school and continuing to fund her medicines. She hopes that her other children will have a stable life once they have their own families. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* group, as she learns a lot from the Bible, which strengthens her spiritual life.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 27 years old and married with three adult children. Eliza is from Sinusa, Ozamis City. 

Elisa owns a plot of land, where she plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this work for over 10 years, and she earns 3,000 PHP every month.

In 2011, Elisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elisa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise. This will be Elisa's first loan from GDMPC. Elisa wants to financially support members of her immediate family and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise.

loans.name: Jorge Jose

texts.es:
Jorge José tiene 22 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, maíz hace 3 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos agrícolas, urea, fertilizantes. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar insumos.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema en los cultivos. El sueño es tener una casa.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar en los desmontes.
texts.en:
Jorge José is 22 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Jorge José is a member of the San Juan Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of San Francisco and part of the parish of San Juan. The members are farmers.

Jorge José is a farmer who has been growing rice and corn for three years. He buys and sells in San Juan. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies, urea, and fertilizers. The loan will be of great help because he will be able to acquire these products. At the moment, he is not experiencing any problems with his crops. His dream is to own a house.

In his free time, Jorge José enjoys being out in the open fields.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, urea, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her father and mother).   

Prossy has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days a week. Prossy sells her products at the market, by means of retail.  Prossy has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.  She also generates additional income through dry cleaning. The main business challenges for Prossy include thieves and seasonality.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and to start going to the villages of Masaka for bananas.  Prossy lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Sandra es socia del banco comunal Nueva Juventud, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, cuenta con una gran belleza, riqueza natural y cultural, su gente es amable, cordial, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Sandra tiene 23 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido una niña de 3 años de edad. Su esposo labora como estibador, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de cuyes y gallinas, también los días de feria se dedica al armado de casetas para las vendedoras de la feria. 

Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la comprar de cuyes y gallinas. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Juventud".  She lives in the city of Cuenca which in December 1999 was designated as a World Heritage Site.  It is a place of extraordinary beauty, with natural and culture wealth and its people are kind and cordial and maintain their culture and traditions.

Sandra is 23 and lives with her common-law husband and their three-year-old daughter.  Her husband is a stevedor. They live in a rental house.

She sells guineas pigs and hens, and on holidays also sets up the stalls for the tradefairs.  This is her fourth loan through the communal bank and she plans to use it to buy guinea pigs and hens.

Her goal is to have her own house some day.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora  Gladys es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y costura desde hace 8 años. Ella inicio este negocio realizando pequeñas reparaciones de ropa luego fue mejorando con ayuda de los créditos. 
Glaydys invertirá el préstamo en pacas de ropa y materia prima tela, hilos…ect.
texts.en: Gladys is a hardworking, enterprising woman who sells used clothes and sews; she’s been in business 8 years.  She started the business doing minor clothing repairs and then gradually improved with help from the loans.  Glaydys will use the loan to buy bundles of clothes and raw materials: fabric, thread, etc.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes, fabric and thread.

loans.name: Pauline's Group

texts.en:
Pauline, pictured above, has been a farmer for 8 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 13 farmers in Chwele District. She is 35 years old, is married and has 5 children.

Pauline likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has learnt a lot from farming trainings. Pauline plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Pauline’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Ayéwa

texts.en:
A married mother of 2, Ms. Ayéwa A. is in the business of retail rice sales in her locale. Her husband, a bike mechanic, is unable to meet the needs of his family as he does not have a shop. The majority of the family’s expenses are covered by Ms. Ayéwa A.. She therefore feels obligated to increase her efforts to fulfill her responsibilities to her family. To acheive this, she has but one wish: to improve her business. Dynamic and sincere, she has managed numerous loans with a prompt attitude toward repayment.

Ms. A. is asking for a loan of $700 in order to increase her rice stocks and satisfy her ever-growing clientele. The receipt of this loan will be very beneficial to her in that she will be able to increase her income and achieve true financial independence.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de 2 enfants, Madame A. Ayéwa exerce comme activité la vente du riz en détail dans sa localité. Son mari, un mécanicien à deux roues n’arrive pas à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille car n’ayant pas d’atelier. La plupart des dépenses de la famille sont à la charge de Madame A. Ayéwa. Elle se sent donc obligée de redoubler d’ardeur pour être à la hauteur de ses responsabilités familiales. Pour cela, elle n’a qu’un seul désir : améliorer son commerce. Dynamique et sincère, elle a eu à gérer plusieurs crédits avec une attitude prompte dans les remboursements.

Madame A. sollicite un crédit de $700 en vue d’augmenter son stock de riz et satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse. L’octroi de ce crédit lui sera très bénéfique en ce sens qu’elle augmentera son revenu pour une véritable autonomie financière.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of rice

loans.name: Zaila

texts.en:
Zaila lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She is married and has two sons. Zaila is a food vendor. She operate this business in a rented premise in a busy industrial area. Most of her customers are industrial workers. She has four years in this business.

She wants to improve her business by adding dining tables and chairs, food serving dishes and stock of cold drinks. She also in need of a cupboard for keeping food serving dishes hygienically. During working hours her business is normally crowded with customers. Sometimes she looses customers due to her limited facilities. To facilitate her plan Zaila needs USD 750.

loans.use: Buy equipment and furniture for restaurant

loans.name: Marleny

texts.en:
My name is Marleny P. and I am committed to the sale of shoes for women, men, and children. I have had my business for three years and I have the assistance of my husband for the sales of my products. My clients are very good since they know I sell good quality shoes. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to have a better variety and with the earnings I obtain I would be able to remodel my business and feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer, Laura Kirkvold.

Mi nombre es Marleny P. me dedico a la venta de zapatos para dama, caballero y niños tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para la venta de mi producto, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que vendo buena calidad en mis zapatos, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios para tener una mayor variedad y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio y alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: purchase of shoes for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Born in 1973, Samuel N. has suffered from ill health that resulted from a car accident he had and also from emotional stress after the death of his sister and brother. His parents are unemployed, as is an elder brother, so he has the heavy responsibility of providing basic needs for them as well as younger brothers and sisters. He became a member of GHAPE in 1999 and before receiving his first loan he was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since 1999, he has been able to invest and repay loans up to $1000 with which he raised money to pay school fees and apprentice fees for his siblings.

Given a loan of $1200, he plans to buy piglets to fatten and sell, raise poultry and cultivate yams. With this, he will raise money to increase his business. He plans to pay the loan in 24 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Samuel would like to purchase piglets, pig feed and yam sets.

loans.name: Cefesina Niese

texts.en:
Cefesina, 23 years old, owns a little grocery store (colmado) which she started two years ago. She’s living with her 3-year-old daughter and had been separated from her daughter’s father. Bread, juice, tomato paste, peas, spices are some of the foodstuffs that are sold in her grocery store.

Cefesina needs a loan to remodel her ‘colmado’. She plans to buy lumber and sheet iron and pay a craftsman to do the job. She will also use some of the money to buy more products like flour, sugar and other foodstuffs that people in the community frequently need.

loans.use: To buy lumber, sheet iron and other articles to remodel and stock her little grocery store

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor Hugo is a young, single man that lives with his mother. He works as a taxi driver in Ciudad de La Paz - El Alto, which serves as his primary source of income to support his mother. He lives in the Cotahuma area in Ciudad de La Paz. The loan will be used for the maintenance of his taxi which is his tool for work and the primary source of income. This is the first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him to be granted the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Víctor Hugo, joven soltero que vive con su madre, trabaja de chofer de taxi de servicio publico Inter ciudad La Paz – El Alto, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que mantiene a su madre. Vive en la zona Cotahuma de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo que es su herramienta de trabajo y principal fuente de ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase motor for taxi.

loans.name: Saidmakhmad

texts.en: Saidmakhmad K. lives in Mastchokh. He is an active client of MicroInvest since 2004, and the loan sums are permanently increased. This shows business stability and income increase. He describes himself as a serious and experienced client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. He is engaged in the commercial services and trade. He works in the bazaar, where his shop sells perfume. Saidmakhmad K. has a broad assortment (men's and women's spirits, cosmetics, lotions and creams, etc.) that allows him to work with clients of a different income level. Mr. K. requires a loan of 2500 STJ, to widen the existing assortment and to develop the business he is engaged in.

loans.use: To widen the existing assortment and to develop the business

loans.name: Kasokoso A(V) Group

texts.en:
Joanita, Judith, Florence and Annet all have brick laying businesses. Joanita is 42 years old and married with six children.Sharifu has a retail shop and wants to use the loan to purchase more stock.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel Z. lives in his own home in the Llojeta hillside area, west of the city of La Paz with his wife, Mrs. Florencia Blanco and his two sons. Miguel works as a barber in the Grand Poder area of the city and his wife knits for a living in the "Mother's Center". The loan will be used to pay part of the total cost of a plot of land Mr. Z. acquired in Llojeta, in the city of La Paz. This is the first time that he's applying for a loan and he was approved for the loan because the credit analysis performed came back favorable.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Miguel Z. vive en casa propia en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa, la señora Florencia Blanco y sus dos hijos. Miguel trabaja como peluquero en la zona Gran Poder de nuestra ciudad y su esposa realiza tejidos en un centro de madres de su zona. El crédito solicitado será destinado al pago de parte de costo total de un terreno que el señor Z. esta adquiriendo en la zona de Llojeta, en la ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land in the city of La Paz.  (Compra de un terreno en la ciudad de La Paz.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chairs and tables for his restaurant, to rent and paint a small stall in the sector for food sales, and to purchase agricultural supplies for a winter crop.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha M.’ business is run from her home, being that it is a cabinetmaking workshop situated in its ample yard where she is visited by the sector’s clients. She is a married woman with four children to maintain.

The necessity that Mrs. M. is facing today is the urgency to purchase wooden boards so that she may carry out the cabinet orders for her business. To obtain these boards, she has turned to Ceprodel hoping to receive a loan that will allow her to finish her work. With the financial assistance given to this lady, her four small children will also benefit since they depend on her and her work.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de la dama Martha M. se lleva a cabo en su casa de habitación siendo un taller de ebanistería que se ubica en su amplio patio de la casa donde es visitada por los clientes del sector. Ella es una dama casada y con cuatro hijos que mantener.

La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa la señora M. es la urgencia de la compra de la madera en tablas el cual le permite realizar sus trabajos de ebanistería en su negocio. Para lograr adquirir esta madera, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando que le sea otorgado el crédito que le permita adquirir la madera para la elaboración de su trabajo. Con la ayuda brindada a esta dama también se benefician sus cuatro pequeños hijos ya que dependen de ella.

loans.use: Purchase wooden boards for her cabinetmaking business.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet belongs to the “Renacer” Comunal Bank.

Yanet is a single mother, she is 24 years old, and has a very young daughter. She studied for a technical degree in computation. Yanet sells soft drinks of different brands and sizes at her father’s restaurant, which has at its specialty barbequed chicken.

Yanet needs a loan of 1500.00 soles, which she will invest in buying a variety of soft drinks. Part of the loan will be for making improvements to her house.

Yanet’s dreams are to expand her business and to provide the best for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Yanet pertenece al Banco Comunal Renacer.

Yanet es madre soltera, tiene 24 años y 1 hija muy pequeña, estudió una carrera técnica de computación, Yanet se dedica a la venta de gaseosas de diferentes marcas y tamaños, las ventas lo realiza en el restaurante de su papa que tiene como especialidad los Pollos a la Braza.

Yanet necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas variadas y parte del préstamo será para hacer mejoras en su casa.

Los sueños de Yanet son ampliar su negocio y brindar lo mejor a su hija.

loans.use: She will use her loan of 1,500.00 soles to buy a variety of soft drinks and also to make some improvements to her house

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. is a 32-year-old married woman with 5 children. Additionally, she is hard-working and extremely committed to her job.

She has a stall from which she sells produce and other food-related items such as tomatoes, smoked fish, charcoal, onions, and so much more. In fact, she has owned and operated this business for 5 years yet there is no urgency to change the business in any meaningful way. Instead, she is seeking a loan in order to restock her business' supplies and to expand the business further.

Her dream is for her family to own a house rather than rent a house (as they do now). She is a devoted member of the Kamu kamu women’s group in Lugazi.

loans.use: To restock her food market stall with additional produce and food-related items.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr:
Mr. Joseph B. was born in Akpro-Missérété, in the county of l'Ouémé, in the southwest of Benin. He is 38 years old. He is married and the father of four children, who are all in school and in his care. A teacher by profession, he also has a shop in which he markets spare parts for four-stroke motorbikes called “Djènannan”, in comparison to a rare pearl. His shop is situated in the Akpakpa-Dodomè district, and its location enables him to realize considerable sales figures each day. Joseph B. is on his third loan and always honors the due-dates of the payments associated with his loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur B. Joseph est né à Akpro-Missérété dans le département de l'Ouémé au sud ouest du Bénin. Il est âgé de 38 ans. B. Joseph est marié et père de 4 enfants tous scolarisés dont il a la charge. Instituteur de profession, il possède également une boutique dans laquelle il commercialise les pièces de rechanges de moto quatre temps appelées "Djènannan" en comparaison à une perle rare. Sa boutique est située au quartier Akpakpa-Dodomè. La situation géographique de sa boutique lui permet de réaliser un chiffre d'affaire journalier considérable. B. Joseph est à son troisième crédit et a toujours bien respecté les échéanciers de remboursement liés à son crédit.

loans.use: Tp buy spare parts for four-stroke motorbikes

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is an unsalaried baker and it is the only job with which he supports his three children. He is divorced and his house is located in the Villa Ingenio zone of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy construction material (tiles, stucco and cement). He plans to finish building his kitchen and put a roof his house so that the rains do not inconvenience him. This is his first loan with Kiva and our evaluation revealed positive results, which is why he can access the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Antonio es un panadero asalariado, es el único trabajo con el que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos. Es divorciado y su casa esta ubicada en la zona de Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito será usado para comprar material de construcción (tejas, estuco y cemento), él planea terminar de construir su cocina y techar su casa para que las lluvias no lo incomoden. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, nuestra evaluación reveló resultados positivos y por eso puede acceder al préstamo.

loans.use: Home Repairs

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith  tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos.  Se dedica a la venta de diversos productos de decoración, lo que realiza en su domicilio  durante una parte del día, este negocio lo inició hace unos meses, desea consolidarlo, puesto que esta actividad es lo más le agrada, y a la vez brindar los mejores productos a sus clientes.Por el contrario, lo difícil, es ambientar su local para que sea más acogedor para las personas y decorar su propio local para hacerlo más llamativo.
Judith basa su esfuerzo en sus dos menores hijos quienes son su mayor adoración. 
Ahora iniciará una sociedad con su hermana, para mejorar el local y consolidarlo como el mejor de su ciudad, para ello, tendrá que invertir mayor cantidad de capital, por lo que solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
Judith is 37 years old; she lives with her husband and 2 children. She sells various decoration products from home during part of the day. She started this business several months ago and would like to strengthen it because she loves her job and would like to offer better products to her clients. On the other hand, it is hard because she has to redecorate her shop to make it more attractive. Judith's efforts are inspired by her two youngest children whom she loves. She will now form a partnership with her sister in order to improve her shop and make it the best in her city. For this, she will have to invest more money, which is why she asks for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her business and redecorate her shop

loans.name: Khafiza

texts.en:
S. Khafiza was born in 1968 in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Mrs. S. Khafiza first applied for a loan in 2008, and has shown herself to be a serious and reliable client. She started the business practically from scratch but thanks to the previous loan she gained a wider assortment of children's wear.

Mrs. S. Khafiza is also the manager of kindergarten. She also has a livestock business. Now she applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 2600 STJ for 3 months for importing new seasonal wear. In the future she wants to open a specialized trade outlet for selling children's wear.

loans.use: importing new seasonal wear.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver U. is 30 years old and is single. He sells furniture materials at Eharkpen Street in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria.  Oliver opens his shop at 8am and closes by 7pm daily. He has one sales boy who assists him with sales in his shop. Oliver loves his business and is determined to excel in it. Oliver needs the loan amount of N70,000 (US$600) to purchase more furniture materials to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture materials to sell

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu A. is a 36-year-old married woman. She and her husband have four children, three of whom are currently in school while the oldest child is married and lives with her husband. She sells porridge in her neighborhood, and she explains that porridge is a very popular breakfast food enjoyed by nearly all Ghanians. More specifically, porridge is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, and is boiled and taken with sugar, milk, and bread; or, porridge could be taken with what Ghanians call Kose, which is prepared from milled beans and is fried with cooking oil for approximately 20 minutes so it can be served with the porridge.

Fortunately, Zenabu has developed a large and loyal customer base, so she is now seeking a loan to increase her porridge production by buying more raw materials such as bags of maize, millet, beans, sugar, and milk. She also would use a portion of the loan proceeds to increase her lingerie sales. In turn, she hopes to generate sufficient income to support her kids in school.

Notably, she is a member of group known as the "Abrabopa" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay his or her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She notes that she does not work during days when her group meets, and that her picture was taken at one of the group meetings.

loans.use: To increase her business' porridge production by purchasing additional raw materials (e.g., maize, millet, sugar, and milk)

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina H. D. C. forma parte del Banco Comunal “mujeres del futuro” D. la provincia D. Huaraz.

Alejandrina tiene 61 años y cuatro hijos con su esposo, ella comenta que no ha tenido muchos problemas en su vida personal siempre las ha podido enfrentar, aunque ya no tiene a ninguno D. sus hijos junto a ella se siente acompañada cuando sus hijos D. tiempo en tiempo llegan a visitarla, Alejandrina se dedica a la venta D. verduras en un puesto ambulatorio en el pasaje San Cristóbal D. la ciudad D. Huaraz, ella comenta que ha crecido regularmente porque recuerda que empezó en este negocio con menos D. 10.00 y en la actualidad ella invierte diariamente más D. 40.00, en los productos que compra D. los vendedores mayoristas que traen desD. la zona costa y desD. el  callejón D. Huaylas, alejandrina comenta que se siente tranquila y que las utilidades que obtiene son suficientes para ella y para el apoyo a su esposo.
  
Con este préstamo D. s/.500.00, que pagará en cuatro cuotas invertirá en la compra D. cebollas, tomates y zanahorias.
 
Alejandrina desea recibir capacitaciones para mejorar su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
Alejandrina H. D. C. is a member of the “Mujeres del Futuro” (Women of the Future) microfinance institute in the Huaraz province.

Alejandrina is 61 years old and has 4 children with her husband. She states that she has not had many problems in her personal life because she has always been able to face them. Even though none of her children live with her, she does not feel alone because they visit her from time to time. Alejandrina sells vegetables in a cart on San Cristóbal road in the city of Huaraz. She states that her business has steadily grown. She remembers that she stated the business with less than 10.00 PEN and she now invests 40.00 PEN a day purchasing products from the wholesalers who bring their goods from the coastal area and from the Huaylas alley. Alejandrina says that she feels at ease and that the profits she earns are enough for her and to help out her husband.

With this 500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in four monthly installments, she will purchase onions, tomatoes and carrots.

Alejandrina wishes to receive training to improve both her business and personal life.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables (onions, tomatoes, etc.)

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Mrs. Carmelita E., 57 years old, married & a resident of Olingan, Dipolog City. Their source of income is sari-sari store. Her husband is a carpenter. Fortunately, Mrs. E. has managed the business so well that it has expanded with just a  start-up capital of Php 10,000. Mrs. E. heard of Paglaum Cooperative and became interested on the benefits given to its members, like savings, insurances, dividends and the like. She decided to join the cooperative last August 2007, and already availed loan for 2 times already. Now, she is applying for a loan of  PhP7,000 to buy additional soft drinks and canned goods for sale. In the future, she wants to see her child finish his school.

loans.use: to buy softdrinks & canned goods for sale

loans.name: Adriana Marcela

texts.es:
Adriana inició el negocio para sentirse útil, ya que después de que se caso y dejo de trabajar necesitaba realizar alguna actividad y empezó a invertir el dinero que ahorraba en el negocio que tenía de taxis para invertir en la joyería y no tener que depender completamente de su esposo. Comenzó el negocio en Abril de 2006 por invitación de una de sus amigas a la cual también habían invitado a vender joyería de plata por lo que decido invertir sus ahorros y fue como empezó a vender entres sus amistades, vecinos y familiares, desde que empezó le ha ido muy bien y en la actualidad ya tiene un buen número de clientes y  ha ganado premios por seruna de las vendedoras “estrella” en su grupo de trabajo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $3,000 que pagara en 6 catorcenas para comprar más artículos de joyería de plata para tener un mejor surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes aprovechando que se acerca el 14 de Febrero ya que en esa fecha a la gente le gusta regalar cosas
texts.en:
Adriana started her business to feel purposeful. After she married and stopped working she needed to start some kind of work and so she invested money that she saved from the taxi business she once had to invest in a jewlery store and not have to depend completely on her husband. She started out in April 2006 through an invitation from a friend who had also been invited to sell silver jewlery. She decided to invest her savings and started selling to her friends, neighbours and family, and since she started it has gone very well for her. Currentlly she has a good number of clients and she has won recognition as being one fo the "star" salespeople in her work group.

She requires a loan of $3000 MXN, which will be repaid in 6 biweeklly payments, to purchase more silver jewlery items, to have better selection to offer her clients, taking into account that February 14 is fast approaching. In this season people enjoy giving gifts.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Johny

texts.en:
Johny C. raises pigs. He is 41 years old and has 2 children. He loves pigs and thinks that it is a very profitable business. His wife, Lorna C. helps manage their pig business. Together, they worked hard to provide their children with a good future. Aside from pigs, she also has a sari-sari store. She earns additional income from selling various goods in their village. People come to his store to buy their needs. With the profits from these businesses they feed, clothe and educate their family.

Johny is requesting a CEVI loan of Php 6,000. He will use the loan to buy piglets. Some of the loan also will be used to buy feed for his pigs. This loan will help him expand his business. 

CEVI has helped Johny get started with his business. He is provided with the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage that CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and resell

loans.name: Leana Teresa

texts.es: Leana Teresa R. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es soletar, Doña Leana tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian y trabajan. La ubicación del negocio de Doña Leana es de manera ambulante ya que recorre las calles para ofrecer sus productos. La actividad económica de Doña Leana es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que tiene de poseer este negocio, ya que surgió por que a Doña Leana es una mujer que le gusta trabajar fuertemente y es así como decide vender estos productos. Los propósitos de Doña Leana son de invertir en suficientes productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para aplicarlo al capital de trabajo y así efectuar la compra de golosinas, pan, gaseosa y jugos. Los sueños de Doña Leana son de establecer una pulpería en su vivienda ya que la posee actualmente es de manera ambulante y es así como asiste a los diferentes colegios. La cantidad que solicita es de C$7.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Leana Teresa R. is 36 years old, single, and has two children who both study and work. The location of Leana’s business is mobile by means of walking as she covers the streets in order to offer her products for sale. Leana’s business operation is a store which she has had for more than 4 years. It came about because Leana is a woman who enjoys working hard, and therefore she decided to sell these products. Leana’s intentions are to invest in sufficient products in order to satisfy the demands of her customers.

The financing that she asks for is for working capital to purchase candy, bread, sodas, and juices. Leana dreams of establishing a store in her home as her current business is mobile which is how she attends to the different schools. The amount she is asking for is 7000 NIO.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lu Thi

texts.en:
Hoà Lưu (640991087) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, Hoà owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Hoà has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $170) a month from these activities.

In 1999, Hoà joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hoà has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Hoà is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. The loan will be the 9th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. Hoà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: For livestock feed and supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Vanna Phat Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Village Bank, which consists of thirteen members, is located in Trapeang Trayueng village in Takeo province. The members plan to use the loan they obtain for different purposes. Mrs. Vanna P. is the Village Bank president, and was selected by the members. She is a weaver. Since her work is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more weaving supplies. Her husband, Mr. Meas Hoeun, is a security guard. Mrs. Vanna P. is a 27-year-old mother of a child who is too young to work or stuD.. Mrs. Diyana P. does not come to take a loan but her husband does, so he is presented in the picture instead.

One member in this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Purchasing more weaving supplies.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Virgen de los Angeles Village Bank, which meets each month in the town of Huayllacocha, where she lives. Sabina is forty-one years old and is married with four children. Three of her children are adults and live independently, while her youngest daughter is nine years old and lives with her. All three of her adult children are in college or have graduated from college: one studied education and teaches in Lima, another is studying accounting in Cusco, and her third child is currently living in Cuba and studying medicine. 

Sabina and her husband have a farm where they grow potatoes, barley, corn, peas and broad beans (“habas”). They also have two cows and twelve pigs on the farm. Sabina is requesting a loan which she will send to her son in Cuba to help pay for his educational and living expenses. She plans to repay the loan with the money she earns from selling her animals. 

Sabina’s goal for the future is for all four of her children to graduate from college; then she wants to rest. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time. Sabina is grateful for the loans offered by Asociacion Arariwa, since it is the only financial institution that offers services in her town.

loans.use: Pay for son's medical school

loans.name: Komlanvi

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur  a ouvert sa boutique qu’il a appelé « MIR TELECOM », dans sa boutique il vend des antennes, des appareils électroniques et câbles et divers accessoires électroniques. Son stock de marchandises est épuisé, il sollicite un  premier crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec des câbles électriques, antennes et divers appareils et accessoires électroniques.
Etant célibataire, c’est avec le revenu de ses activités qu’il subvient à ses propres
texts.en:
Komlanvi A. opened a shop called "Mir Telecom" where he sells antennas, electronic devices, wires and other electronic accessories. He is running out of stock and is requesting his first loan to replenish his supply of these items. Since he is single, he runs the business on his own, and this support will help him continue to operate and earn income.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase elecrical wires, electronic devices and antennas

loans.name: Sangeeta

texts.en:
Sangeeta T. is a vegetable farmer and owns her own small plot of land adjacent to her house.

Sangeeta is applying for a loan of Rs. 10,000 to buy vegetable seedlings so she can plant more vegetables in time for the harvest. Because it is monsoon season in Nepal right now, it is the best time for planting.

Sangeeta has two sons, both of whom are still too young to attend school. Sangeeta’s husband works as a taxi driver in the city and is often away for several nights at a time with work. To help her on the farm when it gets busy, Sangeeta will employ one or two workers for a few hours each day.

With the profit from selling vegetables, Sangeeta hopes to be able to buy some livestock including a buffalo and a few goats. Sangeeta would also like to earn enough money from her vegetable farm so that she can provide her sons with a good education when they are ready to go to school.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seedlings

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 24 years old. She is married and is the mother of one child who is a boy. Her child attends school in the community where she lives with her husband.

Ruth is a trader and sells vegetables like cabbages, tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc. in the main community market. She sells her goods on her table. She always works hard to meet her target and, through that, she has acquired lots of marketing and selling experience.

Ruth buys her goods from the surrounding villages and retails them to her customers. She is requesting the loan to buy lots of cabbages, carrots, tomatoes, onions, etc. With the loan she wants to buy in bulk to avoid a vegetable shortage.

loans.use: To buy vegetables like cabbages, tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn J. is from the village of Waterfall Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Evelyn is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from HSPFI. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 24000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Evelyn's 9th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Pat

texts.en: Pat P. was born in 1959; he is a married man and blessed with four children. Two of them are married and others are single and work in construction. He is currently a domestic fisherman, while his wife's name is Kim Bath, 56, and she has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable for family, Pat P. would like a loan of US$ 300 in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest price. Note: Pat P.'s wife appears in the photo above.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Pabeyar Ii Group

texts.es: El grupo de Panyebar II Han Acudido en la ASOCIACION DE ASDIR para solicitar ayuda para incrementar sus capitales ya que ellas han trabajado unos 5 años con anterioridad,y las ventas lo realizan en otros lugares; Ellas quieren reforzar sus ventas ya que la competencia es demasiada alta y ellas quieren ser conpetitivas para sobre salir y asi mantener a sus familias y quieren sacar a sus hijos avantes en los estudios ya que en esa zona son M. pobres, y el trabajo del hombre es M. escasos por esa razon ellas qluchan para mantener a su familia.

loans.use: Aplicacion de capital

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es: Martha Alicia M. de 52 años de edad reside en El Congo el departamento de San Ana. Marta vive con sus dos hijos mayores de edad quienes son el orgullo de esta madre que los ha sacado adelante. Marta tiene una panadería ubicada en su casa la cual es administrada por ella, el pan que Marta elabora es de manera artesanal y comercializa a diferentes puntos de Santa Ana, el deseo de Marta es seguir expandiendo su negocio y es por eso que solicita de un crédito que le dé la oportunidad de crecer su producción de pan.

loans.use: Comprar insumos

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen S., 68, is married with four children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of meatballs, earning  an income of approximately US$3 per day as a primary source of income for her family. The family also is assisted by three of her children, who are currently employed at a local garment factory. They are able to earn a reasonable income to make a living and to help cover their mother’s household expenses. 

The members of S.’s family are seeking to improve their standard of living and to expand their current business. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US$200 to purchase more meatballs. By doing so, S. hopes that her business will go well so that she is able to generate extra income for  future household use.

loans.use: To buy more meatballs

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Vending vegetables is the business of Carmelita G.. She is married to Arcenio G. and they are blessed with three children: Melicio, 26 years old, who is a college undergraduate; Rolando, 23 years old; and the youngest is Marieta, 21 years old, who is a college graduate.

Carmelita would like to buy additional kinds of vegetables so that she could also generate a bigger income.  But the income she generates is not enough to purchase more vegetables, so that’s why she is requesting a loan amount of Php 5,000 from Kiva lenders allowing her to buy more vegetables. She hopes that lenders will approve her requested loan as it is a big help for the productivity of her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for business improvement

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en: Carmencita N. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 57 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Carmencita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Carmencita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Carmencita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en: Graciela M. is from the village of Libag Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Graciela owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP whenever she sells her raised animals. In 2009, Graciela joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Graciela plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda Q. is from the village of Tubod. She is 62 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Erlinda owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 14th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Maribell

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Maribell tiene 30 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos: Justo tiene 12 años y Andree tiene 1 año. La socia Maribell vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades en la casa como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para sus hijos y su esposo y también limpia la casa. La socia después de hacer sus actividades de la casa lleva comida al mercado modelo de Calca. Ya son 4 años que se dedica a la venta de comida y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, carne y verduras para preparar más platos de comida.  
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maribell is 30 years old, married, and has two children: Justo (12 years) and Andree (1 year). She lives in the city of Calca, in the department of Cusco, and is a member of the Arariwa Association’s Mamacha Asunta Community Bank.
