Maribell is a hardworking mother and businesswoman who gets up very early each morning to begin her daily activities such as preparing breakfast for her children and husband, and cleaning the house. After doing these chores, she takes food to the Modelo Market in Calca. She’s been selling food there for four years and has done very well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to buy items such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, meat and vegetables for more meals. Maribell is grateful for this opportunity to get a loan, and promises to pay back the money according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy meal ingredients

loans.name: Guapay Group

texts.es: El grupo “Guapay” esta representado por la señora Roxana y conformado por 20 miembros que van cursando juntos ya un segundo ciclo todos los miembros del grupo son madres y padres D. familia por lo que sus hijos son su principal preocupación en especial lo concerniente a su educación y su futuro, muchos D. los socios tienen no solo un trabajo para cubrir las necesidades D. sus hijos ya que también están las muchas obligaciones con proveedores o bancos es por esta razón que requieren D. un préstamo que pueda ayudarles en sus capital D. trabajo para la compra D. insumos, mercadería, materiales y herramientas que ayuden a mejorar sus productos terminados y mejoren sus negocios para tener mayores ganancias que se traducirán en una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias.  La mayoría D. las socias se dedican al comercio como la venta D. comida, pan , cosméticos y al servicio D. empleos domésticos, entre los varones se dedican a la agricultura D. verduras, al servicio D. transporte público, servicio D. portería, jardinería y albañilería, por ejemplo la presidenta es mesera D. un restaurante y en su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos por catálogo para poder dedicarse a su pequeño niño que es la razón D. su esfuerzo ella vive con sus padres que le ayudan en el pago D. los servicios pero lo que mas desea es poder independizarse y comprarse un lote para poder tener una casita mas cómoda y llevarse a sus papas con ella.  La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero las socias saben como salir adelante. Los socios van cursando ya un segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. salir adelante con trabajo y esfuerzo para poder mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The Guapay group is represented by Roxana and composed of 20 members who are in their second loan cycle. All the members of the group are mothers and fathers whose children are their principal preoccupation, especially with regards to their educations and futures. Many of the partners have more than one job to cover their children's needs as well as many obligations to suppliers and banks. For this reason, they need a loan that will help them get working capital to buy inputs, merchandise, materials, and tools that will help them improve their final products and businesses so that they can make money, which would translate into a better quality of life for their families. The majority of the female partners work selling food, bread, or cosmetics or work as domestic employees. The male partners work in agriculture, public transportation, caretaking for houses, gardening, or construction. For example, the president of the group is a waitress in a restaurant and uses her free time to selling cosmetics from a catalog so that she can dedicate herself to her little boy, who is her reason for living. She lives together with her parents who help her pay basic costs, but what she wants more than anything is to be independent. She wants to buy a a lot so she can have a more comfortable house, where her parents can also live with her. The competition among small businesses is high, but the group's partners know how to get ahead. The partners are now in their second loan cycle, which demonstrates their responsibility, honesty, and ability to get ahead with hard work and effort so that they can improve the quality of life for them and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ka-La-Mayre Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are members of the Ka-La-Mayre group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. The leader of the group is Jatu S..  She has been a businesswoman for 3 years now. Jatu sells firewood and local produce like palm oil, groundnuts, rice, etc.  She is 30 years of age. Her husband is a businessman. Jatu has 2 children, all of whom are in primary schools. She was born in Sanda. Jatu will use this loan to purchase firewood, and local produce.

The members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Makump village. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva Lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profits and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase firewood, palm oil, and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk

loans.name: Paz

texts.en: Paz B.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 39 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin province. Paz has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Paz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Paz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Paz decided to request a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en: Kosar, wife of M. S., lives in a mid-size city named Vehari in Pakistan. She is an active lady. She stays at home and does household work and helps her husband by taking care of his animals. Basically, her husband, whose name is M. S., is involved in an animal selling business. He raises goats and sells them to butcher shops and earns profit. Presently, they have three goats that they take care of. Kosar is applying for a loan to buy more goats to expand her husband's animal selling business.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly tiene 31 años D. edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores D. edad, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Quemazón, una zona rural ubicada en el distrito D. Mórrope, D. la provincia D. Lambayeque, a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace doce años a la crianza D. animales en su domicilio, actualmente ella cría ganado vacuno, ovino y caprino en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior D. su vivienda. Ella cría sus animales y cuando ya están completamente desarrollados los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona con frecuencia. Esta actividad le brinda D. ingresos para apoyar al sostenimiento D. su familia ya que las ganancias que su esposo percibe como agricultor no son suficientes para salir adelante.

Adicionalmente ella también ha instalado una pequeña bodega en su vivienda hace cuatro años, el negocio fue instalado gracias a algunos ahorros que tenía disponibles y poco a poco ha hecho crecer su establecimiento, estas actividades contituyen un importante ingreso extra para la economia D. su familia.

Magaly desea ampliar su negocio D. venta D. animales con la compra D. aves y alimentos para que estas se desarrollen adecuadamente, asimismo desea ampliar su bodega con la compra D. algunos artículos, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Magaly es una mujer trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarles una buena calidad D. vida. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
31-year old Magaly is married and has two children. She and her family live in the village of Quemazón, a rural area located in Mórrope district, Lambayeque province, an hour from the town of Chiclayo. For the last ten years Magaly has raised animals in her home. At the moment she is raising cattle, sheep, and goats in an area located in the back of her house. Once the animals are grown, she sells them to the businessmen who frequently visit the neighbourhood. This work brings in income to help support the family as her husband's wages as a farmer aren't sufficient for them to get ahead. Magdaly has also run a small grocery store from her home for the last four years. She started it with some available savings and gradually expanded the business which provides important additional income for the family. Magdaly wishes to expand the animal-raising siD. of her work by buying poultry and feed so that the birds develop properly. She also wants to expand her grocery store by buying additional items. As a result she approached Edpyme Alternativa and asked for a loan of 1500 soles to help her achieve her objective. She is a hardworking woman and devoted to her family. Her greatest wish is to be able to proviD. them with a good quality of life. She has already had a loan with our institution and immediately demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with the repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Joveta

texts.en: Joveta S., 46 years old, is a rice grower. She has a small rice field, which she has maintained for many years now, to ensure a supply of food for their family. Currently, she is happy with her business status. It’s gaining and improving every year. Now she needs a small amount of money to buy farm supplies and fertilizers. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 10,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She chose CEVI because it provides not just loans but insurance coverage as well to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em S., 45, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells fish at a local market for an income of about USD 4 per day. Her husband is a skillful fisherman, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to buy wood to build a boat for fishing. This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy wood to build a fishing boat

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida B. is from the village of Malasin. She is 60 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Zenaida owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom S. lives in Phngeas village in Takeo province and she is 24 years old. She is the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Chan Oun, is shown in the photo with her.

Mrs. Mom S. is a pig breeder who is able to earn some money to support her family. Her husband is a farmer who owns a small piece of the land he uses to cultivate rice to sell to support his family; he is a fisherman, too.

Mrs. Mom S.’s problem is that her husband’s field has infertile soil, it is far away from irrigation system, and it has a lot of insects. So, to improve production, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, gasoline, and pesticide.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas T. is from the village of Campo 1, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old and a widow with six adult children. To make a living, Felicitas owns a store selling daily-use products such as candies, biscuits, coffee, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Felicitas has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Felicitas joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Felicitas is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Felicitas from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 30 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 4 años trabaja fabricando ladrillos, es un trabajador dependiente en una empresa, asimismo comprar al por mayor ladrillos para luego venderlos a un precio más elevado a otras ciudades.  De esta manera es que puede dar seguridad económica a su familia, por otro lado su esposa lo apoya en la economía, elaborando bordados de trajes típicos de su zona. Afirma que su trabajo aunque es muy sacrificado tiene sus recompensas por que le permite tener buenas rentas para su economía, además que su trabajo es estable durante todo el año. Jesús quiere para el futuro tener su propia fábrica de ladrillos para poder disponer libremente de su tiempo. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ladrillos al por mayor y una parte en la compra de materiales que utilizará su esposa en los bordados.
texts.en:
Jesús is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and son in a rented house. He has been making bricks for 4 years. He is a reliable worker in a business, and he also buys bricks wholesale to later sell them at a higher price in other cities. In this way, he can give his family financial security. On the other hand, his wife supports him with the finances embroidering traditional clothing from the area. He states that although his job is very demanding, it has its rewards becasue it allows him to have good earnings. In addition, his work is stable all year. For the future, Jesús wants to have his own brick factory to be able to manage his own time. This is his seventh loan with MFP. He is very happy to know that he has this financial support. He has shown himself to be very responsible with his payments. He also likes being part of his community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. He thanks those people who will participate in the loan he is asking for and it will be very useful for his business' progress. With the loan that he is asking for, he will buy bricks wholesale and will use a prt to buy the materials his wife uses in her embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks wholesale

loans.name: On-Time Traders Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale-business people in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 500,000, they will each be able to add more stock to their business and make more sales and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living, send their children to school, and feed and clothe them.

Marie K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni about thirty-six years ago. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending schools.

Marie K. sells bars and packets of soap and has been running this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy soap making materials (palm-oil, caustic soda, etc.) in order to produce a large quantity of soap to sell.

loans.use: To buy more soap making materials like palm-oil, caustic soda, etc.

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Erdenebaatar B. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. His wife has a hearing problem and receives a handicapped allowance. However, she runs a small food shop in their yard and she also sews traditional clothes at her home. They have been living at their current address for three years.

Erdenebaatar started a transportation business in 2007. Since 2009 he has been operating a meat retailing business in his local town. His household's consumption depends on his business earnings only, so he has to work very hard. He purchases livestock at wholesale prices from the neighbor sub-provinces two or three times a month in order to slaughter and resell to make more profit. Since he has been operating a meat retailing business, he is able to create permanent customers and has gained much experience

Erdenebaatar is a hard working person who says "Meat trading seems to be a very profitable business. I am planning to purchase more livestock in order to resell in the coming spring at higher prices."  Erdenebaatar is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large number of livestock and sell out at retail prices.

loans.use: To purchase a large number of livestock

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is married to a driver. She is blessed with three children. She has been selling scrap metal for one year. She sells the scrap metal to industries for recycling. She is a member of Baraka Ukweli group of Faulu Kenya. She wants to take out a first loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to increase her stock of scrap metal. She hopes to provide a good education for her children. She describes herself as hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: To add stock of scrap metals

loans.name: Winnyrose

texts.en:
Winnyrose is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been farming for the last five years. Her main product is milk, which she sells locally. She also earns income from her small-scale farming of tea and a bodaboda (motorbike transport) business.

Winnyrose is 24 years old. She is married and has been blessed with three children, ages 9, 7 and 2. Two of the children attend school.

Winnyrose has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo after successfully completing her second loan. She has requested this loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a dairy cow. She says that with this loan she will be able to purchase a quality dairy cow that will increase her milk production and earn her more income. She does, however, face the challenges of an unreliable market for her milk and a lack of artificial-insemination services. In the future, she would like to buy a pure breed of dairy cow and land to plant enough dairy feeds.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ayuimbubu's Group

texts.en:
Ayuimbubu A. is the leader of the group. She is 60 years old and married. Her husband is already a pensioner. The couple has six children (4 sons and 2 daughters). All of their children are married and live separately from their parents. The family business consists of the following: cattle breeding and harvesting. By now they have managed to harvest 2 tons of barley and 2.5 tons of wheat. In order to develop family business, Aiyumbubu wants to purchase livestock animals for further fattening and increasing stock. In the future the family wants to improve their life's wealth.

Dariika S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 42 years old and married. Her husband makes his living by renting a combine and working as a tractor operator. This kind of work makes it possible to earn 10,000-20,000 soms per season. The couple has four children (3 sons and a daughter): the eldest one is a university student, the younger sons are schoolboys, the daughter goes to kindergarten. At this point the family is engaged in harvesting. In order to purchase animal livestock for business development, the family hopes to get a loan. In the future, Dariika wishes to improve her family's welfare and to increase cattle stock.

Almabubu J., 50, is married. Her family has 5 children (3 daughters and 2 sons): the eldest are married and live separately from their parents, the youngest daughter is a schoolgirl. The head of the family raises money by farming: he is harvesting and looking after cattle. They have managed to give their children an education. The loan purpose is to purchase animal livestock. In the future, Almabubu is planning to increase cattle stock. 

Asanaly U., 71, is married. He and his wife are pensioners. They brought up 5 children (a son and 4 daughters) who are all married and live separately from their parents. The main source of income comes from cultivating cereals. The family has managed to harvest 4 tons of barley. The loan purpose is to purchase animal livestock for further fattening and breeding. Asanaly, with his wife, are aiming to support their children and to improve their wealth.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: W. Robert is 35 years old with 3 kids. 15 years is the time he has been running and having an oversight role over his agricultural produce, beauty and bicycle spare parts businesses in Kayunga Town. Principally for agro produce, he has been selling mostly coffee. 150,000 shillings is what totals up as his weekly profits. These genres of business require lots of courage, sacrifice and determination. In Robert’s, case he has not short-changed himself in that regard. He also does some crop growing and animal husbandry. With this loan he wants to purchase more bags of coffee for resale.

loans.use: The purchase more bags of coffee to resell.

loans.name: Ashra's Group

texts.en:
Ashra is the mother of 2 sons. Her elder son has a business of selling animals while her younger son is 16 years old and has left school after 5th  grade. He stays at home and doesn’t work. She is married to M. A. who also involved in animal sales business. He buys animals like goats, buffalo from the animal markets at cheap rates, raises and sells them to butchers and other customers earning a good profit. 

Ashra lives with her family in a 2 room brick house in the area named Abdullah basti which is a small housing community in Depalpur. Depalpur is a small city of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living here since her marriage.  Ashra is a housewife, stays at home and does her household works but in her spare time she also helps her husband in his business by taking care of the cattle. She gives them timely food and water. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. He will invest the loan in purchasing animals to improve his sales.  He has been doing this business for over 15 years and Ashra is hopeful that this investment will be more profitable for her husband and hopes his income will double.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting.  

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ashra.

loans.use: To buy animals for an animal sales business

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita F. is from the town of Surallah. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 children aged 20, 18 and 15. Elenita owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She says she wants to improve the living conditions of her family and that's why she is working hard.

Elenita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Elenita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase additional farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tito Richard

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Tito; el tiene 43 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de filmaciones y ediciones para todo tipo de eventos matrimonios,cumpleaños,aniversarios entre otros,a la vez el socio trabaja para una empresa privada en el area de administración.   

El socio solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Tito is a member of the community bank "Unidos para el Triunfo" [United for Success], located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco. 

Tito is 43 years old, married, and has three children.  He balances his daily activities with a business filming and editing all types of events: weddings, birthdays, and anniversaries, among others.  He currently works for a private company in the area of administration.

He is asking for this loan to begin his business.

He is thankful for everyone who will make this dream possible through this loan, and he promises to make all of his payments on time.

loans.use: Start a business filming events

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Marina; ella tiene 39 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de todo tipo de grano seco como maíz, chuño entre otros, también cuenta con su propio molino haciendo que esto le facilite el trabajo , la socia lleva años trabajando en este negocio, ella trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the 'Siempre Adelante' (Always Moving Forward) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Marina is 39 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling all kinds of dried grains such as corn and 'chuño' (traditional freeze-dried potato).  She also has her own mill which makes her work easier.  She has been working in this business for years.  She works with her partner and, in this way, gets her family ahead in life.

Marina is requesting a loan to buy products for her business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy products for her business

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Mrs. Norn C., 44 years old, and her husband, Mr. Mean Miech, 46 years old, have 8 children - 5 sons and 3 daughters. The family lives along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Norn and her husband are rice farmers. They also operate a fishing business when they are not at the farm. Norn is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide and to buy a water pumping machine for her rice farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide and to buy a water pumping machine

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La Sra. María, vive en la zona del Plan 3000 en el Barrio 7 de Julio ya hace 8 años junto a su familia, ella vive en casa de sus Padres donde cuida a su bebe,  Ella tiene su negocio en la casa de sus padres, ella se dedica a la venta de salteñas que ella misma elabora todo los sábados y domingos, por día esta vendiendo entre 300 y 400 salteñas cuando tiene pedidos para cumpleaños, actualmente ella necesita del crédito para poder comprar un horno nuevo puesto que el que tiene ya se encuentra en mal estado como  se puede apreciar en la fotografía, además de comprar licuadoras para hacer jugos y vender en su casa para aprovechar que vive al frente del un colegio  y quiere poner un snack pequeño. Anteriormente ella trabajo con créditos en grupo donde demostró mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad en el crédito es una persona trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señora María has lived with her family in the Plan 3000 zone in the July 7th neighborhood for the past 8 years.  She lives with her parents so she can care for her baby.  Her business is in her parent's house where she sells salteñas [filled pastries] that she makes every Saturday and Sunday.   She sells between 300 and 400 salteñas per day when she has orders for birthdays.  

She needs a loan to buy a new oven since hers is in bad shape as one can see in this photo.  She also needs to buy blenders to make juices that she sells from her house, taking advantage of her location in front of a school. She has had previous group loans where she demonstrated how responsible and punctual she is.  She is a hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a new oven and blenders

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a 32-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating a motorcycle repair shop. She lives in Puerto Princesa City, Palawan. Jonalyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eleven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jonalyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 25,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $812, thus raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing 28,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the expansion of her business. Jonalyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for the shop

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is a resident of Samundri, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, that's famous for its agriculture industry. She has lived in an area named 463 GB with her family in a single-room brick house for over 24 years. 

She is a 52-year-old widow who lost her husband a few years ago as a result of sudden death. Her children are young and working, so she prefers to stay at home to fulfill the household responsibilities and to take care of her family.
  
She has given birth to six children: three sons and three daughters. Her eldest son is involved in an agriculture profession and works in the fields, and her second eldest is an employee in a factory. Her remaining children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her eldest son in his business. With the loan she will buy fertilizers and seeds in order to get better crops from the field.
 
She started this business four years ago, and Bilqees is confident that the loan investment will be a good help for her son to earn better profits from his work.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bilqees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for agriculture business

loans.name: Yangi

texts.en: Yangi is currently in a business of selling charcoal and peas. She is 28 years old, married to a soldier, with 5 children and 3 of them go to school. Yangi borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal and peas to sell. In the future, she hopes to build a house for rent with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal and peas to sell

loans.name: Assurance De Phaeton Group

texts.fr:
Dalusma est le coordinateur de son groupe Assurance.

Dalusma habite dans la région de Phaeton d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Dalusma a dirigé son commerce de pieces mecaniques pendant les 8 dernières années.

Dalusma voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à plus de pieces 

Des autres membres D’assurance ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires et du poisson.

Dalusma dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteurs constants a cause du chômage.

Dalusma dit que son rêve est d’agrandir son commerce pour qu’il achète un camion pour faciliter le commerce.
texts.en: Dalusma is the coordinator of his group, Assurance. Dalusma lives in the Phaeton region in Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Dalusma has been in the mechanical parts business for the last 8 years. Dalusma would like to use this loan to invest in more parts. Some other members of Assurance need a loan for businesses, including selling food products or fish. Dalusma says that his main challenge is the lack of regular customers because of unemployment. Dalusma says that his dream is to grow his business in order to be able to buy a truck to facilitate his business.

loans.use: to buy mechanical parts

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo C.:de 25 años el tiene 2 años de estar vendiendo productos de usos domesticos,como chamarras,ponchos,sabanas,el trabaja todos los dias vendiendo en la localidad donde el vive,y en otras aldeas aledanias el sta muy contento porque le a hido muy bien con su venta y ademas porque vive con sus abuelitos,el tiene que vender ambulantemente ya que no tiene un lugar especifico donde vender, solicita este prestamo para comprar productos de usos domesticos,su sueño es tener un lugar donde vender en el mercado o un local donde poder vender su producto.y asi estar bien economicamente junto con sus abuelitos.
texts.en:
Rodolfo C., 25, has been selling home products like, jackets, ponchos and sheets for two years.  He works every day selling in the location where he resides and in other adjacent villages.  He is very happy because he’s done well with his sales and also because he lives with his grandparents.  He has to sell in an itinerant fashion because he does not have a specific place in which to sell.

He is asking for this loan to buy home use products.  His dream is to have a place in the market or a locale somewhere in which to sell his products in order to be in good economic conditions together with his grandparents.

loans.use: to buy home products.

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en:
Chuluuntsetseg Z. is a 36-year-old widow who lives with her mother and only son in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her son, age ten, goes to the local secondary school.

Chuluuntsetseg operates a women's wear trading business at a rented stall at Narantuul, one of the biggest and most crowded markets in Ulaanbaatar. She started her business in 2005. It has become stable and much more profitable compared with the early years of her business. She is planning to expand and continue her business in the future. Her monthly sales presently reach 300,000 MNT.

Chuluuntsetseg is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory in order to increase her collection of clothes to sell. She is a diligent woman who says, "I want to have my own booth in the future."

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea M. (pictured here), 41, is a widow with one son and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, one is a construction worker and another one is in school. They are living along National Road two, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Sophea M. is a farmer and she also buys additional vegetables from the fellow villagers for resale. She is asking for a loan of loan of $1,200 USD to purchase a motorbike for her son, a construction worker, to drive to work. She will also use a part of the loan to fill-up the land around her house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son who is a construction worker to drive to work and also to fill-up the land around her house.

loans.name: Aliadas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Aliadas lo conforman Elena Francisca, Amada y Esther, tres mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras originarias de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Elena de 45 años quien inicio haciendo y vendiendo cajetas, frijoles cocidos, donas… etc. con las ganancias invirtió en la venta de cosméticos negocio en el que lleva 4 años.  Además ella los fines de semana pone su fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita.
Elena tiene 5 hijos pero solo la menor de 9 años está a su cargo e invertirá el crédito 

Las otras integrantes del grupo Amanda de 59 años quien vende gaseosa, pan, helado y realiza costura, y Esther de 26 años comercializa enchiladas, repocheta, fresco y sandillas.
texts.en:
The 'Las Aliadas' (Allies) group is made up of Elena Francisca, Amada and Esther, three entrepreneurial and determined women from Managua.  The group's coordinator is 45 year-old Elena who started out making and selling 'cajetas' (a traditional sweet treat), baked beans, doughnuts, etc. She invested her profits in selling cosmetics, a business she has been in for four years now.  In addition, at weekends she sets up her 'fritanga' (a restaurant that sells fried food).  Elena has five children but only her youngest, who is 9, is still in her care.

The other members of the group are 59 year-old Amanda, who sells soda, bread and iced treats, and sews, and 26 year-old Esther who sells enchiladas, repocheta (filled corn tortillas), soft drinks and watermelon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and basic grains for making fried food

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson de 28 años, es padre de familia, vive con su hijo en la casa de su padre, ubicada  en el distrito de Pomalca, a unos 15 minutos  de distancia de la Provincia de Chiclayo, la cual cuenta con los servicio de agua y luz.   La actividad de los pobladores es el cultivo de la caña y la elaboración de azúcar de caña, agricultura y ganadería.

Nelson se dedica desde hace 2 años como obrero de la empresa agroindustrial de la misma ciudad donde vive, los ingresos que persibe es para solventar los gastos diarios de  él y su hijo, a creídoconveniente pedir un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de  1200 nuevos soles para poder cubrir algunos gastos personales y poder realizar arreglos en su casa ya que son necesarios para poder estar seguros y cómodos.

Con los ingresos que persiba Nelson con sus horas extras que haga en la empresa agroindustrial para laque trabaja tratara de cubrir su crédito otorgado y como es un padre muy preocupado  porque su hijo salga adelante,va a trabajar con más ganas para poderle brindar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelson de 28 años, es padre de familia, vive con su hijo en la casa de su padre, ubicada  en el distrito de Pomalca, a unos 15 minutos  de distancia de la Provincia de Chiclayo, la cual cuenta con los servicio de agua y luz.   La actividad de los pobladores es el cultivo de la caña y la elaboración de azúcar de caña, agricultura y ganadería.

Nelson se dedica desde hace 2 años como obrero de la empresa agroindustrial de la misma ciudad donde vive, los ingresos que persibe es para solventar los gastos diarios de  él y su hijo, a creídoconveniente pedir un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de  1200 nuevos soles para poder cubrir algunos gastos personales y poder realizar arreglos en su casa ya que son necesarios para poder estar seguros y cómodos.

Con los ingresos que persiba Nelson con sus horas extras que haga en la empresa agroindustrial para laque trabaja tratara de cubrir su crédito otorgado y como es un padre muy preocupado  porque su hijo salga adelante,va a trabajar con más ganas para poderle brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Cubreir algunos gastos personales y realizar arreglos en su casa

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan, 22 years old, is a primary teacher in Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap Province. She typically makes around $62.50  in income each month to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. She has been married for several years to Mr. San, 23, a local farmer, and they are blessed with a child who is still very young. Beside her work, she always assists her husband to grow various crops on her own land. 

Due to lacking funds, Mrs. Kan decided to seek a loan to hire a plowing machine to plow her land so she can begin to plant her crop this rainy season.

loans.use: to hire a plowing machine to plow her land.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is into the production and sale of fante kenkey (foodstuff made from fermented maize dough) at Abura. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a security man. Rose has been selling kenkey for just two years. She wishes to increase her sales and so needs a loan from Kiva to buy additional bags of maize to use for the kenkey. She hopes to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to use for fante kenkey.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Santa Ana es de la Ciudad de Asunción. Cuenta actualmente con 12 integrantes, todas ellas trabajan de forma solidaria y responsable, dentro de un ambiente de cooperación. Ellas tienen un objetivo común que es el de procurarse mayores ingresos, para que de esa forma puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, no solo para ellas, sino también para sus hijos.
La Sra. Estela se dedica a la venta de hortalizas. Ella comenta que todos los días empieza su jornada a muy tempranas horas de la mañana cuando va a comprar las hortalizas que va a vender y vuelve ya cuando termina de vender sus productos. Por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido solventar todos los gastos que implica la manutención de su hogar. Sueña con algún día poder tener un pequeño local donde vender sus productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hortalizas, para que de esa forma pueda ampliar la variedad que tiene. Sabe que la ayuda de la Fundación le sera de mucha utilidad en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
The committee named “Santa Ana” is from the city of Asunción.  There are currently 12 members.  They are all supportive of one another and work responsibly in a spirit of cooperation.  All of them have a common goal of generating more income so that they can have a better life, not only for themselves, but also for their children.

Sra. Estela sells vegetables.  She says that every day her journey begins in the early morning hours when she has to go buy the vegetables that she will sell.  Through her work, she is able to cover all of the expenses related to maintaining her household.  She dreams of someday having a small shop where she can sell her products.  Estela is requesting a loan to buy vegetables so that she can expand the variety that she offers.  She knows that the assistance from Fundación Paraguaya will be a great help to her small business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 39 years old and lives in Delapaz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, with 6 children.  Juana works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more fish to sell. Juana has become a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Juana hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 45 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. One is currently in school.  

Janet has a small retail shop that she has had for four years. She owns rental houses as her second business.  
	
To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Janet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Janet hopes to expand her business.  

Janet is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program (SEP), which has helped her prospects for the future by providing her with more knowledge about business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha, 53, and a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Constantino, a driver. Editha, her husband and their children manage their own household while operating their business. Editha works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Editha oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have two jeepney units that have a capacity of 18 people who pay a boundary (daily quota) each day. Editha’s husband also drives one of their jeepneys if their driver is not available. Their regular customers are students and employees in the local community. The business collects a minimum of PHP 1,800 in boundary every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Editha is requesting a PHP 28,000 loan to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepneys. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Editha dreams of acquiring another jeep or van. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

Footnote: Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepneys

loans.name: Jhonny Agustin

texts.es:
Johnny de 41 años hace su trabajo de Ebanista con dos hermanos de 8:00 a 6:00 pm. El hace 10 años desarrolla esta actividad, hace muebles, modulares, mesas etc. Dice tener el arte en sus manos.
Es unido con Elvia que es ama de casa y tienen 5 hijos (estudiantes).

El necesita comprar materiales como madera, pintura, guaipe, lija para seguir con su labor, por ello solicita un préstamo. Desea seguir trabajando para mantener a su familia y que no les falte nada. Quiere ampliar su línea de muebles a muchos proveedores, tener su negocio dentro o más cerca de su casa y que sus hijos aprovechen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Johnny is 41 years old. He works as a cabinetmaker with his two brothers from 8:00 to 6:00 p.m. He has been doing this work for 10 years. He makes furniture, modular furniture, tables, etc. He says that he has artistic hands. 

He is in a relationship with Elvia who is a housewife and they have 5 children (students).

He needs to buy supplies such as wood, paint, rags and sandpaper to continue to work which is why he is asking for a loan. Hhe wants to continue working in order to support his family and so that they lack for nothing. He wants to expand his furniture line to many suppliers, locate his business inside or closer to his house and that his children make the most of their education.

loans.use: to buy paint and wood supplies.

loans.name: Zipora

texts.en: Zipora is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with five children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She takes care of the family with help from her husband who is a businessman and their dream is to educate their children. She has been selling maize for eighteen years and her dream is to start exporting to nearby countries. Zipora needs the loan facility to buy sacks of maize to sell.

loans.use: To buy  sacks of maize to sell.

loans.name: Tinevimbo Group

texts.en:
Blantina is 23 years old and lives in Gweru. She is single and has two children, age 6 and 2 years. The eldest attends school. She also cares for her parents.

She sells a range of items including footwear, clothing and blankets. Her main problems are the level of bureaucracy and competition. She has one employee.

Blantina will spend the money she borrows on more stock to sell in the market.

She hopes that her business will continue to help her to sustain her family and that it will grow over time.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, clothes and blankets for resale.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is a working lady who supports her family financially by doing sewing and embroidery works. She is very hard-working and knows the latest trends in fashion, that’s why she can provide good quality services to her clients and earns good profits. Her husband is a driver by profession. He provides transport services to his passengers. He is an expert in driving and his passengers trust his good driving skills. 

Nusrat has three sons and two daughters. Her sons have left their education and started doing different kind of works to financially contribute to the family and her daughters are studying in a local school. 

Nusrat is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son who is involved in making wooden ladders. With the loan, he will buy wood, nails etc in larger quantity to make ladders in larger quantity to sell to his customers and increase his profits. He has good experience in his work and has been operating it for the past five years. Nusrat is hopeful that an investment will help him grow his business further and increase his monthly income. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has established a good credit record in her previous loan and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails etc to make wooden ladders

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La señora Ernestina trabaja en su propia agencia de viajes como administradora y le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para invertir en su agencia y desea hacer reserva de boletos turísticos, pasajes aéreos y otras cosas más. A Ernestina el anterior crédito le ayudo en su negocio y sobre todo obtuvo buenas ganancias de las cuales lo utilizo para el gasto familiar.     

La señora Ernestina agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Ernestina runs her own travel agency, and it is going very well. On this occasion, she needs the loan to invest in her agency, and wishes to reserve tourist entrance tickets, airline tickets and other things. 

The previous loan helped Ernestina in her business, and especially, it helped her to make good profits, which she used for her household expenses.  

Ernestina values and is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her monthly instalments.

loans.use: To reserve tourist entrance tickets, airline tickets and other travel items for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with two children. One is enrolled in school while the other is still too young. Her husband is a taxi driver who contributes to the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child.

Margaret has operated as a food vendor for the past six years. She sells her products out of her house. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a challenge of fluctuating commodities prices in the market. She dreams of owning a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance for financial assistance to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: María Liset

texts.es:
Maria tiene 20 años de edad, esta acompañada con una hija.

Ella tiene un año de dedicarse a la venta de lociones, cremas y artículos para la belleza. Esta es la forma en que Maria le ayuda a su compañero de vida a los gastos del hogar. Antes ella elaboraba los alimentos en la escuela de su comunidad.

Los productos de belleza se los llevan a su casa, ya que son por pedidos. Luego los sale a vender a las comunidades aledañas.

Maria solicita el préstamo para invertirlo, en la compra de más productos de belleza como lociones, cremas, entre otros. Debido a que en la época de navidad vende a mejores precios y esto le ayudaría a obtener mejores ingresos. Ya que los productos que ofrece son bastante vendidos y así ella podrá tener mejore ofertas. Maria manifiesta que de los ingresos que reciba ahorrara,  para construir su casa de adobe ya que la que tiene es de bahareque, así mismo le proporcionara una mejor calidad de vida a su hija y le dará el estudio. De igual manera espera incrementar su negocio ya que le es rentable.
texts.en:
Maria is twenty years old and has a daughter. 

She has worked selling lotions, creams and beauty products for one year. This is how Maria helps her life partner with their household expenses. Previously, she prepared food in the school in her community. 

She takes the beauty products home because they come through orders. Later, she takes them out to sell to the surrounding communities. 

Maria is requesting the loan to invest it in purchasing more beauty products like lotions and creams, among others. During the Christmas season she sells them for better prices, which will help her to obtain a better income. As the products she offers sell sufficiently she can make better offers. Maria expresses that the income she receives she will save to construct her house out of adobe, as the one she has now is made from cane and mud. This will provide a better quality of life for her daughter and will allow her to study. Likewise, she hopes to expand her business as it is profitable.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products, like lotions and creams, among others.

loans.name: Chut

texts.en:
Chut, a 55-year-old mother of two married children, lives in Cho town where she has had a shop that sells movie tapes, dvds, and cds for the past five years. She earns a monthly income of about 5.500.000 Vietamdong (VND).

A participant in SEDA since 2007, Chut always repays her loans punctually. Having last borrowed and repaid 8.736.000 VND, she is now requesting her sixth loan for 9.632.000 VND to buy more dvds and cds to sell and appliances for her house.

loans.use: to buy more DVDs and CDs to sell and appliances for her house.

loans.name: Uvaldo

texts.es:
El sr. Uvaldo tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el caserio asacualpa y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva como ser jeans, camisetas, blusas, calsonetas y sandalias. Uvaldo es una persona trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio, hace varios años que se dedica a este tipo de actividad,  su mercancia la vende en varios  lugares  cercanos a su comundad.  Uvaldo se levanta  a las 6 de la mañana para salir a vender la ropa y las sandalias.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa y sandalias, tiene muchos pedidos para navidad y desea cumplirle a todos los clientes. 
Uvaldo es padre de 3 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando en la escuela publica de su comunidad.         
Su tiempo libre lo dedica a visitar la iglesia.
la meta de Uvaldo es graduar a sus hijos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Uvaldo is 41 years old and lives in the village of Asacualpa. He sells new clothing such as jeans, t-shirts, blouses, shorts, and sandals. Uvaldo is a hardworking individual who is dedicated to his business. He has been in this line of work for many years. His merchandise is sold in various places near his community. Uvaldo wakes up at 6am so that he can leave in order to sell clothes and sandals.

This loan will be used to buy clothing and sandals. He has many orders for Christmas and wants to keep all of his customers satisfied. Uvaldo is the father of three children who attend public school in their community. In his free time, he attends church. His goal is to see his children graduate from the university.

loans.use: to buy new clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Digna Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Digna es socia del banco comunal Pauteñitas, vive por el cantón Paute (Cuenca) lugar que es privilegiado por su clima templado, la población de Paute es una de las más laboriosas y emprendedoras, cuentan con gastronomía típica y disposición de los más atractivos platos típicos, la producción de flores, hace de este cantón un verdadero jardín, se cultiva para exportación, rosas de la más alta calidad.

Doña Digna tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y ha concebido un hijo quien es mayor de edad y vive independiente. Su esposo se dedica al comercio de ropa, la casa en la que habita es arrendada.

La Señora Digna se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cría pollos, cerdos y ganado, los fines de semana se dedica a la elaboración de sancocho y fritada (platos típicos) actividad la que realiza hace 12 años.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cerdos. 

Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Digna is a member of the Pauteñitas communal bank. 

She lives in the Paute canton (Cuenca), an area with a wonderfully mild climate. The residents of Paute are very hard-working and enterprising. The region has a traditional and delicious cuisine. Flowers, including the highest quality roses, are cultivated in this canton for export; the whole canton is like a garden.

Digna is 46, married, and has one grown and independent child. Her husband sells clothing. They live in a rented home.

Digna does the housework; raises chickens, hogs and livestock; and also makes sancocho and fritada (traditional dishes) on the weekends. She has been doing this for twelve years.

This is her second loan in the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of chickens and hogs.

Her goal is to finish her home.

loans.use: to buy chickens and hogs.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: La señora Ernestina de 49 años vive en una colonia popular de la localidad desde hace 15 años, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y ella en su domicilio instalo una área exclusiva para vender prendas de vestir usadas como lo son, blusas de dama, pantalones, sacos, camisa de caballero y ropa de niño ella vende todos los días ya que esta su principal fuente de ingres; o su esposo se encuentra trabajando en estados unidos y es muy complicado para Ernestina depender al cien porciento de los ingresos de su esposo la vida haya es más cara y cuando se termina el trabajo la Señora Ernestina tiene que esperar a que el se acomode para poder recibir un ingreso por parte de el, esta fue la principal motivación para que ella pudiera emprender su negocio  de esto ya hace cuatro años y ella requiere el apoyo para compra de mercancía de temporada como lo son: chaquetas, pantalones, sudaderas, tenis, bufandas y más variedad de productos.
texts.en: 49-year-old Ernestina has been living in a 'colonia popular' (urban poor and working-class neighborhood) for 15 years.  She is a very enterprising woman and has set up an area in her home where she sells used clothing such as ladies' blouses, pants, bags, men's shirts and children's clothing.  She sells every day as this is her main source of income.  Her husband is working in the USA and it is very complicated for Ernestina to have to depend completely on her husband's income.  Life is becoming more expensive and when Ernesta lost her job, she had to wait for her husband to get settled so that she could receive an income from him.  This was her main motivation to start her business.  She has been working in her business for four years and she needs support so that she can buy seasonal merchandise such as jackets, pants, sweatshirts, sneakers, scarves and a wider range of products.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing

loans.name: Jerida

texts.en:
Jerida lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Jerida is married and has one child. She is a tailor while her husband is a photographer. They also practice farming. They have been farming for two years now and they are currently growing vegetables, bananas and indigenous trees. 

Jerida is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and provide her with honey for medicine.

This is Jerida's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in their businesses. Jerida's hope for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Parwati

texts.en:
Parwati is a 51-year-old divorced lady living with her younger brother and children. She felt like a burden on her brother and his family, so she planned to help her brother financially and started a food production center (making different local snacks). She purchases the raw materials from the local market, prepares these with the help of her family members and packages these products. She takes orders from her customers from the local market and supplies them according to the customer's demands. Due to limited financial conditions, she is not able to meet the growing demand of the customers. She earns 2,000 INR per month from her snack business, which is not sufficient for her family. 

She has a plan to purchase more raw materials for her business so that she can take more orders from her existing customers and increase her client base to earn more income. She says that she can earn up to 4,000 INR per month after purchasing more raw materials for her business. She has requested a loan of 36,000 INR to purchase more raw materials. She wants to help her father and save some money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials for her snack business

loans.name: Lyova

texts.en:
Lyova is from Agarak town. Using his own car, Lyova has been running as taxi for many years. 
He lives with his wife, their elder son is a student and second son serves in the army. 
Lyova, besides taxi driving, also engaged in farming business. With the help of his wife, he cultivates and sells different type of crops and fruits. 
Lyova requested this loan to purchase  winter wheels, and renovate some spare parts of the car to be able to continue taxi driving and gathering income for the family. This is important to bring the car to working condition now, because it is a season for holiday sales and people travel a lot, hence creating jobs for taxi drivers like Lyova!

loans.use: to pay for winter wheels, and renovate some spare parts of the car to be able to continue taxi driving and gathering income for the family

loans.name: Rosana Amalia

texts.en:
Rossana and her family, husband and four under aged children, live in the city of Merida, Yucatan. She and her family went through some difficult times five years ago after her husband was left unemployed. This situation made Rossana think of a solution, as she needed to provide her children with the necessities, such as an education. This is how she started selling corn on the cob from her home. Soon thereafter with the help of some loans she was able to purchase a tricyle to be able to go out and sell her products, which also increased in variety. The want to provide her children with a better quality of life motivated Rossana to work very hard every day, and she has managed to reach her goal through effort and dedication.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $275, that she plans to repay in a term of 5 to 10 months. She will use this amount to purchase ingredients and materials necessary for her products, and upkeep of her tricycle. With your generosity you can help Rossana and her family. Don't wait any longer. They sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Rossana y su familia, esposo y 4 hijos menores de edad, vive en la localidad de Mérida Yucatán, ella y su familia hace cinco años atravesaron por momentos económicamente muy complicados, pues su esposo se quedo sin empleo. Esta situación llevó a Rossana a pensar en una solución, pues tenía que darles a sus hijos lo necesario, como educación. Es así como comenzó con la venta de elotes en su casa, luego con la ayuda de algunos préstamos logró comprar un triciclo para salir a vender y amplió también los productos ofrecidos. Las ganas de brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida impulsó a Rossana a trabajar muy duro cada día y ha logrado con esfuerzo y dedicación la meta propuesta

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 275 DLLS, mismos que planea regresar en un plazo de 5 a 10 meses. Ella destinará ésta cantidad para la compra de insumos necesarios para elaboración de sus productos, y para dar mantenimiento a su triciclo. Con tu generosidad puedes apoyar a Rossana y su familia, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en: My name is Alejandrina, and I sell clothing for men, women and children ages 3 and up. This business has helped me cover my family’s expenses and pay for my children’s education. Mother’s Day is coming up, and I need to stock my inventory with new merchandise to be able to offer my clients a larger variety of clothing and good prices.

loans.use: Purchase of button-down shirts, skirts, sweaters, pants, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.en:
My name is Sandra G. and I make a living selling groceries,a business which I've had for the past three years. Thank God, everything has been going very well and my sister helps me take care of clients. My goal is to increase my stock and use the income to feed my family, and be able to afford a good education for my son and nephew, both who are still in school.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Sandra G. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, actividad que me dedico hcae 3 años, gracias a dios todo me ha salido muy bien, tengo la ayuda de mi hermana para la atencion de mis clientes, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario con otra variedad de productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y pagarles un buen estudio a mi hijo y mi sobrino que estan en la escuela.

loans.use: purchasing tomato sauce, salt, sugar, rice, bread, sodas, eggs, juice, etc...

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort B. was born in 1964.  She is married and a mother of five children. She has suffered from the death of her two sisters this year.  Additionally, she has been unable to provide enough food and pay school fees for her family. Motivated by these difficulties, she became a GHAPE member and was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline.

She requests a first loan of $100 with which she plans to sell groceries. Her grocery store is situated in the residential area and will be profitable because the larger markets are far away.  She plans to raise money to pay school fees for her children and to provide balanced meals for her family.  She plans to repay the loan in 15 months.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, soap, toilet paper etc.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh, 26-years old, lives with her parents and younger brothers in the little village of Jal El Bahar, close to Tyr, South Lebanon. She is employed in a small "lingerie" shop and earns limited wages of $200 per month. Fatmeh is the main breadwinner of the family, because her father, a daily worker, does not have a regular income. This month, she will use her last year's savings to pay for her brother's school fees and stationery. But Fatmeh needs medical treatment and lacks the funds to cover this unexpected expense. She is requesting a loan for $500 to cover these medical expenses.

loans.use: To cover medical treatment expenses

loans.name: María Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria is a very hard working lady who spends most of her day as a secretary working in an office from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm, Monday through Wednesday. Aside from her hard work in this job, she also works selling dress clothing. She brings her merchanside from Lima in order to fulfill her customers' requests, which thus causes her to travel bi-weekly to the capital city to make her purchases. While she does this, her only relative, her mother, stays behind to watch over the home. Maria cares for her mother's health and well-being and for this reason Maria asks that you help her with the loan so she may increase the amount of merchandise she provides in order to fulfill her customers' needs. Please do not be indifferent to Maria's needs and let's collaborate with her and her elderly mother who requires great care and treatment.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Wendy Wise.

María, es una dama muy trabajadora que ocupa el mayor tiempo del día a su labor de secretaria en un grifo donde trabaja desde las 9:00 am. hasta las 5:00 pm. de lunes a miércoles y muy a parte de su desempeño en este trabajo vende prendas de vestir a las personas que le envían sus pedidos. Ella trae su mercadería de la ciudad de Lima para cumplir con las peticiones de sus clientes, razón por la cual viaja quincenalmente a la capital para realizar sus compras, mientras su abnegada madre cuida de su hogar y por ser su único familiar, María vela por su salud y bienestar.Por esta razón Maria, pide le ayudemos con el préstamo de una cantidad de dinero para que pueda aumentar la cantidad de sus artículos a fin de satisfacer los pedidos de las personas.No seamos indiferentes ante la necesidad de Maria y colaboremos con ella y su anciana madre quién requiere de mayores cuidados y tratamientos

loans.use: Purchase fashion garments to help her beloved mother's economic and medical situation.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long K. S., 29, is a mother of two children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She works weaving silk clothes and generally makes around $2 each day. Her husband is both a construction worker and a motor-taxi driver, making on average around $2.50 per day.

Mrs. Long K. S. hopes to use this loan to purchase weaving threads and other tools for her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving threads and other tools to assist in her business.

loans.name: Kigandazi F Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for six months. Irene has a beauty salon. Janet is a poultry farmer and wants to use the loan to buy a water tank. Agnes and Maria both sell used clothes while Margret has a canteen business.Irene wants to open up a retail shop with the extra business profits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene lives with her parents on Kiswuarani street in the Alto Tacagua area of La Paz. She is a single mother and supports her daughter. She makes dough in order to make cakes, turnovers, tarts, etc. She subleased space in a store on Alcoreza street and there she displays her products and her business is going well and her customers are asking for more items. She is asking for a loan to expand her business and increase her income. Her previous credit history qualifies her as a good client and she can have a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Kiswuarani de la zona de Alto Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es madre soltera y mantiene a su hija. La actividad que realiza es la elaboración de masitas como ser pasteles, empanadas, tortas, etc., para esto alquiló una tienda trastienda en la calle Alcoreza, en este lugar expone sus productos y le va muy bien pero le piden mas cosas. Solicita crédito para ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Expand products and business

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 39 year-old Tatu K., who is married with three children, aged 9, 12, and 16.

In 1997, Tatu established a business selling fish and traditional cloth, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish and traditional cloth.

loans.name: Yasmina Del Socorro

texts.es:
In the city of Chinandega's "municipio" of Somotillo, Yasmina has a school supply shop that, with a lot of work over the years, she's managed to stock with various items. She's the mother of two children and is responsible for providing them with the education that they deserve.

Thanks to help from Ceprodel, she's succeeded in improving her business. Now she needs to buy products such as as notebooks, pencils, binders, etc. It's for this reason that she has applied again to Ceprodel for a loan that will allow her to stock what she needs and improve the conditions of her humble business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Yasmina Torres se dedica al negocio de librería el cual con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado suplir con diferentes artículos a medida que han venido transcurriendo los años. Es madre de dos hijos y con la responsabilidad de brindarle los estudios que ellos se merecen.

Gracias al apoyo otorgado por Ceprodel ha logrado mejorar la condición de su negocio dándole lugar a la compra de sus vitrinas y sus productos en general.
