Hoy en dia su necesidad es la adquisición de los productos de librería como cuadernos, lapiceros, afiches, etc. Es por este motivo que ella acude una vez mas a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito que le permita suplir su necesidad y de esta manera mejorar la condición de su humilde negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata is a member of the Renacer Community Bank.

Fortunata is married, 30 years old, and has 2 children. She sells traditional food in the street market of Ayacucho city on Saturdays and Sundays. In addition Fortunata travels to the markets where she purchases grains and cheeses to sell in Ayacucho’s markets. She also has a car that she rents as a taxi.

Fortunata needs a loan of 1750 which will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley, corn and lamb.

Fortunata has dreams for her children to grow up to be professionals, to build a house and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.

Fortunata es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos. Fortunata vende comida en el mercadillo de comidas típicas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, los días sábados y domingos. Además Fortunata viaja a las ferias donde compra cereales, quesos y lo vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. También tiene un carro que alquila para hacer transporte de pasajeros.

Fortunata necesita un préstamo de 1750 dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada, maíz y carneros.

Los sueños de Fortunata son que sus hijos sean profesionales, construir su casa y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase wheat, barley, corn and lamb.

loans.name: Abduqahor

texts.ru:
Abduqahor R. raises livestock. He has been in this business for 20 years. He raises calves, fattens them and resells them to be slaughtered. He would like to take advantage of a loan and to purchase two calves. This will help him to increase his inventory and to earn additional profits. Abduqahor plans to pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Abduqahor is 58 years old and has 7 children. The older children help him in his work. They all live together happily.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Рузиев Абдукахор занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. Работает в этом виде бизнеса уже 20 лет. Разводит бычков . откармливает и перепродает на мясо. Вот и теперь хочет воспользоваться кредитом и купить двух бычков. Это поможет ему увеличить товарооборот. Кроме того это принесет ему дополнительную прибыль. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 12 месяцев. Абдукахору 58 лет и у него семеро детей. Старшие дети уже постарше и помогают отцу по хозяйству. Все они живут дружно и весело.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei’s family consists of his wife and four children. Nearly 2 years ago he decided to launch a small venture offering lithography and gravestone technique services--a business he says that was his calling. He was able to rent a small facility in his town which works as his shop and is easily accessible to many customers. Today, Alexei’s business yields $700 a month in income.

Alexei sees a great opportunity for business growth in the future. His expertise in this sphere of business is greatly appreciated by his customers. His desire to assist clients and his entrepreneurial spirit are part of what makes his business successful. Alexei has requested a loan for 5,000 Grivnas to broaden the assortment of equipment he uses in his work so that he will be ready for more complicated orders. He has proven to be a strong and reliable client with “Nadiya Ukraine”. We believe that this loan will be a big help to Alexei as he looks for ways to increase his business activity.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Julia Justina

texts.es:
Mrs Julia P. is a 51 year old woman living in barrio 380 in Managua. She is divorced, with a 19 year old daughter and a 7 year old son. The children's father provides support for them. She has a small store in a room in her home, which she began 7 years ago by selling ice and ice cream. She used her last loan to improve her home, and she will use this loan to improve her business. With the money that she is requesting she plans to purchase basic grains and cleaning products to stock her business and to meet the needs of her customers in the neighborhood. This is a very poor neighborhood, and people purchase their daily needs in the small stores. For this reason,Juila must keep her store stocked with products so that her customers do not lose faith in her.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Julia P. tiene 51 años de edad, habita en el barrio 3-80 de Managua, es divorciada, tiene una hija de 19 años de edad y un niño de 7 años de edad, el papá le apoya en la manutención de sus dos hijos. Tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, la cual desde hace 7 años ha venido administrando, la cual empezó con ventas de hielo y helados. El crédito anterior fue usado para mejoras de su hogar pero éste será usado en la mejora de su negocio, con el dinero solicitado comprará granos básicos y productos de limpieza para abastecer su negocio y satisfacer las demandas de sus vecinos del barrio. Este barrio es un barrio pobre, la manera de vivir de la gente es comprar en las pulperías las necesidades del día, es por eso que Julia necesita tener su pulpería llena de sus productos para así no quedar mal a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains and cleaning products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther O., a 29-year-old merchant, is married with two kids. One kid is in school. She is a very resourceful wife and mother. Esther helps her husband provide for the household through the sale of used clothing, and she also sells rice and stew with fish at Dunkwa Township where she lives around Obuasi.

Selling of used clothing is a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes are too expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, selling of used clothing has created a market for many Ghanaian women like Esther. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing, a bag of rice and vegetables, etc. to increase her inventory. She believes this loan could help her to save more for her children's education. She is member of the group called Solid Rock. Members agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing and foodstuffs such as bags of rice, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Muhiba

texts.en:
S. Muhiba describes herself as a hard-working, enterprising and happy married mother of two children. Her husband is a laborer. She decided to start a tailoring business to help him with household expenses. She wanted her children to get an education and that wasn't possible on her husband's salary alone. She started by helping a woman who ran a tailoring shop. After she learned the business well, she installed a small shop in her home. During the last 20 years, the business has gone very well and grown.

Now Muhiba is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750). She plans to use the loan to purchase modern materials so she can fulfill her customers' requests for national dresses. Muhiba and her family are very grateful for your support in helping this business grow and move ahead.

loans.use: Purchase new modern materials to sew the national dresses

loans.name: Paz Y Esperanza Group

texts.en:
This is a group of 5 women who are looking to take out another loan. Each woman has taken out a previous loan, and all the women have been very faithful in making all their payments.

Anarelis is the group representative, and she was chosen because she is an great example of a hardworking woman, who is very diligent in all her payments. She has been very successful with her previous loans. She started a small business selling food in her area, and it has grown and grown. She is a single woman who hopes to have a family someday, but wants to be able to provide for her children before she has any. She thinks this new loan will help her business grow a lot, and so she is very excited about this opportunity!

On behalf of Anarelis, the group, and Esperanza International------ Thank you for your support!

loans.use: Buying products for her food business

loans.name: Sonia Martha

texts.es:
Sonia Martha P. T. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Nicrupampa” del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Sonia Martha tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente con un hijo. Comenta que aún cuando su mayor dificultad fue recuperarse de la pérdida de su bebé cuando aún estaba embarazada, ha tenido la tranquilidad de tener a otro pequeño que ella considera su mayor éxito, así como tener una carrera profesional, pero que lamentablemente no ha podido ejercer. En la actualidad se dedica al alquiler de cuartos los cuales obtuvo por medio de la herencia de su padre en la Av. Las Flores N° 203 Nicrupampa. Habitaciones que van mejorando para incrementar el precio del alquiler. Sencuentra tranquila y con el deseo de emprender nuevos negocios.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en el mejoramiento de sus habitaciones para el alquiler de los mismos.
 
Sonia desea emprender nuevos negocios para lo cual desea capacitarse y aprender.
texts.en:
Sonia belongs to the Las Triunfadoras de Nicrupampa ["The (Women) Victors of Nicrupampa"] community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. She is 36 years old, partnered and has one son. She says that the hardest time of her life was losing a baby during a past pregnancy. She ultimately had the peace of mind to have another baby, a child she considers her greatest success. She studied for a professional career but, unfortunately, she wasn't able to work in her chosen field. She now rents rooms in a house on the Avenida Nicrupampa that she inherited from her father. She's improving the rooms so that she can increase the rent. She's pleased with what she's accomplished and hopes to start new businesses in the future.

With this S/.1,200 [1,200 Peruvian soles] loan, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will invest in improving her rooms so that she can rent them.

Sonia wants to start other businesses so she'd like to train and learn.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve rooms for room-rental business.

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy es chofer propietario de un taxi que trabaja como trufi inter-ciudad La Paz – El Alto, la esposa es comerciante de masitas que  comercializa en las ferias populares. Estas dos actividades se convierten  en sus principales fuentes de ingreso. Viven en casa de la hermana de Willy, ubicada en  la Zona Exaltación de la Ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará la reparación de su herramienta de trabajo (taxi) para poder continuar prestando servicio de transporte publico.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación socio económica realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Willy is an owner-driver of a taxi who has a route between the cities of La Paz and El Alto. His wife sells cookies at local fairs. These two activities are their main source of income. They live in Willy's sister's home, in the neighbourhood of Zona Exaltación in El Alto. The loan will be use to repair the taxi in order to continue to be able to offer public transportation services. This is his first loan with Impro; the socio-economic evaluation results qualify Willy for the loan requested.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with two kids. They live in Mukachevo. Mariya sells cosmetics and souvenirs out of a store called “Era” in downtown Mukachvo. She has been in the business for many years. Her good quality merchandise has always been in demand. Mariya’s business has been growing with remarkable stability and consistency. However, Mariya believes her business is ready for further expansion and is willing to invest effort into the growth of her venture.

Currently, Mariya has 70,000 Grivnas in turnover capital. However, she realizes that’s not the limit. That is why she is now requesting a loan of 6,000 Grivnas to help her with expansion of her trade. Mariya tries to keep her customers in mind with everything she plans and does. By thinking this way she has managed to get better products, customer support, and a larger market share. We are hoping her focus on the customer and commitment to business will help Mariya in her endeavors and lead her to success in entrepreneurship.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el Jr. Mollendo, Urb. Carmen; distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 06 hijos y posee estudios de primaria incompleta (quinto grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01año; se dedica al engorde de ganado menor y la venta de bebidas (gaseosas); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual incremento adquirirlo mas bebidas (gaseosas)
Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; con ello piensa comprar ganado menor para engorde (ovejas de raza para carne), de esta manera obtendrá ingresos mayores por la venta de carne en las ferias y mercados locales, con lo cual podrá ayudar a sus hijos en sus educación básica y superior.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the "03 de Mayo" Communal Bank in Llave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, has 6 children and a fifth-grade education. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year, fattening small livestock and selling soft drinks. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to increase her beverage stock. With this loan of 1500 soles, which she promises to repay in five monthly payments, she will buy more small livestock to fatten (breeding sheep for meat). By selling meat at local fairs and markets, she will obtain a better income, with which she will support her children in their elementary and higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small livestock to fatten (breeding sheep for meat)

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov S. is 48 years old and lives in Kvav village in Takeo province. She is a basket maker. Her husband, Mr. Yang Chanthon, is a farmer. Aside from tending his plantation, he is a cow breeder. Since his cattle business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Pov S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She has two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Justina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La venta de ropa es un negocio que requiere de mucha inversión por lo que a diario se vende el producto y se debe de estar llenando los estantes. Consciente de esta situación la señora Justina R. se dedica a su actividad de venta de ropa de diferentes tamaños y para hombres y mujeres.

Por este motivo es que la señora Justina busca el apoyo en Ceprodel esperando que su crédito sea otorgado para dar lugar a la compra de la ropa y así ofertarla en su negocio.
texts.en:
Selling clothes is a business that requires a lot of investment because clothes need to sold on a daily basis and the rails always need to be full. Mrs Justina R., who has her own business selling clothes of different sizes for both men and women, is aware of this and as a result is looking to Ceprodel for support. She hopes that Ceprodel will grant her the loan she requires so that she can buy more clothes and help her business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухабат 48 лет. Она замужем, муж на заработках в России, воспитывает 4 детей. Постоянной работы не имеет и уже несколько лет занимается шитьем национальных халатов дома. Ей помогает ее дочь. Мухабат приоретает ткани и вату для набивки и потом дома шьет. На шитье одного халата уходит от одного до трех дней в зависимости от полученного заказа. Прибыль от вложенного составляет 25-30% и полученная прибыль идет на расходы семьи. Мухаббат собирается приобрести ткани и поэтому подала заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is 48 years old. She is married, her husband is a migrant worker in Russia and she is raising 4 children. Muhabbat does not have a regular job and has been sewing traditional robes at home for several years. Her daughter helps her. Muhabbat purchases fabric and cotton for padding and then sews at home. It takes her one to three days to sew one robe depending on the order. The profits from her investment constitute 25-30% and the earnings are spent on family expenses. Muhabbat plans to purchase fabric and this is why she has applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Mariétou

texts.fr:
Madame Mariétou  T.est âgée  de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 7  enfants, elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, ses  deux coépouses et leurs enfants dans le quartier Hamdallaye   de la préfecture  de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, elle s’est très vite initiée aux activités génératrices de revenus, auprès de sa maman. Après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle décida finalement de faire l’achat et la vente des habillements notamment la vente des layettes  il y a de cela 15 ans. Cette activité est rentable et lui procure assez de  revenus. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et satisfaire sa clientèle, Madame Mariétou n’a pas pris du temps pour rejoindre l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso. En six ans de relation avec l’institution, elle a correctement remboursé ses  4 prêts  solidaires (prêt de groupe) et ses 3 prêts individuels.
Elle est à son quatrième prêt  individuel  qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une importante quantité de layettes (de qualités et de couleurs différentes)  à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Elle effectue sa vente  dans le grand marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle composée de femmes et hommes à crédit ou au comptant.  
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000 FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt,  participer aux  dépenses quotidiennes  de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariétou Tounkara, age 48, is married and the mother of seven. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her two co-wives, and their children in the Hamdallaye district, in Koutiala prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having lacked the chance to go to school, she very soon got introduced by her mother to earning revenues. After having worked at several kinds of businesses unsuccessfully, she finally decided fifteen years ago to buy and sell clothing, particularly baby wear. This is a profitable business, which brings in a fair income for her.

Concerned about increasing her turnover and satisfying her customers, Ms. Mariétou wasted no time in joining the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. During her six years associated with the institution, she has correctly repaid her four solidarity loans (group loans) and her three individual loans. She is now on her fourth individual loan, which will be used to buy a sizable quantity of baby wear (of good quality and of different colors) in Bamako (capital of Mali). She makes her sales at the grand marketplace of Koutiala to customers composed of women and men, cash or credit accepted.

She plans to realize a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA she envisions using to make loan interest payments, to help cover day-to-day family expenses, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for babies

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: “Progress wouldn’t be achieved by an instant click” said Flordeliza A.. She is a 34 year old housewife, married to Romelo Sr., who operates a tricycle transport. Sometimes, Flordeliza also sells vegetables in their village to help her husband with their basic necessities. Flordeliza is asking for loan amounting to PHP 9,000 that they will use for the maintenance of their motorcycle. Some of their income in the business will be used by Flordeliza to buy vending products to sell in their village. The couple helps each other to earn income for the future of their children.

loans.use: Motorcycle Maintenance

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Yolanda es soltera, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Yolanda tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende carne, los animales los compra en las ferias. Además Yolanda vende leña en su casa.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ovino y ganado porcino.
Los sueños de Yolanda son construir su casa y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Banco Comunal Estrella [Community Star Bank]. Yoland is single, 28 years old and has a son. Yolanda has a stand at the central market in the city of Ayacucho where she sells meat, the animals she buys at fairs. Additionally, Yolanda sells firewood from her home. Yolanda needs a loan of 1000 Pervian Soles. The money would be invested in buying sheep and pigs. Yolanda dreams of building a home and educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and pigs.

loans.name: Cristo Vive, Group 1

texts.en:
Paulina R. is the leader of a group of five women seeking to take out a loan. She is unmarried but lives with the father of her children, who are ages 4, 14, 15, and 17. Her business is selling shoes and bedspreads, something she has been doing for over a year and a half.

Paulina has taken out several loans in the past, and says that being an Esperanza associate has given her hope to keep moving forward in life. She plans to invest the money from this loan by starting her own store and expanding her business to include a confectionery.

loans.use: To start her own shop and add a confectionary.

loans.name: Senovia Antonia

texts.es: La señora Senovia Antonia R. R., tiene la edad de 37 años, habita en el barrio Medardo Andino, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, los planes hacia su familia es poder terminar de construir su vivienda, desde hace nueve años doña Senovia trabaja para la D.G.I, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento. Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para comenzar a construir su casa. Este es su segundo ciclo de préstamos y da las gracias por los beneficios alcanzados.
texts.en:
Senovia Antonia R. R. is 37. She lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood, which is located in the Ticuantepe municipality. She lives with her husband, and he helps with the household expenses. The family plan is to be able to finish construction on their house. Senovia has worked for the D.G. I. [General Directorate of Revenue] for nine years. Her biggest difficulty is the lack of financing. With this loan she will buy construction materials to begin construction on her house. This is her second loan cycle, and she is thankful for the benefits she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to improve her house

loans.name: Las

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. Las, 41, and her husband, Mr. You Khem, 44, were married in 1993 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Four of their children attend school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Y. and her husband are farmers. Besides farming, Mr. You Khem is a wooden house constructor as well. He works in his village and in nearby villages.

Y. is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a motorized hand-tiller. She will use it to plow her own farm and rent it to other farmers to get extra income.

loans.use: To buy a motorized hand-tiller for plowing

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a 52-year-old married mother of six children, two of whom are currently in school. She started a fish business 30 years ago in a community market near where she lives. She prepares and serves very tasty fish and, for that reason, many people buy from her. Comfort buys her stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She supports her children from the proceeds of her business. She also depends on this income for their food, school bills and sometimes medical bills. Comfort is requesting a loan to buy increased stocks of assorted fish in order to increase her sales and income. This will help her to support her children's education and the growth of her business. She hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mr. Phat P., 44, and his wife, Mrs. San Kheak, 43, have been married since 1987. They have five children: two daughters - one of them is married and another one is a garment factory worker; and three sons - two attend school and one stays at home. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Phat has been fishing for over twenty years, while his wife has been growing vegetables for over five years. He is applying for his first loan of $150 in order to purchase fishing nets for his fishing business. He will use part of the loan to help his wife in her business growing vegetables as well.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets for his fishing business and to help his wife's business growing vegetables

loans.name: Vectoria

texts.en:
Vectoria D. is a rice grower from Veruela, Agusan del Sur in Mindanao. She has six children, 15 years old the eldest, whom she really puts all her attention to every day and night. Her dream for her children is that they will grow as responsible persons in the future.

Vectoria would like to request a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying farming necessities to obtain an abundant harvest. The income she makes from growing rice is what she hopes will provide her family with enough food and income to buy their other needs.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita B. P. de 52 años de edad reside en el departamento de Santa Tecla junto a sus tres hijos y su esposo. Margarita es una mujer muy trabajadora y da todo por su familia, hace once años ella inicio su negocio, con el deseo de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares y es así como hasta el día de ahora Margarita sostiene su negocio en el mercado municipal de Santa Tecla donde vende calzado  y productos de nutrición, el crédito que solita es para surtir su negocio.

loans.use: surtir su negocio.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 39 years old and married to Orlando.  She and her family reside in San Andres, Aurora, Isabela. She is engaged in a dress making business and sometimes she also sells vegetables and cooked snacks in their village. Her business has been of great help in providing the school allowance for their children.  They have five children and they are all boys and three are studying.  

Her income is just enough to help her husband in providing for the needs of her family.  She is glad that her son, who is working in Bulacan, is helping them financially.  She now wants to borrow additional capital from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP8,000 for the continuous improvement of her dressmaking and vending business.

loans.use: Additional capital for improvement of her small businesses

loans.name: Nun

texts.en:
Nun K. is 22 years old and resides with her husband and two young children in Siem Reap province. Since 2004, she has been raising pigs and chickens to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 1 per day, while her husband has a business selling firewood and typically makes US$ 3 every day.

Nun K. told to a loan officer that she typically spends about US$ 23 on food and US$ 2 on utilities. Nun K. is asking for a loan of US$ 700 which her husband needs to purchase a motorbike trailer to transport wood.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike a trailer to transport wood

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Тошмуратова Ханифа проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 39 лет. Вдова, имеет 4 детей. Ханифа более 3 лет занимается выращиванием сельских культур, например пшеницы, лука и т.д. Помимо этого она занимается пашивом одежды. Кредит просит для закупа семян и удобрений, чтобы посеить новый урожай.
texts.en:
Hanifa T. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 39 years old, a widow and has 4 children. Hanifa has been involved in growing agricultural varieties, such as wheat, onions, etc., for over 3 years. Besides this business, she also sews clothing. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer in order to sow new plants.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu K. is a grocery vendor and she has been in this business for two years.  She is 30 years old.  She has been a client with ARD and has taken three successive loans, which she has repaid without any problem. She wants to increase her stock of items so that she can increase her income. She spends 14 hours every day in her stall. 

Fatu is married with one child. The family has bought a piece of land, on which they intend to construct a small house. Fatu is respected by her peers and is serious with her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock of items for sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is married with 5 children, and she is 52 years old. She sells colorful sarongs and shoes to make a living in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Omar tiene 27 años, es conviviente y tiene una hija llamada Mercedes que tiene 4 años.  El socio Omar vive en la ciudad de Calca departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio trabaja como técnico en informática en el Ministerio de Salud ya son 6 años que trabaja en el ministerio. El socio tiene un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de comestibles donde su esposa atiende. El socio nos cuenta que los domingos juega en el equipo de fútbol “Humberto Luna” de Calca donde es el capitán y nos cuenta que el año 2009 salieron campeones. Ya son varios años que él y su esposa se dedican al negocio y les ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos como arroz, pollo, carne, queso y gaseosas para la tienda de abarrotes.     
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Omar is 27 years old, lives with his wife and his 4-year-old daughter named Mercedes. They live in the city of Calca in the department of Cusco and he belongs to the Mamacha Asunta communal bank of Arariwa. Omar has been working as an information technician in the health department for six years. He also has a small grocery business that his wife runs. He tell us that he also plays football on Sundays for the Humberto Luna team, the champions of 2009. Omar and his wife have operated the grocery business for several years and it has gone well due to the effort they put into their work. This loan will be used to buy more products such as rice, chicken, meat, cheese, and soft drinks for the grocery store. Omar is a hardworking father and entrepreneur who supports his family. He is grateful for the opportunity provided by this loan, and commits to making his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, chicken, cheese, soft drinks, etc. for grocery store.

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
La Sra. Rocío del Pilar, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 37 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella.

Rocío del Pilar, lleva  10 años dedicándose a la confección de todo tipo de vestidos pantalones, blusas, para niños, niñas y caballeros, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su pequeño taller de costura y teniendo habilidad  para este tipo de actividad, no dudó en hacerlo y gracias al apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos logró implementarlo, el mismo  que se encuentra ubicada en su casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, trabaja a pedido.

En la actualidad continua con su negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa para solicitar sus servicios.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará telas en metros, blondas, de diferentes modelos, tijeras, agujas de coser y de máquina, alfileres, botones y grecas.

Rocío del Pilar, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a iniciarse en el  negocio a mujeres como ella y a otras que quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Rocío del Pilar belongs to "Los Eucaliptos" Community Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martin province and region. She is married, is 37 years old and is mother to one son, who still depends on her. For ten years, she has been dedicating herself to making all types of clothing such as trousers and shirts for boys, girls and men. Gradually, she began to generate her own income and saved her money, desiring to start a small seamstress shop. Having a skill for this type of activity, she didn't doubt pursuing it and, thanks to the Manuela Ramos Movement, she was able to do so. It is located in her home, in a well conditioned environment. She tells us that her sales are good and she works based on orders. Currently, she continues with her business and has a faithful customer base that goes to her house daily to request her services. With this loan of S. 800.00, she will buy metres of fabric, different types of lace, scissors, sewing and sewing machine needles, pins, buttons and borders. Today, Rocío del Pilar feels like an accomplished woman, with more goals to succeed and make the rest of her dreams a reality. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her start their businesses and others who wish to grow business-wise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy metres of fabric, different types of lace, scissors, sewing and sewing machine needles.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa S. âgée de 36 ans est une femme divorcée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vend des tissus, parfums, laits de toilette, de la pâte d’arachide et de l’huile de palme depuis 6 ans après son divorce. Membre d’U-IMCEC depuis 2008, Madame S. y sollicite pour la première fois un crédit de 200 000 FCFA pour renforcer son activité. Ainsi avec ce prêt, Madame Awa S. compte s’approvisionner en tissus et parfums qu'elle va placer à ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs Awa S. is a 36 year-old divorced mother of two. She has been making a living by selling fabric, perfume, toilet water, peanut butter and palm oil since her divorce six years ago. She has been a member of U-IMCEC since 2008, and this 200 000 FCFA loan to bolster her business is the first that she has requested. Mrs Awa S. aims to use this loan to source fabric and perfume for her clients.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sourcing fabric and perfume

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun S., age 31, is married and resides with her children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has four children. She is in a business of producing palm sugar for sale, earning an income of $5 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. Her husband is employed in a nongovernmental organization, earning an income of $3.50 per day. He has been with this job since 2005. S. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a plot of farmland to expand the agricultural products. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Rubilyn Abu-Abu Group

texts.en:
Rubilyn A. is from the village of Colupan Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Rubilyn is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rubilyn A. Group.

Rubilyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rubilyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rubilyn has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $45 a month from these activities.

In 2007, Rubilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rubilyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, de 30 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Yony de 35 años y su hijo Edison de 10 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Su tienda de abarrotes es una de las más concurridas del poblado de “Villa Visca”. El carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera en abrir.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su pueblo. Lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer gran parte del día en su tienda, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para cultivar sus tierras. Para más adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda para tener más productos que vender en stock.

Este el tercer préstamo de Gladys con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes y así incrementará su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 30 years old and is a very loving and happy mother. She lives in her own house together with her husband, Yony, who is 35 years old, and their 10-year-old son, Edison, both of whom are the motivation for her efforts.

Her grocery store is one of the most popular in the Villa Vesca area. Her charisma and friendliness have made her preferable among her neighbors, who do not doubt shopping very early since they know that she is the first store to open.

What she likes most about her work is talking with her neighbors about the things that happen in the town. She has been in this business for 2 years and considers the most difficult part to be having to stay in her store the majority of the day, as it doesn’t leave her much time to cultivate her lands. In the future, she hopes to expand her store to have more products in stock to sell.

This is Gladys’ third loan with MFP. She knows that if she makes her loan payments on time, she will be able to access another loan more easily and without making complications for her communal bank, where she is very well-liked by the rest of her partners. With the 2,000 PEN requested, she will purchase more goods for her grocery store and increase her stock of products.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 8 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 8 años se dedica a la costura, en donD. ofrece a su clientela la confección D. ropa D. niños, como: buzos, casacas en material polar. Su actividad empieza desD. la mañana, acompañándola su única herramienta D. trabajo, que es su maquina D. coser. Hay momentos en que sus hijos mayores la ayudan en la confección, así como en la venta D. la ropa que confecciona. Las ganancias que percibe le ayudan a sostener a su familia y eso la mantiene tranquila. Su deseo es crecer en su negocio y tener un taller D. costura con nuevos equipos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y asegura que será muy responsable con sus pagos, menciona además que dicho aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. fardos D. tela , hilos y demás implementos para  elaborar sus prendas D. vestir.
texts.en:
Dora, 45, lives with her husband and 8 children in her own home. She has been a seamstress for the last 8 years; she manufactures clothing for children, especially thermal sweatshirts and jackets. Her only work tool is her sewing machine which is her only company during her work day that starts early in the morning. Occasionally, her older children help her to make and sell her wares. Her profits help her support her family and that gives her much peace of mind. She would love to have her business grow and have a workshop equipped with newer equipment. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she assures us that she will be very punctual with her repayments and she also mentioned that the loan will be very useful for her business’s progress. She will use the funds to buy bolts of fabric, threads and other dressmaking tools.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy E. is married with four children and she is 35 years old. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home.

Joy sells clothes, sarongs and female shoes at retail prices and has been in this business for three years. She hopes to own a world-class supermarket in the future.

Joy is requesting a loan of NGN 40,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Hut

texts.en:
Mrs. Hut T., 37, is a professional fish catcher who has operated along the river for more than nine years. She and her husband always wake up in the morning and go to the river where they fish frequently. Also they hurry to bring their fish to sell at the market after they finish fishing. The couple has five school-aged children who are dependent on their income.

Hut T. needs a loan to buy a boat that they will use to travel to the middle of the river to fish. Hut T. intends to use any remaining money from the loan to accumulate more fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy a boat for fishing

loans.name: Pascual

texts.en: Pascual V. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 59 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Pascual owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over thirty years and earns approximately 50,000 PHP every harvest. In 2010, Pascual joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his first from ASKI. Pascual plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn B. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 33 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. She also retails coffee and sugar. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase inventory and as working capital. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim M., 43, is a good mother who has been blessed with four children, two of whom are married and the others are single and in school. Sim M. makes a living by buying and selling used goods for a profit. She owns an old motorbike that she uses to transport used goods that she buys door-to-door in her community. She stores many hundred kgs of recycling before selling it and gaining a profit.

Her husband was a civil servant officer, but has been retired for years and now works in the business with her. Sim M. has requested a loan, which is her third loan. She will increase the financial capital of her used goods sales trade. Sim M.’s house often needs repair, so she will use some of her loan to mend it.

loans.use: To increase the financial capital of her used goods sales trade.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer esta conformado por 13 mujeres quienes son luchadoras y lo hacen para buscar la estabilidad económica que sus familias necesitan, se llevan muy bien entre ellas llegando a ser un grupo muy alegre y unido. Vive en la parroquia de Zhidmad que esta ubicada al sur occidente del cantón Gualaceo, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y  ganadería, su producción les sirve solo para el autoconsumo. La población femenina se dedica al tejido de sombreros de paja toquilla, a la elaboración de chompas de lana y al bordado de polleras (faldas) y blusas.  Su gente sale a la ciudad de Cuenca en busca de fuentes de trabajo.

La Señora Jannet Guayllas vive en la comunidad de Zhidmad, se encuentra en su primer ciclo y fue  invitada por su suegra a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres organizadas y luchadoras, se dedica  a los quehaceres de su casa y aprovecha para criar animales como: gallinas, cuyes y chanchos, los vende cuando tiene  alguna necesidad económica.

Nuestra socia tiene 27 años, es casada y  tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo trabaja como mensajero, con el sacrificio conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia. Es  su primer crédito, lo va a invertir en la compra de más cuyes y así crecer en el negocio. Su sueño es tener un almacén de ropa.

La Señora Rosa T. vive en la comunidad de Zhidmad, tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 10, 7, 4 y 1 año de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estan estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo trabaja como cocinero, y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia es costurera, actividad que viene desempeñando hace 7 años, fue su suegra quien le ha enseñado esta actividad,  borda las polleras (faldas) que son la  vestimenta típica de la región, trabaja bajo pedido todos los días sin tener horario fijo, también se dedica a la cría de animales como: cuyes, chanchos, conejos, que los vende en la ciudad de Cuenca cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. Es nuestra socia hace tres ciclos y los créditos le han beneficiado para comprar animales, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos.

Su meta es  llegar a tener una tienda.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nuevo Amanecer is made up of 13 women who are fighters. They do it to find the financial stability that their families need. They get along very well together and are a very cheerful and close group. They live in the parish of Zhidmad, located in the southwestern part of the Gualaceo canton. People there work in agriculture and cattle, and their production is for subsistence. The female population weaves hats from toquilla straw and makes wool sweaters and embroidered skirts and blouses. The people go to the city of Cuenca to seek work. Mrs. Jannet Guayllas lives in the community of Zhidmad. This is her first cycle and she was invited to be a part of the group by her mother in law, to join these organized and dedicated women. She is a homemaker and raises animals such as: chickens, guinea pigs andpigs. She sells them when she needs the money. Our member is 27 years old, married and has a 6 year old son who is attending a local school. Her husband works as a messenger. With their hard work they have been able to build their own home. This is her first loan. She is going to invest it in buying more guinea pigs and thus grow her business. Her dream is to have a clothing store. Mrs. Rosa T. lives in the community of Zhidmad. She is 30 years old, married and has 4 childres aged 10,7, 4, and 1. Her two oldest children are attending a local school. Her husband works as a cook, and with both their hard work they have been able to build a home. Our member is a seamstress, and has been for 7 years. It was her mother in law who showed her this activity. She embroiders the skirts that are a part of the traditional clothing of the region. She works to order every day without a set schedule. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, and rabbits, which she sells in the city of Cuenca when she needs the money. She has been a member for three years and the loans have helped her to buy animals. Her new loan will be invested in buying chickens. Her goal is to be able to have a store.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia tiene 79 años y vive con su esposa en la ciudad del Cusco y tienen seis hijos. Amalia antes vendía carne en el mercado “Vino Canchón” pero desD. que su esposo sufrió un accidente tuvo que dejar D. trabajar para que pueda atender a su esposo que se quedo inválido.

Decidida a continuar su vida,  Amalia se las ingenia para vender caldos los días domingos en el mercado “Vino Canchón”, donD. la pueden encontrar, desD. las 6 mañana hasta el medio día o hasta que se agote los caldos, ella venD. varios tipos D. caldos como por ejemplo caldo D. cabeza D. res, caldo D. patas y caldo D. panza. Ya son 20 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.
 
Con su próximo préstamo, Amalia espera recibir $200 USD. Es para el gasto familiar y para la salud D. su esposo que esta invalido. 

El banco comunal “Las Leonas D. San Jerónimo”  ya tiene 10 ciclos D. funcionamiento, pero Amalia hace varios años atrás que recién participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Amalia, 79, lives with her husband in the city of Cusco; they have 6 children. Amalia used to sell meat in “Vino Canchón” Market but since her husband suffered an accident which left him an invalid she had to stop working in order to stay home to care for him. Determined to continue her life, Amalia figured out a way to sell soups on Sundays in “Vino Canchón” Market. She can be found there from 6am until midday or until she runs out of soups. She sells a variety of soups like: beef head soup, foot soup and stomach soup. She has been doing this for 20 years and does quite well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Amalia expects to get $200 USD in her next loan which is to cover family expenses and for her invalid husband’s care. The “Las Leonas D. San Jerónimo” (Lionesses of San Jerónimo) communal bank has been in operation for 10 loan cycles. Amalia has been participating in the bank for several years and does quite well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For family expenses and for care of her invalid husband.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel S. is from the village of Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 30 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Richel owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling charcoal  in the local community. Richel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Richel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Richel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La  Sra.  Zoraida está  casada con el señor Miguel y tienen 4 hijos de los cuales 2 ya están casados  y 2 aun están en la escuela primaria. Viven en el barrio Fátima.  
Zoraida  tiene una despensa bien surtida y de buena ubicación en el barrio ya que la parada de ómnibus de la zona está ubicada frente a su casa. 
Ella se inició hace varios años con muy poca mercadería que poco a poco fue aumentando con el pasar de los años. 
 Hoy día ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y buenos precios, con una clientela formada. 
Además su marido es una persona muy trabajadora y con su trabajo ayuda con los gastos del hogar, 
El es responsable con sus compromisos.
Gracias al crédito que le hemos otorgado pudo aumentar su negocio con la compra de más mercaderías como harina, fideos, azúcar, arroz, panificados, enlatados y otros.
texts.en:
Señora Zoraida is married to Señor Miguel. They have four children, of whom two are already married and two still attend primary school. They live in the neighborhood of Fátima. Zoraida has a well stocked grocery store. It is in an excellent location in her neighborhood, since the local bus stop is right in front of her house. She started several years ago with just a few goods. As the years went by, her inventory increased progressively. Today her grocery store is well stocked and has attractive prices, which ensures an established customer base. In addition, her husband is a hard-working man and his work helps paying for household expenses. He respects his commitments. Thanks to the loan that we granted Zoraida, she could expand her business by purchasing more goods such as flour, noodles, sugar, rice, bread, canned food and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, various soaps, and similar products

loans.name: Doe

texts.en:
Deo Ssemppuga is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda.  He is married and has seven children. Five of his children are currently in school. Deo has a business in food production, which he has had for five years.         

To help expand his business, Deo has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fertilizers, fungicides and insecticides for the crops. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Deo hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Deo hopes to buy a grinder.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides, fungicides

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 43-year-old single mother of two.  A year ago, she left her previous employment and started a greengrocer shop to provide for her family.  The business is doing well, and Rose is focused on expanding her shop.  She hopes to open other outlets in the future.  She has requested 20,000 KES to buy vegetables.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 49 years old and married with 11 children between the ages of 7 and 30. Nine of her children are currently attending school. Lucy is a member of the Yuya Mulembe group which is funded by Juhudi Kilimo. She is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. She has been farming for seven years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces milk, vegetables, and eggs which she sells to the local market. Lucy also earns income from her shop which she operates in the same area. Her biggest challenge has been poultry diseases which reduce her productivity.

Lucy has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry project. The increased income from this project will enable her send her children to good schools. She wishes to have 500 chickens and a posho mill, which is used to grind maize into flour, in the next five years.

Lucy has been pictured with her dairy cows because it was not possible to take her picture at her poultry farm.

loans.use: to expand her poultry project

loans.name: Ruthsel

texts.en:
Ruthsel E. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Ruthsel is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she sells clothing, shoes, lotions and perfume products from AVON and NATASHA in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruthsel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Ruthsel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: Aurelio, de 55 años, está casado con Mery, de 53 años. Ambos tienen 11 hijos, pero solo viven con 7 de ellos, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Centro Culebrayoc. La siembra de papa, maíz, habas y arvejas, es su principal actividad desde hace 18 años. Desde las primera horas del día, se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos agrícolas, que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación logró obtener. Lo que más le gusta de su labor, es poder quitar la melaza que crece en sus plantaciones, las cuales le resulta un dolor de cabeza, ya que si las permite crecer, pueden malograr el sembrío. Pero sin duda, los días que disfruta Aurelio, son las fechas que lleva su cosecha al mercado mayorista de su ciudad, donde vende su producción y ve reflejado todo su refuerzo. Esté trabajador hombre también, se dedica a la crianza de vaca y carnero, donde vende la leche y la lana que produce. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, y está seguro que con el esfuerzo conjunto de los integrantes de su banco comunal, podrán salir adelante, en el desarrollo de sus objetivos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, como también fertilizantes naturales, los cuales esparcirá en sus sembríos de papa y habas.
texts.en:
Aurelio is 55 years old.  He is married to 53 year-old Mery.  They have 11 children but only live with 7 of them.  They live in their own home in the town of Centro Culebrayoc.

Aurelio grows potatoes, corn, beans and peas.  This has been his main business activity for 18 years.  From the very first hours of each morning, he works on his land which he managed to obtain through hard work and commitment.  What he most likes about his work is being able to get rid of the weeds that grow on his plantations.  They are a real headache because if they are allowed to grow they can ruin his sown fields.  However, without doubt, the days that Aurelio enjoys are the dates when he takes his harvest to the wholesale market in his town, where he sells his produce and sees all his hard work pay off.  This hard-working man also raises cows and rams, selling the milk and wool which they produce. 

This is Aurelio's tenth loan from MFP and he is certain that through the joint work of the members of his community bank, they will be able to get ahead in the development of their goals.  He will use his loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer and also natural fertilizers which he will spread over his potato and bean crops.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and other fertilizers

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio G. Bogado es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Republicano , tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Juana Bautista Dominguez de G., con 43 años de edad, Actualmente tienen 2 hijos menores todos en edad escolar.
 
       Posee una despensa en su domicilio particular, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, señor muy trabajador, excelente cliente con nosotros y con otras entidades financieras, Ademas se dedica en la Agricultura y Ganadería, tiene 10 Has. Finca con producción agrícola bien diversificados, ganados vacunos.

             El cliente con este crédito va comprar mercaderías para la venta en estas fiestas de Navidad y Año Nuevo  y así tener mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
Antonio G. Bogado is from the city of San Estanislao, in the Republicano neighborhood.  He is 48, married to Juana Bautista Dominguez de G., 43, and they have 2 young school-age children 

He has a store in his home with regular customers, a good income and a good commercial and personal reputation.  He is very hard-working, and is an excellent client with us and with other financial institutions.  He also works in farming and cattle-raising with a ranch of 10 hectares of diverse crops, and beef cattle.

He will use the loan to buy merchandise for the upcoming Christmas and New Years holidays and thus have better earnings.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, flour, mate, and noodles.

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is 61 years old and a married mother of seven children who all are adults. Two of her children are currently attending school. She is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where she has been farming for 12 years. Her mixed farm produces eggs and milk which she sells to the local market. Farming is her main source of income.

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000KES to expand her poultry farm. The proceeds from this loan will go a long way in the education of her children and grandchildren. She says that epidermic diseases are rampant in the area and this has been her biggest challenge.

She is grateful to Juhudi for supporting her to undertake her project to another level.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
Maria Virginia pertenece al banco comunal “Kukuli” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 13 ciclos de funcionamiento (Cada ciclo son 4 meses) y el banco comunal está bien administrado por la junta directiva. 

Maria Virginia, tiene 51 años, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos, ella nació en el departamento de Apurímac 
provincia de Abancay, Perú. Actualmente, Maria Virginia vive en el distrito de Wanchaq de la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus hijos. 

Maria Virginia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de la marca AVON. Ya son cinco años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
 
Maria Virginia espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles de crédito y utilizará este dinero para comprar productos de bellza como perfumes, aretes, collares y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Maria Virginia belongs to the “Kukuli” Communal Bank of the UMF Arariwa Association of the city of Cusco, Perú. The Communal Bank has been in operation for four years and is well managed by its governing board.

Maria Virginia is 51 years old, is divorced and has three children. She was born in the Apurímac department, province of Abancay, Perú. At present, Maria Virginia lives in the Wanchaq district in the city of Cusco with her children.

Maria Virginia sells beauty products of the AVON brand. She has sold her items for some five years and has done quite well thanks to the hard work that she puts into her job.

Maria Virginia hopes to receive a loan of S/. 1500 nuevos soles and she will use the money to buy beauty products like perfumes, earrings, necklaces and other products.

loans.use: To buy beauty products like perfumes, earrings, necklaces and other products.

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji is currently in the business of selling goods like sodas, water, etc. She is 40 years old, married, with five children and all of them go to school. She took out a loan to stock more goods to sell, for example sodas, water, etc. Keji hopes to build a house to rent out in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more goods to sell, for example sodas, water, etc.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a housewife in Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry.  For 18 years, she and her family have lived in the Faisal Park area in a 2-room brick house. Zarina stays at home and performs her household responsibilities.  She is a good wife and mother who cares for her family.  In addition, she does sewing for neighborhood clients, a skill she learned from her mother before marriage.

Her husband’s name is T. H. and he sells timber in areas where gas is not available, and people use firewood to cook their food. 

Zarina has a son and 2 daughters. Her son is a motorbike mechanic who works at a repair shop.  Her daughters are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to assist her husband in his timber-selling business. With the loan, he will buy firewood in bulk which will help him fulfill customer demand and sell greater quantities in order to earn more profit.  She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial results for his business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. With her previous loan, she established good credit and never missed a meeting.  


Note: In the photo, the woman holding a book (the Asasah Passbook) is Zarina.

loans.use: To buy timber to resell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence R. has been a hair dresser at Takoradi near Effiakuma Estate for four years. Educated up to senior high school, she is single. 
Her income helps pay for housing and household expenses. She needs the loan to purchase additional hair products in order to expand her business. The increase in the business as a result of the loan will be used to buy additional hair products for sale.

loans.use: To purchase additional hair products in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres Nueva Esperanza se conformó en el año 2007, han tomado como experiencia muchas situaciones que les cupo vivir en todos estos años como grupo y equipo para crecer como comité, buscando un objetivo en común “Mejorar el nivel de vida de las integrantes”, además de mejorar como persona.
Las señoras son de la ciudad  de Encarnación, distante a 50 km. de la oficina de la fundación y el destino del crédito es para compra de mercaderías e insumos para su actividad comercial.
Las integrantes están con el ánimo de seguir  retirando el crédito ya que les ayuda en sus emprendimientos, teniendo en cuenta que la zona donde viven hay bastante movimiento comercial y necesitan de capital de trabajo para impulsar sus emprendimientos.
Renuevan por 12va vez, pasando al siguiente ciclo por el excelente pago en sus cuotas, por el buen acompañamiento de su directora  Mirta A., quien con sacrificio mantiene su producción agrícola y cría de animales en su residencia. Ella las motiva a que sean puntuales y cumplan con sus cuotas para seguir con la línea de crédito.
La sra. Mirta solo desea poder prosperar con el crédito que solicita ya que de ella depende el progreso económico de su familia.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) was established in 2007. This group has experienced many situations over the years that have helped them grow as a committee. They seek to achieve the common objective of “improving the standard of living of the members”. In addition, the members want to improve as people.

The women are from the city of Encarnación, which is 50km from the office of Fundación Paraguaya. This loan will be used to buy merchandise and supplies for their business activities. The members are excited about continuing to receive loans to help them with their ventures. They live in an area where there is significant commercial activity, so they need capital to promote their businesses.

The group is receiving a loan for the twelfth time. They are entering their next loan cycle with an excellent payment history. Mirta A., the group’s director, has made sacrifices to maintain her farm production and raise animals from her home. She encourages the members to complete their payments on time so that they can continue their line of credit.

Sra. Mirta’s only wish is to prosper with the loan she requested since the financial progress of her family depends on her.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for planting crops and raising animals.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
La señora pastora es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual significa novia del del sol, 
la cual es una region ganadera. Doña Pastora tiene la edad de 54 años, solo estudio hasta el primer año de primaria ya que nos comenta que antes los padres preferiandarle estudios a los hombres y a las mujeres les enseñaban las labores del hogar, ella se encuentra casada cone le señor Benito con el cual tuvo 4 hijos los cuales ya estan casados.	

Doña pastora nos platica que años despues de casarse como el dinero no alcanzaba decidio ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y inicio a vender antojitos mexicanos(tostadas,chiles rellenos, tacos, empanadas, garnachas, platanos fritos y papas) los fines de semana(sabado, domingo y lunes), ella ya tiene mas de 30 años con su negocio cuando ella inicio sacaba sus mesas y su anafre a la parte de enfrente de su casa que da a la carretera y desde que inicio a recibir los prestamos de fundacion ha estado invirtiendo en la compra de insumos(col, tomates, chiles, cebolla, frijol, carne, crema, queso, tortillas, maiz, huevos, platanos, papas, aceite y gas) y sus ganancias las esta inirtiendo en la construccion de un pequeño local en el cual piensa intalar su negocio.

Ella nos dice que con este credito trabajara de la misma manera ademas de que piensa invertir un poco en la venta de ropa interior y zapatos.		

Ella esta muy entusiasmada y espera que sus ganancias aunmenten para poder terminar su local.
texts.en:
Sra. Pastora is a resident of a place called Tierra Blanca, which is also known as “The Bride of the Sun”. In addition to being a livestock region, it is one of the warmest places in the State of Veracruz. Doña Pastora is 54 years old and only has a first grade education. She says that her parents preferred that the men be educated while the women were taught how to perform the household duties. Pastora is married to Sr. Benito and has four children who are already married.

She says that after she got married, she decided to earn money so that she could help her husband with the household expenses. Pastora started selling Mexican snacks such as tostadas, stuffed chili peppers, tacos, empanadas, “garnachas” (a fried corn tortilla topped with shredded meat, cabbage, and cheese), fried plantains, and potatoes on the weekends (Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays). She has been in business for more than thirty years. When she first started, Pastora took tables and a portable stove to the front part of her house that faces the highway. At that point, she started receiving loans from Fundación Realidad to invest in the purchase of supplies such as cabbages, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, beans, meat, cream, cheese, tortillas, corn, eggs, plantains, potatoes, cooking oil, and propane gas. Her earnings were invested in the construction of a small shop where she could relocate her business.

Pastora says that with this loan, she will continue to work in the same manner, but she will also invest a little bit of the money in the purchase of undergarments and shoes to sell. She is very excited and hopes to increase her earnings so that she can finish the construction of her shop.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for making Mexican snacks as well as undergarments and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 69 years old, married and she has three children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Flordeliza has a tailoring business in the Philippines.  She requested a 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy threads, needles, scissors, tape measure, garments, and buttons for her tailoring business.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 50 years.  In the future, Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Chuluunhuu

texts.en: Chuluunhuu is 44 years old and lives in a ger (Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent) in Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. She manages a shoe trading business in Narantuul market, one of the busiest markets in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business in 2000. Since then her business has been quite successful which has allowed her to buy a plot of land where she lives now. She attributes her business success to the good location of her rented stall. Now her daily earnings exceed 50,000-70,000 tugriks (MNT). She is planning to increase her collection of shoes in order to increase her business sales. She is a very hardworking woman who pays great attention to performing or completing a task satisfactorily. She says that she wants to build a house on her plot of land. She is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of shoes for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of shoes.

loans.name: Jesugnon 1 Group

texts.fr: JESUGNON 1 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (dont la main est levée sur la photo) est nommée Jocelyne. Les membres du groupe sont des amies et vivent ensemble dans le même quartier. Née le 20 Mars 1974 à Zinvié, Jocelyne est mariée à un certain Gilbert et est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Jocelyne et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Jocelyne a très peu fréquenté l’école. Afin de satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Jocelyne achète divers produits vivriers (conserves, des vivres, des œufs, etc.) à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et les revend à son domicile. Jocelyne exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année. C’est la deuxième fois que Jocelyne et son groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d'affaire et leur revenu.
