texts.en: JESUGNON 1 is a group composed of three people. Its representative (whose hand is raised on the picture) is named Jocelyne. The group members are friends and live in the same neighborhood. Born on March 20, 1974 in Zinvie, Jocelyne is married to Gilbert and the mother of five children, who all go to school. Jocelyne and her husband live together with their children. The couple provides together for the various needs of their family. Jocelyne did not go to school much. To supply for her and her children's needs, Jocelyne purchases various food products (cans, foodstuffs, eggs, etc.) in Dantokpa, Benin's international market, and resells them from her home. Jocelyne has been in this business for about ten years. This is the second time that Jocelyne and her group are requesting a loan from ALIDé, in order to grow their business, increase their sales, and raise their revenues.

loans.use: to purchase canned and fresh food.

loans.name: Grimaldo Amacedo

texts.es:
Grimaldo tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia, cuanta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual se encuentra a 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Esta zona la actividad principal es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Grimaldo desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.  Su esposaa colocado una tienda donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para comprar alimentos balanceados, para que sus animales sigan teniendo una buena alimentación para ofrecerlos a un buen precio a sus clientes en el mercado.  Grimaldo es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca cada vez más y que su familia salga adelante.
texts.en:
Grimaldo tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia, cuanta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual se encuentra a 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Esta zona la actividad principal es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Grimaldo desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.  Su esposaa colocado una tienda donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para comprar alimentos balanceados, para que sus animales sigan teniendo una buena alimentación para ofrecerlos a un buen precio a sus clientes en el mercado.  Grimaldo es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca cada vez más y que su familia salga adelante.

loans.use: Compra de alimentos balanceados para sus animales

loans.name: Kristyl

texts.en:
Kristyl is 20 years old and single.  She works very hard to help her parents. Kristyl runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like sugar, grocery items, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Kristyl has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, bread, bottled products and other basic commodities. 

In the future, Kristyl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 43 years old, married to Zadok. Together they have three children. She has been running her dress making business for fourteen years. She earns a monthly income of about KES 7,000 which he uses to stock up in the business and also take care of her family.

She has applied for a loan of KES. 10,000 by KADET Ltd. This is her first loan from KADET. She intends to use her loan to purchase more materials.

She plans to use the profit from her business to expand and educate her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for he dress making business

loans.name: Los Girasoles De Compone Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS GIRASOLES DE COMPONE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Tania Nélida; ella es soltera y tiene 36 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y chanchos y también tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo donde siembra maíz y verduras y luego los vende en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Compone y los animales también lo vende en el mercado de Anta, la socia por medio de estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de animales y mejorar sus negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y alimentos para los animales y para comprar semillas para las tierras de cultivo.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de lácteos, negocio de venta de queso, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de leche, negocio de ganadería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the "Los Girasoles de Compone" ["The Sunflowers of Compone"]. The bank is located in the district of Anta, which is part of Anta province, department of Cusco. 

One member is Ms. Tania Nélida. She is single, 36 years old, and has one son. She works in her business raising young animals like guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs. She also has a small plot of land where she plants corn and vegetables, which she sells at the various markets in the district of Compone. She also sells her animals at the market in Anta. Through these small businesses, Tania is able to help her child get ahead. She would like to expand her animal sales business and to improve her agriculture business. She is requesting this loan to buy animals and feed for them and to buy seeds for her fields.

The other members' businesses include: dairy sales, cheese sales, vegetable sales, milk sales, and cattle.

Tania is grateful to those who, through this means, will form a part of her dream. She promises to comply with her repayment plan according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed for them, as well as seeds to plant

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: To have a good life, one must try. Mrs. Kong, 25, and her husband, just 27, both have jobs. Mrs. Kong is a fish and cheese seller in Baray district, Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. Her husband doesn’t waste time, he works as a retail and wholesale seller of fish to more clients. Both of them are young, but they care for two children responsibly. For improving on her business, Mrs. Kong wishes to borrow a loan in the amount of $800 in order to purchase more fish to sell, in time, to customers. She is shown in the photo with her baby.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell, in time, to customers.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y una hija, administra un negocio de ropa y medicina, dicho negocio surgió gracias a la ayuda de su hermano quien le enseño a manejar el negocio, no tiene un horario establecido para atender a sus clientes.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, medicina y mas mercadería para su negocio, esta compra le ayudara crecer y tener la mercadería necesaria para atender a la clientela. 
El Objetivo de Jose es tener una empresa bien formada, tener mas clientela y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and daughter.  He manages a clothing and medicine business.  Said business emerged thanks to his brother’s help.  His brother taught him how to run the business.  He does not have a fixed schedule for seeing to his customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, medicine, and more merchandise for his business.  This purchase will help him grow.  It will help him to have the merchandise he needs to see to his customers.

José’s objective is to have a well formed business, to have more customers, and to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, and medicine.

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr:
Yawavi est une femme âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un douanier à la retraite. Elle a 03 enfants.
Yawavi travaille comme revendeuse de sacs de charbons et des céréales il ya 03 ans. Elle vend à domicile et achète à ANIE. 
Yawavi a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter 12 sacs de charbon et 04 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Yawavi is a 36-year-old woman who is married to a retired customs agent. She has three children. She has been working as a retailer of charcoal and grains for three years. She sells out of her home and makes her purchases in ANIE.

Yawavi has requested her second loan at WAGES in order to buy 12 sacks of charcoal and 4 sacks of corn.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and grains

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
"Nothing is impossible to a willing heart" this is what Maricar says. She is 42 years old but still hopes that someday she will uplift her family's living condition. She is operating a small sari-sari (variety) store in the window of her house. She has been managing it for almost five years. She wasn't able to construct a store outside her house due to the expensive cost of construction materials, such as gravel and sand. Instead of buying these materials, she would rather use a loan to buy groceries for her store. She earns about P4,000 each month doing these activities. She has four children and all are attending school and need daily allowances. 

Maricar is now asking  for a loan of P10,000 to buy soft drinks, breads, eggs and instant noodles to sell in her store. Additional groceries to sell will attract more customers and increase the capacity of sales from her business. She will then earn more profit and will be able to save a part of it for emergency purposes.

In the future, Maricar would like to earn consistent profits to construct a store in front of her house.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads, eggs and instant noodles to sell in her store.

loans.name: Efia

texts.en: Efia supplies her customers with bags of charcoal when she receives orders for them. She is married. Her customers have increased and it has affected the volume of charcoal she needs to supply; a loan will help to meet the sudden demand for more charcoal.

loans.use: to meet the sudden demand for more charcoal.

loans.name: Lois

texts.en: Lois is 45 years old, has five children and earns a living by selling beer in a local market in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years and is applying for a loan from BRAC and Kiva to buy more beer to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Basima

texts.en:
Basima is a 41-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan and a mother of 10 children. She makes "Maftol" which is a kind of traditional food in Jordan.

Basima is requesting a loan of 500 JD to expand her home-based project and purchase more materials needed to make more Maftol.

Basima is looking to purchase a machine for making Maftol so that she can increased her sales volume and increase her income to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to expand her project by purchasing more materials.

loans.name: Bioleta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bioleta; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa y venta de zapatos, la socia vende pantalones, chompas, polos y blusas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos al por mayor y para comprar polos, chompas, blusas, pantalones y casacas al por mayor. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY” communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco District, which belongs to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Sra. Bioleta.  She is 32 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She spends her days selling clothing and shoes.  From 8:00am until 6:00pm, she sells pants, sweaters, polo shirts and blouses from a street stand.  Through these businesses, she is able to help her children to get ahead.  Sra. Bioleta wants to expand her business selling clothing and shoes.  She is requesting the loan in order to purchase wholesale shoes and wholesale polo shirts, sweaters, blouses, pants and jackets.

Sra. Bioleta is happy about the loan and promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale shoes and wholesale polo shirts, sweaters, blouses, pants and jackets.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, single and lives with his parents.

Ahmad has been a shop-owner since 2000, selling sports wear and equipments.  He has more than ten years experience in this field and a good reputation.  His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2700 loan in order to paint and renovate his shop’s wall and floor. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to paint and renovate his shop’s wall and floor.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a widow. After the death of her husband, life became very difficult for her but she never lost hope. She raised her children with great effort. Now her children have grown and taken over the financial responsibility of the family.
Her eldest son runs a grocery store while two of remaining five also work. Her three younger children are getting their education.
Kosar remains at home and does her household responsibilities.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for her son who wants to stock a larger supply of items such as spices, sugar and cooking oil in his grocery store. This will allow him to fulfill his clients' orders and increase his profits.
He has been operating his business for the past many years and Kosar is very hopeful that an investment will help him make his business more profitable.
Note: - The lady holding the pass book in the picture is Kosar

loans.use: to buy sugar, spices, cooking oil and other grocery items.

loans.name: Hamidahon's Group

texts.en:
Hamidahon leads this three-person loan group. She is 21, married to a builder and raising an infant. Two years ago, after her marriage, her family gave her a cow and she began breeding farm animals. She sells one whenever she needs money, and is applying for this loan to enlarge her herd by buying two sheep. Her goal for the future is to earn enough money to buy a car.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy two sheep.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: Imelda comenta que estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria porque sus papas ya no pudieron seguir apoyando económicamente ya que eran más hijos y no les alcanzaba para darles más estudios, ella tiene 38 años de edad es casada con el señor Demetrio el cual es empleado, ellos tienen 5 hijos y 3 de ellos viven en su casa Carlos de 17 años quien trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, Vanesa de 15 años y Fernanda de 13 años de edad ellas dos estudian la secundaria. Ella está pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para poder hacer crecer su negocio de  venta de aguacate y nopal. Imelda comprara abono e insecticidas y plantas de aguacate, su negocio lo tiene hace  aproximadamente hace 25 años, platica que lo tiene en su casa porque tiene un terreno muy amplio y puede  estar al pendiente de sus plantas. Dice que sale a vender sus aguacates y nopales a diario a la central de abastos de una población cercana a la de ella y también dice que tiene pedidos de clientes. Platica que el crédito le beneficiara ya que a sus hijas las menores les podrán comprar lo que necesiten para sus trabajos escolares. La meta que tiene con su negocio de aguacate y nopal es seguir sembrando y cuidarlo más ya que de ahí ellos se mantienen y salir a otras ciudades donde vendan sus productos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Imelda says that she studied through the third year of high school because her parents were not able to continue providing financial support. She has other siblings and there was not enough money to further their education. Imelda is 39 years old and married to Sr. Demetrio, who is employed. They have five children, three of whom live at home: Carlos, age 17 who works and helps with the household expenses; Vanesa, age 15; and Fernanda, age 13. Both daughters attend high school.

Imelda is requesting a loan from the microfinance organization so that she can grow her business of selling avocados and cactus pads. She plans to buy compost, insecticides, and avocado plants. Imelda has been in this business for approximately 25 years. She says that she has a very spacious plot of land at home that is suitable for her plants. Imelda sells avocados and cactus pads every day at a supply depot in a nearby town where she receives orders from her customers.

She says this loan will benefit her young daughters because she will be able to buy the things they needs for school. Her goal is to maintain her avocado and cactus pad business by providing additional care to her crops, thereby allowing her to sell her products in other cities at a better price.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, and avocado plants.

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is taking out another Kiva loans of KES 10,000 to expand her business.  She anticipates an increase in demand during the festive season. 

Mwaris’s previous Kiva loan, helped her earn more profit and improve the her family's living standard.  She was able to purchase a pieces of land and she is now planning to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is 52 years old, widowed, and has two children, one of whom is a dependent working in a rubber plantation factory. Having earned a living as a widowed mother, she has been farming rice as her main income source for 35 years and she supplements her income by raising pigs. The previous loans from VisionFund since 2009 have helped Sok have a regular income. Now she earns more than five U.S. dollars per day. 

Sok leads a group of five female members who have been with VisionFund from one year to two years and are applying for another loan. She will use this loan to harvest her rice crop and buy a few piglets for her business. She hopes to make more rice and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To harvest her rice crops and buy a few piglets for her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Huampani Group

texts.es:
Mariana es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Huampani”, grupo que está  conformado por  10 socios, practican valores como la responsabilidad y la solidaridad. 
Mariana tiene 43 años de edad es casada con 04 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a 02 de ellos. Mariana es una mujer emprendedora, tiene un negocio de cabinas de internet en su casa; realizo diferentes trabajos para lograr salir adelante. 
Estudió corte y confección que le permitiría poner su propio taller, los implementos como máquina de coser entre otros los compro parte con dinero ahorrado y el resto con apoyo de su pareja. Ella se siente orgullosa por ello, ya que ayudó a sus hijos en su educación, mejorando su calidad de vida.
El crédito lo destinara al mantenimiento de sus maquinas. Adjunto fotografía de Josefina.
texts.en:
Mariana is a member of “Las Triunfadoras de Huampani” Community Bank. The group is composed of 10 responsible and hardworking members. Mariana is 43 years old, she is married and she has 4 children, 2 of whom depend economically on her. A resourceful woman, Mariana has installed some Internet terminals in her house. She has various jobs to be able to get ahead. In order to fulfill her dream she has had to engage herself in different jobs. She has studied dressmaking and she has used what money she could earn and save with her jobs to buy some sewing machines, and thanks to the support of her husband she purchased 3 machines, buying some others later on to face the growing requests of the customers of her area; she told us that she currently owns 12 sewing machines. She is proud about it, as she has been able to help paying for the education of her children. Her next goal to achieve is the improvement of her house. In this occasion she has requested a loan to pay for the maintenance of her machines. Mariana is thankful to the lenders for the support they offer to people like her. 

We have added the photo of Josefina, another member of the group, to the original group picture.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her sewing machines.

loans.name: Maria Alma  Delia

texts.es: La señora Alma  es  una persona responsable la cual se  dedica  a la venta  de  calzado  por  catalogo   lo cual le  a permitido  salir  adelante  día  con  día   y brindarle  a su  familia  una estabilidad  económica,  ella  se  acerco  con nosotros  ya que  requiere  realizar  la compra  de   zapatos  para  seguir brindado  a  sus  clientes  el excelente  servicio que  la  a  caracterizado, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para la realización de su  proyecto.
texts.en: Alma is a responsible person who sells footwear by catalog for a living, which has allowed her to progress day by day and provide her family economic stability. She approached us as she need to make the purchase of shoes in order to continue providing to her clients the excellent service which they characterize to her. She is thankful for the support in order to realize her project.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell.

loans.name: Nanou

texts.fr:
Madame Nanou est âgée de  56 ans environ, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle  vit dans une grande famille  avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants  dans la ville de Koutiala. 
Madame Nanou n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, raison pour laquelle elle s’est basée sur le commerce depuis à bas âge qu’elle apprit auprès de sa maman. Elle excelle dans la vente de Sounbala, un des condiments essentiels des femmes maliennes, depuis plusieurs années. Elle est très sollicitée par sa clientèle, car elle reçoit des commandes importantes en provenance de plusieurs villes du Mali et des pays voisins. 
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle, Nanou rentre en partenariat avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 8 ans. Après 3 prêts dans un groupe (prêt solidaire) elle est à son 7ème prêt individuel et tous ses prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 15 sacs de 100Kg de noix de néré auprès des villageoises lors des foires hebdomadaires de la ville de Koutiala. Elle fait transformer ces noix de néré en Sounbala pour ensuite les vendre  à Koutiala, Bamako, Kayes, à une clientèle constituée de femmes généralement, au comptant et souvent à crédit.  
Elle compte générer un bénéfice mensuel de 125.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso, contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat de noix de Néré

loans.name: C_F_Lwanja_Eunicewafula Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Eunice, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Chwele District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to 4 children, known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Eunice joined One Acre Fund in 2012 because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has had more profits from each harvest. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Eunice plans to buy a cow.

Between the 14 farmers in Eunice's Group, a total of 8 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Nagossi

texts.en:
Ms. Nagossi A. produces palm oil. She learned this skill from her mother. Having abandoned school because of a lack of financial means, she got into this business to take care of herself. Married to a motorcycle taxi driver, she is a mother of four school age children. She also takes care of her parents, bringing the total number of people who depend on her to seven. Determined and enthusiastic, she now has a lot of experience in the production of palm oil, which makes her product very desirable at the market. Demand has become very high, but Ms. Nagossi A. is unable to meet it because she does not have the means for production.

To re-energize her business and to satisfy all her clients, Ms. Nagossi A. is requesting a credit of $700 to buy a supply of palm nuts and the materials to produce palm oil. The profits from her business will allow her to effectively take care of her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Nagossi produit de l’huile de palme. Cette activité, elle l’a acquise de sa mère. Abandonnant les études fautes de moyens, elle se lance dans ce commerce pour se prendre en charge. Mariée à un conducteur de taxi moto, elle est mère de quatre (4) enfants en âge de scolarisation. Elle a aussi à sa charge ses parents soit au total sept (7) personnes. Déterminée et enthousiaste, elle possède aujourd’hui une grande expérience en matière de production de l’huile de palme. Ce qui fait que l’huile qu’elle produit est très appréciée sur le marché. La demande étant devenue très forte, Madame A. Nagossi est incapable de la satisfaire car elle ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour la production.

Pour redynamiser son activité et satisfaire tous ses clients, Madame A. Nagossi sollicite un crédit de $700 pour s’approvisionner en noix de palme et en matériel de production d’huile de palme. Les bénéfices de son activité lui serviront à s’occuper efficacement des besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts and materials for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 30 years and married with 2 children. She has a basic education with further training in dressmaking. However, she has gone into the sale of dairy products since the dressmaking industry is not encouraging. She managed to secure a used deep freezer to store the products. However, with the increase in electricity tariffs she is paying more. She intends to use a KIVA loan to buy a new freezer to reduce the tariffs and prolong the storage period.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Miss Hue is 18 years old. She is the first daughter in the family. Her father is mentally retarded and her mother suffers gall-stone. Her mother had 3 surgery times and the family has paid $25.000 for her medical treatment. So Hue and her brother had to stop going to school. Her brother works as a daily month. So Hue’s selling vegetable at the local market is thus important to increase income about $6/person/month. Average income is $12/person/month. Now, Hue wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her selling business.

loans.use: selling vegetable

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of wood, rent a raffia bush, hired labour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand existing restaurant and help his daughter set up a beauty salon in their home.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is involved in a number of businesses in order to help support her husband and three children. On Sundays, her week begins with setting up her stand and filling it with as many shoes, shoe accessories, purses, and t-shirts as it can hold. This is done in one of the newer markets just outside the city center of Ayacucho, Peru. She and her fellow market vendors are slowly recruiting more vendors to this market in order to create a popular new destination for the Ayacuchan population. On Tuesdays, Nora returns to the market to sell shoes from her stand as well. Nora’s week ends on Saturday when she wakes up very early in the morning and travels to a chicken and fish farm in the city. There, she buys a large supply of meat which she transports via bus to the rural countryside. Once well outside the city, Nora sets up a stand selling the fresh meat by the kilo. She also makes sure, she says, to bring along supply of shoes to sell, because a variety of products is the key to attracting customers.

The days that Nora isn’t selling products from behind one of her three different stands are not spent idly. Her husband also works extremely hard, explains Nora, and while he is away, she takes care of their three children. In fact everything Nora does is for her kids. She is currently saving up her money to buy a house for herself and her husband, leaving the house they presently own for her sons and their families. Professionally, Nora says her dream is to leave the tiresome traveling behind and open a small grocery store.

All these dreams are possible thanks in large part to Nora’s involvement with her village bank. For the past 4 years, she has been learning how to save her money and accumulate capital. Nora is requesting a loan of $900. With this money, she will buy a larger supply and greater quantity of shoes and sandals to sell from her stand in the market.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply and greater quantity of shoes and sandals to sell from her stand in the market.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Mrs. Marie A. is married and the mother of 4 children. She is 38 years old. She buys yams in the surrounding villages and sells them at the market in Kpalimé. She has been practicing this activity for the last 10 years. Her husband does not have a regular income, Marie, with the income from her business, takes care of the school fees for her 4 children. She has very diverse customers and they are increasing in numbers. The current loan will help to increase her stock and meet the demand.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mme Marie A. est mariée et mère de 4 enfants .Elle agée de 38 ans.Elle achète des ignames dans les villages environnants et les revend au marché de kpalimé. Elle exercerce cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. Son mari n'ayant pas de revenus réguliers, c'est Marie qui s'occupe de la scolarisation de ses 4 enfants avec le revenu tiré de l'activité .Elle a des clients très variés et sont en pleines progression. Le présent emprut va l'aider à augmenter son stock et faire face à la demande.

loans.use: Purchase of yams in surrounding villages for resale in Kpalimé

loans.name: Bibie's Changamto Group

texts.en:
Bibie, age 36, is married and lives with her husband. She started a business in 2005 - a shop where she sells general items. She works from 7am to 6pm at the shop and now makes a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

In the past, Bibie took out a loan to increase her inventory. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with Pili, a member in her loan group. Pili also owns a shop in the same locality.

loans.use: To buy shop inventory

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Mrs. Karina T. has been selling petroleum for personal use for a short time. She is a 38-year-old mother of 4 daughters who adore her and tell her to achieve her dreams. The encouragement this mother receives from her daughters causes her to be a versatile woman in the job field, with the hopes that her daughters feel good and continue with their projects. Her goal of increasing the quality of her service drives her to ask for your support, so that she can obtain the loan that will facilitate the achievement of her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Karina se dedica a la venta particular de combustible (petróleo) desde hace poco tiempo. Tiene 38 años de edad es madre de 04 hijas que la adoran mucho y siempre le dicen que cumpla con sus sueños, el aliento que le dan sus hijas hacen que esta madre sea una mujer polifacética en el campo laboral, con el deseo de que sus hijas se sientan bien y continúen con sus proyectos.El firme propósito de incrementar la calidad de su servicio la conducen a solicitar vuestra ayuda para obtener el préstamo de dinero que facilitará el cumplimiento de su sueño.

loans.use: Improvement of her small business space

loans.name: Mirian Isabel

texts.en:
Mirian Isabel F. S. runs a small restaurant in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. She serves delicious meals typical to the region that include many dishes of beef, chicken, and rice served with soup and a drink.  She has many loyal customers, including workers from a factory across from her home who come for an economical home-cooked meal.
	
Mirian is happily married and has 4 children.  She started her business after losing her job at a nearby gas station.  She loves to cook and help people so her little restaurant was the perfect fit.  Being able to provide a second income for her family makes her feel good.  All of her children are able to attend school and are planning on attending a university.
	
A member of the community bank Juntos Hasta El Final, Mirian is requesting a loan of s/1600 to repay over 6 months.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant meals

loans.name: Mony

texts.en:
Mrs. Mony S. and her husband were married in 1995 and have two daughters. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Mony started weaving silk earlier this year. It’s skill she learned from her neighbor. Before starting this business, she sold vegetables at a market in Phnom Penh. For the past eight years, her husband has made a living as a mason.

She has applied for a loan of $100 to buy silk for weaving.

loans.use: To buy silk for weaving

loans.name: Pele

texts.en:
Pele P., 45, is married with 5 children. She has 4 years of experience in the Bingo business. She sells games to the villagers 5 days per week. Her husband is unemployed but does fishing to support the family.

Pele has had 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about $US250). SPBD loans are Pele’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The entire loan will be used for her business.

loans.use: To purchase prizes such as washing powder, soaps, milk, mosquito coils, and noodles.

loans.name: Sokhbet

texts.en: Sokhbet M. is 46 years old. Together with his wife and three daughters, he lives in the Internally Displaced People's Settlement of the Bilasuvar region. Sokhbet earns income selling milk and yoghurt directly to people in the area, as well as to the local milk factory. He started this business in 1992 and now needs a loan of US$1,200 to purchase two additional milk cows.

loans.use: Purchase of two milk cows

loans.name: Lumor

texts.en: Lumor is 36 years old and single. He has been a general photographer for 10 years and loves his work. He also does glass cutting and shoots video. Lumor owns a photography and video shop where his clients pose for their photographs. He also goes to parties and concerts to take photos of his clients. He requests a loan of $975 to buy additional tools and materials like a new camera, flash, video camera, glass, and other materials to expand his studio. Lumor belongs to the community group called Living Faith Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee the repayment of their loans through pledge.

loans.use: To buy additional cameras and materials for his photography business

loans.name: Talita Dorca

texts.es:
Talita is 27 and the mother of two children, who are both students. She lives with her husband, Luis, who is a professor and is very supportive of her. Talita does housework until midday and in her free time she sells clothing for credit or cash. Wanting to increase her income, she began this business two years ago because she saw it as something she would be able to do and it would also mean extra income for her family. She works every day to supplement her husband's income towards household expenses and especially for her children's education. Talita wants to continue to expand her clothing business and that's why she plans to use the money from this loan to take a trip to purchase what she needs. She hopes you will lend her a hand.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Talita a sus 27 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos, los mismos que estudian, vive junto a su esposo Luis, quien es profesor y la apoya en todo. Talita es trabajadora domestica hasta el medio día, en sus ratos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa al crédito o al contado. A causa de querer incrementar su sustento económico comenzó este negocio hace 2 años porque vio que era factible para ella y significaba un ingreso extra para su familia. Su esfuerzo diario es para apoyar con los gastos a su esposo y sobre todo para la educación de sus hijos. Talita quiere seguir creciendo en este negocio de la venta de ropa, por eso que con el dinero del préstamo planea hacer un viaje y comprar lo necesario, ella espera contar con su apoyo.

loans.use: Travel to the city to purchase a variety of clothing at a lower cost.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes E. sells a local dish called 'Kenkey' which is eaten with fried fish. She prepares this food herself and sells it at Kokoado in Elmina. Agnes has received no formal education. She is divorced and has 3 children.

Agnes has been selling 'Kenkey' since 2000. She is financially responsible for feeding her family and for their utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy maize, fresh fish and other ingredients for the preparation of the kenkey to meet the increase in demand by her growing customer base. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy maize, fresh fish and other ingredients for the preparation of  kenkey

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia, madre abnegada para sus hijos y gran compañera para su esposo, se dedica a las labores de su casa, es madre de 3 hijos que estudian y son su razón de ser. Patricia pertenece al banco comunal las “Las Triunfadoras de las Palmeras”, en  el distrito de Yarinacocha, gracias al apoyo de su IMF está logrando poco a poco sus objetivos.  Sin embargo, la educación de sus hijos es más importante, desea apoyarlos hasta verlos profesionales. Patricia necesita de un préstamo para invertirlo en el gasto educacional de sus hijos, en el  arreglo del motocarro de su pareja Leon, así como también mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Apoyemos a esta madre que lucha duro por sacar adelante a su familia, ella no te defraudara.
texts.en:
Patricia is a self-sacrificing mother for her children and a loving spouse. She works in the home, is the mother of three school-age children and they are her reason for being. Patricia belongs to the village bank "Las Triunfadoras de las Palmeras" in the district of Yarinacocha and thanks to the help of her microfinance institution is achieving her goals little by litt.e Without a doubt, the education of her kids is the most important of those goals and she would like to help them all become professionals. Patricia needs this loan to invest in her children's education, the repair of her husband Leon's car, and also to help make home repairs. Help this mother work hard to improve the lives of her family members and she will not let you down.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational costs for her children.

loans.name: María Leonor

texts.es:
De 41 años de edad y 3 de ellos en la labor de fabricación y venta de calzado, la señora María ha alcanzado la estabilidad deseada laboralmente, siendo ahora su anhelo el lograr una mejor calidad de vida paralelamente, para, así, poder brindarle a sus 2 hijos lo que ella no pudo gozar al provenir de una familia de pocos recursos. Su mayor hijo, de 22 años, estudia y trabaja a la vez, lo que es un gran esfuerzo en pro de su familia misma y, su menor hijo, de 13 años, cursa el colegio. A nivel de la capital, el rubro de calzados es de mucha competencia, por lo que la señora pugna por estar a la vanguardia de los modelos y de los insumos que requiera para éstos, sabiendo, por su experiencia, que aquel esfuerzo es sinónimo de un ulterior éxito. 

Para alcanzar dicha meta, urge de 1000 soles como préstamo, los servirían como bastión para su futura inversión y, por ende, superación, no sólo personal sino también a todo nivel familiar.
texts.en:
At 41 years old, 3 of those spent creating and selling footwear, Señora María has laboriously achieved the stability she sought. Her desire now is to attain a better quality of life in order to provide for her two children the things she could never enjoy, coming from a family with few means of support. Her elder son, 22, studies and works, a great effort for his family, and the younger son, 13, is in school. Financially, the footwear line is very competitive, so this lady strives to be in the forefront with new models and materials, knowing from her experience that such an effort is synonymous with ultimate success. In order to attain this goal, she is requesting a loan of $325, which will be a bulwark against any future reversals, to maintain the level of herself and her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of capital to obtain the supplies for the manufacture of footwear

loans.name: Asa

texts.en:
Asa E. currently sells clothes and sugar and is requesting a loan to buy more clothing to sell. Asa is 28 years old and married. Her husband works in agriculture. She has five children, who are all going to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay for the children's schooling.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y es madre de 5 hijos. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 300 compró frutas y verduras para vender en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi un año trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que ha aumentado sus golosinas para vender en su triciclo, actividad a la que ahora se dedica.
Con este préstamo de S/. 700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en una mayor cantidad de golosinas para vender es su puesto.
Victoria desea continuar trabajando para comprar un local fijo donde vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres de Villa del Lago II" in the district, province, and region of Puno. She is 38 years old, married, and has five children. With her first 300 soles loan she bought fruit and vegetables to sell at her stall. She has been with the communal bank for almost a year and shared with us that she expanded the sales of sweets from her tricycle, which is what she does now. With this 700 soles loan, which will be repaid in four payments, she will invest in more candies to sell from her stall. Victoria wishes to continue working in order to buy a locale where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on sweets

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa I. is twenty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children. She lives together with her children and husband in Offinso, a business and farming community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Hawa’s husband is a commercial driver in their community. She works to help her husband to provide for the family. She is a fish-monger.

Hawa procures smoked fish from Yeji and hawks it house-to-house in her community. She also sells on a table top in the local market square. Hawa procures the fish at wholesale prices. Hawa has been in business for two years. According to her, when she gets a bigger working capital, she can procure fish in bulk and increase her profit margin to help her children through school.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients used to make ice cream, such as sugar, etc.

loans.name: Vorei

texts.en: Vorei C. is 34 years old and lives with her husband in Battambang, Cambodia. She and her husband make and sell cakes at the market to earn approximately US$4 per day. They have four children and all of them are in school. Vorei C. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike so that she can use it as transportation and sometimes her husband can use it to operate a moto-taxi business to earn an extra income. (Her husband is pictured at home.)

loans.use: To operate a moto-taxi business.

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es: Edelmira tiene 64 años, vive con su hijo Javier de 28 años, los 4 restantes ya conformaron sus propias familias. Se dedica a la venta de comida en el pequeño restaurant que puso en su casa y donde atiende a la clientela que viene todos los días para degustar de sus ricos platillos, se viene dedicando a esta actividad desde hace 20 años, vendiendo diferentes platillos como pollo a la parrilla y chicharron, pero como la clientela va en creciente aumento, no se abastece en la atención, además también necesita tiempo para su criadero de cuyes, es por eso que una nuera la ayuda con mucha frecuencia con esto.  Como si fuera poco también ha incursionado en el alquiler de cuartos, ya que sus hijos se fueron dejando las habitaciones vacías, decidió aprovechar y darlas en alquiler. Edelmira espera poder seguir trabajando, ya que como ella dice: aún tiene fuerzas para dar mucho de sí, en el futuro le gustaría tener una bodega donde poder atender a la clientela sin tanto apuro y así entablar buenas amistades. Este es su 3er préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy  puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de alimentos para elaborar más platillos; con el resto del dinero arreglará y pintará algunos cuartos para darlos en alquiler y así lograr mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
64-year old Edelmira lives with her 28-year old son Javier; her four other children have already left home and have their own families. She earns her living by selling food in the small restaurant she has opened in her home. There she attends her customers who come every day to eat her delicious meals. She’s been doing this work for 20 years, serving a variety of dishes such as barbecued chicken and chicharron (traditional pork dish). Now, as her client base is continuing to grow, she does not want to lower the quality of the service she provides. She also needs time to raise guinea pigs. It is for this reason that one of her daughters-in-law often comes to help with this task. As if that weren’t enough, she has also ventured into the business of renting out rooms—when her children left home, they left behind unused rooms, so she decided to take advantage of the situation and rent them out. Edelmira hopes to be able to continue working for some time; as she herself says she still has the strength to do a lot herself, but in the future she would like to have a small store where she can serve customers without rushing around and in the process make some good friends. This is her third loan with Kiva partner, Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has always been very punctual with her repayments. With the loan she will buy a greater quantity of food so she can make more dishes; with the rest of the money she will renovate and paint some rooms to rent out and in this way earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Qantu Huayta Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Qantu Wayta son  D. la comunidad D. Vischongo, Provincia D. VilcasH., esta ubicado a 3 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, a una altitud D. 2900 m.s.n.m., esta comunidad es zona turística por las ruinas del Intihuatana y la laguna D. Intihuatana. La actividad primordial es la agricultura D. papa, maíz, cebada y también a la ganadería.
Gardenia es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo D. 7 años, Gardenia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes y así surtir mas su negocio, Gardenia sueña con ahorrar para salir adelante, mejorar su negocio y que su hijo culmine sus estudios.
Isabel es madre soltera, tiene 02 hijos D. 8, 10 años, Isabel se dedica a la venta D. cereales que compra en su comunidad actividad que aprendió D. pequeña con su mama, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. cereales, los sueño D. Isabel son educar a sus hijos y comprar un molino D. granos.
Saturnina es casada, sus hijos ya son mayores D. edad, Saturnina junto a su esposo compran animales en las diferentes comunidades, luego los benefician, la carne lo comercializa en su comunidad. Con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar mas animales, los sueños D. Saturnina son seguir velando por el bienestar D. sus hijos y ahorrar para la vejez.
texts.en:
The members of the Qantu Wayta community bank are from the Vischonogo community in the Province of VilcasH.. This community is located 3 hours from the Ayacucho city, and is at an altituD. of 2,900 feet above sea level. It is a tourist zone because of the ruins of the Intihuatana and the Intihuatana Lake. Agriculture is the primary activity. This includes growing potatoes, corn, and barley; and raising cattle. Gardenia is a single mother with a 7 year old son. Gardenia has a grocery store in her house. Her loan will be used to buy groceries to better stock her business. Gardenia dreams of saving to get ahead, improving her business, and her son completing his studies. Isabel is a single mother with 2 children, 8 and 10. Isabel sells grains that she buys in the community. When she was little she learned this activity from her mother. Her loan will be used to buy grains. Isabel’s dream is to educate her children and to buy a grain mill. Saturnina is married, and her children are grown. Saturnina and her husband buy animals in different communities. Later, they benefit by selling the meat in their community. They have plans to buy more animals with the loan. Saturnina’s dreams are to continue seeing to the well being of her children and to save for old age.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the members to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Zarif

texts.en:
Y. Zarif is 27 years old. He and his wife are raising three children. Zarif is an experienced bread baker and has been engaged in this business for more than eight years. He bakes the national bread, “lepeshka,” at home, with the help of his wife. Zarif sells the majority of his product from his home, where he has many customers, but he also runs a trading place in the local marketplace, where he sells his ”lepeshka” at market.

Zarif is requesting $600 for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase flour wholesale.

Zarif is grateful to all who choose to support him, and he promises to manage the loan with accuracy and timeliness.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the site of the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing flour wholesale in order to bake lepeshka for sale.

loans.name: Ruku

texts.en:
Mrs. Ruku H. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. It is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in seasonal farming. Mrs. H. lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband Mr. Kul Bahadur H. works in a private office. Her sons are studying in grades 12 and 7 respectively. 

Mrs. H. is a wholesaler in the potato business.  She sells potatoes cheaply in the local market. She buys potatoes from the Kalimati bazaar which is one of the famous wholesale vegetable bazaars of the Kathmandu valley. She has already taken a first loan from Kiva and has cleared her loan. Now Mrs. H. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 30000.00 to buy potatoes for her business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for her business

loans.name: Las Flores De Palmadera Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal  Las Flores D. Palmadera, pertenece a la Comunidad D. Palmadera  ubicada en el distrito D. Acoria, Provincia D. Huancavelica, departamento D. Huancavelica. La mayoría D. la población D. esta zona es activa en la producción y se organizan mancomunadamente, sus producciones se financian en Ayaccocha, Hucro y Huancavelica. La mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

El Bancomunal tiene 17 socias las cuales solicitan prestamos entre 200 y 800 soles para utilizarlos en sus negocios, haciendo un total D. 7,100 soles.

Leonarda, es casada, tiene 3 hijos D. 14, 8 y 6 años, se dedica a la venta D. carne, Leonarda compra chanchos, carneros  y los mata en su casa para vender su carne, en su negocio le ayudan su esposo e hijos. La mayor dificultad que tiene que enfrentar son los huaycos que hay en la región, donD. tiene que financiar nuevamente para su negocio. Solicita un préstamo D. 400 soles para la compra D. ganados y alimentos para los animales. Su sueño es vender al por mayor, para lo cual necesita invertir más dinero. Por ahora está ahorrando para comprar frazadas para sus hijos que estudian fuera D. la localidad.

Angélica, es casada, tiene 5 hijos en edad escolar D. 13, 10, 8, 6 y 2 años, con el primer crédito que recibió hace unos 6 meses compró ropa para sus hijos, no supo invertir en su negocio, solo con una parte compro animales menores que cria en su casa y los vendió poco a poco para pagar su préstamo, por la mala inversión tuvo problemas pero pese a ello se sintió responsable y pagó su primer crédito. Solicita un préstamo D. 800 soles para iniciar su negocio, quiere tener una granja D. gallinas, para poder vender y consumir sus huevos. Le gustaría ahorrar para los arreglos que necesita su casa.
texts.en:
'Las Flores D. Palmadera' (The Flowers of Palmadera) community bank belongs to the community of Palmadera, located in the Acoria district of Huancavelica province, in the department of Huancavelica. The majority of the population in this zone work in production and they organize themselves jointly to finance their work in Ayaccocha, Hucro and Huancavelica. The majority work in agriculture, livestock, and business. The community bank consists of 17 partners who request loans between 200 and 800 PEN to use in their businesses; the sum of all loans is 7,100 PEN. Leonarda is married and has 3 children who are 14, 8, and 6 years old. She sells meat. Leonarda buys pigs and rams; she kills them at her house and sells the meat. Her husband and children help her in the business. The greatest difficulty that she faces is the region's flash floods, often requiring her to rebuild her business. She requests a loan of 400 PEN to buy livestock and feed for the animals. Her dream is to sell wholesale, for which she would need to invest more money. Currently she is saving to buy blankets for her children, who study out of town. Angélica is married and has 5 children who are 13, 10, 8, 6 and 2 years old. With her first loan she received 6 months ago, she bought clothes for her children, not knowing to invest in her business. Only with part of the loan she bought small animals to raise at home and sell, slowly repaying her loan. Because of the bad investment she had problems but in spite of the difficulties she felt responsible and repaid her first loan. She requests another loan of 800 PEN to start her business; she wants to have a chicken farm so she can sell and eat the eggs. She would like to save for the repairs her house needs.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fulfill loan requests between 200 and 800 PEN, to be used in businesses. The total of all loans is 7,100 PEN.

loans.name: Tomas Aquilino

texts.es: El señor Tomas Aquilino López Sánchez , tiene la edad de 42 años , habita en el barrio Denis Larios , junto con su compañera de vida , la cual le poya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos , los tres estudian y le poyan con las actividades del campo, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , don Tomas desde hace 21 años , se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas , el inicio esta actividad agrícola , con sus propios esfuerzos y el de sus padres que le poyaban , los planes hacia un futuro en sus tierras es diversificar sus productos . Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y aplicar al cultivo lo cual espera obtener una buena cosecha. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo de los  préstamo lo cual se beneficia para mejorar sus cultivo como sus vida personal.
texts.en:
Mr. Tomas Aquilino López Sánchez is 42 years old and lives in the neighborhood Denis Larios together with his companion who supports him doing the chores. They have three children, all students who help with the farm activities. The family plans are to improve the conditions of their home. Don Tomas has been a farmer for 21 years and the mayor difficulties he faces are lack of financing and plagues. He started as a farmer with his own efforts and the support of his parents and his future plans are to diversify the crops. With the loan he will buy fertilizers and supplies for the crops and he hopes to get a good harvest. He thanks Afodenic for the support of the loans as he benefits in order to improve his farming as well as his personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers to improve crops

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.es: Brenda  de 38 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, 1 en edad pre-escolar y el otro que estudia primaria, se desempeña como asesor pedagogico en el MINED de Santo Tomas desde hace 9 años, esta solicitando su 1er credito para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, como es compra de 2 puertas para las habitaciones y tener mayor privacidad, ademas desea terminar de poner la ceramica a la sala de su casa.  Brenda es muy querida por sus compañeras de trabajo, sueña con poder tener una vivienda con las condiciones basicas para que sus hijos crezcan en un ambiente alegre.
texts.en:
38-year old Brenda is single and has two children, a pre-schooler aged one and another child who goes to primary school. She has been working as an educational advisor in the Ministry of Education of Santo Tomas for nine years. This will be her first loan, and she plans to use the money to make improvements to her house such as buying two doors for the bedrooms so there is more privacy. She also wants to finish putting in ceramic tile on the floor of the living room. Brenda is much liked by her work colleagues. Her dream is to have a home with all the basic necessities so that her children can grow up in a nice environment.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to tile her living room floor and buy doors

loans.name: Tol

texts.en:
Miss. S. Tol, age 31, is single. She lives with her mother and brothers and sister on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her mother is 67 years old; however, she is still able to run own business selling dessert.

S. has been a silk weaver for over ten years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. 

S. is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for her sister for commuting to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her sister to drive to work

loans.name: Sandra Marina

texts.es: Sandra Marina A. D. M.  vive en el municipio D. Cuscatancingo del departamento D. San Salvador. Sandra vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando. Maximiliano el esposo D. Sandra es empleado y aporta al hogar $250.00 US. Sandra posee una panadería hace diez años, en la panadería se elabora todo tipo D. pan dulce el cual es distribuido en la zona, el anhelo  D. Sandra es poder sacar mayor producción D. su pan, motivo por el cual solicita este crédito con el que  Sandra pretenD. comprar materia prima que le ayuda a incrementar su producción D. pan y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Marina A. D. M. lives in the town of Cuscatancingo in the District of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and three children, who are students. Her husband, Maximiliano, is employed and brings home $250 USD.

Sandra has operated a bakery for the past 10 years. She makes all kinds of sweet breads that are distributed throughout the area.

Sandra wants to increase her bread production. For this reason, she has requested a loan to purchase ingredients for making larger quantities of bread so that she can earn more money for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a member of the KDC borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 27 year old woman, she is single.

Flora has owned a cafe business selling food 1 year. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Flora second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more  cooking oil, wheat flour for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Flora hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat  flour, cooking oil

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva M. is from the village of Sta. Maria Tangub City. She is 50 years old. Nieva is married and has 5 school-age children. To make a living, Nieva owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a "mais" corn products business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising and selling crops. Nieva has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nieva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nieva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nieva is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nieva from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to help with the family's daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia A. is a seaweed grower. She has grown seaweed to be able to buy her family food, clothes and other needs. She has seven children. The income she makes from her seaweed farm is what her family depends on for living every day.

She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy seaweed seedlings. The loan will help her achieve better income to support the education of her children as well.

loans.use: To purchase seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Archill

texts.en:
Archill A. is from the village of Purok 2 Inobulan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old. Archill is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Archill owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Archill has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Archill joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Archill is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Archill from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
Mrs. Solita V. and her husband live harmoniously in a village located at Barangay Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. They are gifted with five children, two males and three females. Despite their education, they aim to improve their status of living. They help each other earn a living and support the schooling of their children. As a result of their patience and sacrifice, three of their children graduated from college and presently work abroad and the other two are busy managing their respective businesses.

Despite her age, Solita wants to continue to manage her small eatery while her husband manages their parcel of land by planting rice and vegetables. Every week, she earns a net income of PHP800, which they use for their daily needs and save for their future. She wants to improve her small business so she can earn a higher income. Thus, she applied for a loan from KIVA lenders of PHP5,000 to improve her small business and to maintain their crop production.

loans.use: Additional capital to improve her small eatery

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
J. Davaasuren is 46 years old and lives with her husband and son in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son, Gantulga, is 20 years old and a university student. Davaasuren operates a clothes-trading business out of a rented stall in a local market in her town. She runs her business during the day and her husband drives a taxi at night to add to the family's income. Davaasuren started her clothing business in 2003 and has gained much experience over the years. She has used her success to expand her operation and develop many sales channels in her local area. Davaasuren is very hardworking and is always striving to reach her goals. She says, "My main business objective is to supply quality products to the market." She has applied for a 2,000,000 tugrug (~$1,400 USD) loan to import clothes from China to sell. 

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January, 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

loans.use: to import clothes from China to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella V. is from the village of Alibagu,Ilagan,Isabela. She is 46 years old, married, and has children.

Estrella owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month with these activities.

In 2008, Estrella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third loan taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jorge Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Roberto B. E. es originario de san Juan de Limay comunidad de tranquera se le otorgo un crédito para la compra de  tres novillos de engorde su negocio comenzó con la siembra de sorgo y maíz trabajando con su papa luego se dedico a comprar toretes para engorde que es una de las principales actividades a las que se dedica por ahora. 

 Roberto a trabajado en este negocio desde hace mas de 10 años trabaja todos los días además todavía se dedica la siembra de sorgo y maíz en época de invierno el cual le genera mas ingresos para comprar animales, el espera que con e crédito le vaya muy bien para seguir trabajando. Jorge es casado y tiene dos hijos menores de edad ambos están estudiando primaria sus pedrés viven en una casa aledaña a la de el  cual se mantiene al pendiente de ellos.

Este es el segundo crédito que se le otorga en un periodo de dos años. Don Jorge expresa que le a ido muy bien con el crédito y piensa obtener mayores ganancias con este que se le otorgo para seguir creciendo y poder darle una mejor vida  a sus hijos a través del estudio y de esta forma tener una mejor condición de vida para su familia
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge Roberto B. E. is a native of the gated community of San Juan de Limay. He was granted a loan in order to purchase three steers for fattening. He started his business planting sorghum and corn and worked with his father. Later he decided to buy bulls for fattening, which is one of the businesses he now operates.

Jorge has worked in this business every day for over the past ten years. He still spends time planting sorghum and corn during the winter season in order to generate income to buy more animals. He hopes his loan will be invested well so that he can continue working. Jorge is married and has two young children who are in elementary school. He parents live in the house next door so that he can continue to look after them.

This is the second loan he has received within the past two years. Don Jorge says his experience with his previous loan went very well and was able to generate better earnings. It enabled him to continue growing and provide a better life for his children through their education. Likewise, he was able to provide better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase steers for fattening

loans.name: Julia Candelaria

texts.es: Doña Julia Candelaria T. Vásquez  cuenta con 34 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante, “Venta de Papas Fritas” cuenta con una carreta de papas fritas, habita junto a sus 4 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un empleado para la misma actividad, lleva 13 años de laborar en su comercio que se encuentra en el Paraje Paquechop, Cantón Xesacmaljá , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Julia Candelaria T. Vásquez is 34 years old and married. She has a business selling French fries, with her own sales cart. She lives with her husband and 4 children. She and her husband work together and have an employee to help them. For the past 13 years, they have worked in this business, which is located in Paraje Paquechop, in the canton of Xesacmaljá, Department of Totonicapán, Guatemala, Currently, the demand from her customers has been rising, but the current economic conditions have not been favorable enough to allow her to increase her capital. For this reason, she came to the ASDIR Association to request a loan, with the aim of purchasing supplies, and thus increasing her sales, while hoping also to help her children get ahead and provide them with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing supplies

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 40-year-old married man and has three children. He has worked since 1998 in selling curtains and tablecloths. He started this kind of job after seeing a need for such services in the region and by working on a traveling basis he easily reaches his clients.

Today, Mohamad is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy more inventory so as to continue to cater to his clientele and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma H. is from the village of Maras in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 43 years old and married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a general store. Emma has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month fromthese activities. 

In 2008, Emma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Emma is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Emma's fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
