About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina G., 40, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. Married to Ador G., an employee, she makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own sidewalk stall for quite some time now.

Gina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow eleven times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.

Now, with your help, Gina would like to obtain a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries and expanding her business.

Gina dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can finally have her own grocery store.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and expand her business

loans.name: Mauricio De Jesus

texts.es:
El Señor MAURICIO DE JESUS M. Z., Labora como oficial de mantenimiento en el mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua, es casado y padre de  tres Hijos a los que tiene en el colegio ella junto con su esposo han podido sacar a delate la familia.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación  de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mauricio de Jesús M. Z. works as a maintenance official in the Iván Montenegro market in Managua. He is married and has three children. The children are in school. He and his wife have been able to get their family ahead. The requested loan is to buy construction materials to remodel his home. His goal is to give his family greater security and to give his children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enlarge and improve his house

loans.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en:
Munawar is 51-year old woman, residing in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 
Munawar belongs to a poor family. Her parents couldn’t provide her with a good education, but they given her the talent of making embroidery on clothes. She started preparing embroidery, after her marriage, to spend her free time in an activity. But later on she has chosen it as a profession. Now she is making a good benefit from it. She is a very hard working lady. She prepares embroidered dresses on order and generates income. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. 
She is a mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her first two sons run a tailoring shop. The other two work in a local factory on a monthly wage. Her daughter is 15 years old and helps her in her decorative embroidery business. 
Her husband's name is B. H.. He runs a fruit selling business in the market. Their earnings allow them to meet the financial expenses of their family. 
Munawar has successfully repaid her two loans to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for the third time to purchase the seasonal fruits in bulk to expand her husband’s fruit selling business.

loans.use: To purchase fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married. She runs a small business selling cups, vases and other ceramic items. Her business is located at the central market in Zaporozhye. This good location brings in many customers and makes her business a success. Nataliya has been in this business for 12 years.
The business brings a stable income to Nataliya's family. She can even help her children's families. Her goal is to develop the business further, rent a larger facility and begin selling items in bulk. She would like to borrow 7,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and earn additional income.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon A. is from the village of Sta.Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Corazon is separated from her spouse and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products like pants, t-shirts, candies, etc. in the local community. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Corazon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Corazon from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura E. is from the village of  Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Laura is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Laura owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Laura has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Laura joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Laura is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Laura from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rich

texts.en:
Rich T. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. He is 29 years old. Rich is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Rich owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Rich has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rich joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rich has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rich is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rich from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials to change the roof of his house and personal expenses

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: La Señora Erika se encuentra en su tercera secuencia, ella tiene una tienda en la zona de Kellumani que se encuentra cerca de la zona  de Achumani en la zona sur de la ciudad de la paz, por las noches se dedica a la venta de salchipapas, ella vive en la casa de su mamá, juntamente con el esposo y sus tres hijos, dos de los cuales asisten a la escuela, el pequeño se queda con la mama, el esposo quien es transportista de minibús del sindicato 14 de septiembre ayuda con los gastos del hogar,  la señora además adquirió recientemente un punto viva, y por la actividad en la atención del negocio ella se encuentra allí todo el día, es una familia joven y muy responsable con los pagos de su crédito, con el dinero del crédito quiere surtir su tiendita comprando mercadería como ser regalos, abarrotes, aceite, refrescos, dulces, galletas, etc, es muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado..
texts.en:
Mrs. Erika is currently in her third loan cycle. She has a store in the zone of Kellumani near the zone of Achumani in the southern part of the city of La Paz. At night she sells salchipapas (French fries with fried hot dogs). She lives in her mother's house with her husband and their three children. Two of their children attend school, and their youngest stays home with her. Her husband works driving a bus and helps with the expenses of the home. She recently acquired a new post, and she works at that business all day. Her family is young and very responsible with their loan payments. With the loan money she wants to stock her little store by purchasing merchandise such as gifts, groceries, oil, soft drinks, candy, cookies, etc. She is very hard-working and very thankful to the institution for the support given her.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn K. is a villager in Prey Chheu Teal Village, Takeo Province. She is 45 years old. She is the mother of four children. One of her children is a jeweler. The others attend school and they help their parents with their businesses.

She and her husband, Mr. Chhorn Chrek, are farmers who own a 1.5 hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice. They sell the rice to support their family.

Mrs. Vorn K. is also a pig breeder and her husband is also a construction worker. Since her business of breeding pigs is going well, she wants to expand the business. To achieve this goal, Mrs. Vorn K. is asking for a loan to buy more piglets. With the rest of the loan, she will purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise and fertilizer

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en:
These are women with small-scale businesses in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will each be able to add more stock to their business, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living, send their children to school, and feed and clothe them.

Saffie C. is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. She is age thirty and is married with three children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending primary school.

Saffie sells used clothes, shoes, palm-oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil), and rice. She has been managing this business for fifteen years now. She will invest her share of the loan in her business, buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock. 

Attached to the photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, palm-oil and rice in large quantity

loans.name: Jane Pearl

texts.en:
When Jane Pearl, who is single, became a member of Kiva's field partner, Ahon Sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she found that she not only received capital from them, but also her second family in her group mates. That is why she enjoys being a part of it.

This, her 4th loan, will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store. She will buy different groceries and many other items that are needed for her business. Sari-sari stores basically sell small quantities of various foodstuffs, grocery items and beverages. Such stores are convenient for people in the village who live far from the market place.

Jane Pearl’s business has been very helpful in achieving her family's dreams. Her greatest hope is that her family will be able to have a good life, as it currently lives in poverty. Her long term goals are to invest and build a better house for the family and to have a full-fledged mini-grocery store.

loans.use: To buy different groceries and many items that are needed for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transportation costs.

For over ten years, she has operated her vegetable stall. Se also sells clothes at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. Nyamvula faces a challenge of high transportation costs incurred when transporting vegetables from the rural areas to her place of operation.  She hopes to establish a grocery shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase stock of vegetables and fruits and to expand her vegetable stall. She decided to join Yehu because of its low interest rates and friendly loan products.

loans.use: To purchase stock of vegetables, fruits and to expand her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. is from the village of Simimbaan. She is 53 years old. Teresita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna M. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 44 years old. Edna is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. She hopes for her business to improve.

Edna is requesting to loan Php 17000. She will use it to purchase feeds and other supplies she needs for raising pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha N. has been married for more than 30 years and has four daughters. Two of them are married; one sells silk goods in the village, and the other attends school. Sokha is a silk weaver. She has asked for Kiva loans twice, and is now asking for another loan of $100 pay school fees (English class) for her daughter.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama S. is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Ama sells firewood and liquid soap in Takoradi. She assists her husband to provide the basic needs for the family. Ama will use the loan to purchase more firewood for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for sale

loans.name: Tsermaa

texts.en:
Tsermaa T. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and her three children in her own house with a fence in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her younger son is a university student and her older son operates a taxi service business. Her husband is a private businessman. 

Tsermaa and her husband started their old book selling business in 2002 after moving from the countryside to Ulaanbaatar.  She rented a space outside the  Achlal department store for 100000 MNT a month and sells all kinds of a rare books, schoolbooks, dictionaries and textbooks of foreign languages. 

Tsermaa is requesting a 1000000 MNT loan to buy a greater variety of books for her book selling business.

loans.use: To buy more books

loans.name: Briceida Urania

texts.es: Briceida Urania se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación. Ha demostrado que tiene mucho empeño de salir adelante. Inicio este medio de vida porque tenía 2 hijos a su cargo a quienes tenía que brindarles alimentos, educación y vestimenta. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio que con mucho esfuerzo logro sacar adelante. Este crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes.
texts.en: Briceida Urania sells new and used clothes.  She has been a client of Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time and has shown a lot of determination to get ahead in life.  She started out in this line of work because she had two children in her care for whom she had to provide food, education and clothing.  She has owned her business for more than 10 years and has managed, through a lot of effort, to make progress in it.  This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, skirts and dresses.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 35-year-old craftsman who is a member of the Kibera Upendo group with Faulu Kenya. For the past ten years, he has run Samuel Crafts to earn a living. Samuel makes bangles, rings, necklaces, and spoons made of bones. So far, he has managed to employ two people in his business. 

Samuel is requesting a loan of 25,000 KES to buy a bench cylinder and raw materials such as bones. Using previous loans through Faulu Kenya, Samuel has improved his business. In the future, he hopes to open other business outlets.

loans.use: to buy a bench cylinder and raw materials

loans.name: Tes

texts.en:
Tes B., 44, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. B. is a farmer, earning an income of $0.50 per day. Her four children are employed at the garment factory, earning an income of $2.50 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $20 on food and $80 on the other necessary expenses. 

B. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba E. sells cassava, plantain and other food stuffs in Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi.  She has been in this business for six years. 
She is married and has four children. Her income supplements her husband’s, who is a labourer. 

Aba plans to purchase more cassava and other food stuffs that her customers have requested. Her profits as a result of the loan will be used to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava and other food stuffs.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel tiene 53 años, es casado y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad. El señor tiene un taller de carpintería ubicado en su casa de habitación en el cual elabora puertas, sillas, comedores. Don Miguel dio inicio a su negocio hace 15 años, el señor se dedicaba a esta actividad desde su niñez pues fue por su hermano que aprendió el oficio. Cuando dio inicio el señor no tenía muchas herramientas y fue con el tiempo que empezó a hacerse de  su capital para comprar tanto madera como sus artículos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima como madera, junco, maque, alcohol, tela, herramientas, para cumplir compromisos de pedidos que actualmente tienen pendientes.
texts.en:
Señor Miguel, age 53, is married and has three adult children. He has a carpentry workshop located in his house in which he makes doors, chairs, and dining room sets. Don Miguel began his business 15 years ago. He has been involved in carpentry since childhood. He learned the trade from his brother.

When he began, Don Miguel didn’t have many tools. With the passage of time, he began to build up the capital needed to buy the wood required for his products. The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials such as wood, reeds, lacquer, alcohol, cloth, and tools in order to meet commitments for orders that are currently pending.

loans.use: to purchase wood, reeds, lacquer, alcohol, cloth and tools.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
En la Cuenca del Papaluapan existe una comunidad llamada Paso Rincon la cual se caracteriza por ser productora de limon, en este lugar existe la costumbre de que toda la familia trabaja en la cosecha desde los hijos hasta los padres y abuelos.

La señora Rosa R. P. es una habitante de esta comunidad y  nos dice " Desde que yo me case mi esposo me enseño a trabajar en el cultivo del limon y como han hido cresiendo mis hijos se les ha enseñado, es un trabajo que me gusta mucho por dos razones una porque nos une como familia cada vez que cosechamos ya que vamos juntos a trabajar y el segundo los pesos(dinero) que ganamos con nuestro trabajo"

Ella nos platica que en hay temporadas como las de Diciembre que el limon les deja buena gancia pero tambien hay temporadas bajas para las cuales deben preparase con ahorros. 

Tambien nos dijo que ella sale a vender su limon con su esposo en el mercado de una comunidad cercana llamada Tres Valles.

Doña Rosa va invertir este credito  en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para sus limonal .
texts.en:
In Cuenca del Papaluapan there is a community called Paso Rincón, which is known for producing limes. In this area there exists a tradition of the whole family working in the harvest, including the children, the parents, and even the grandparents.

Rosa R. P. lives in this community and she tells us “When I got married, my husband taught me to work in lime farming, and as my children have grown, he has taught them too. I like this work very much for two reasons. The first is because it unites us as a family each time we harvest because we work together. The second reason is the money we earn from our work."

She tells us that there are high seasons, like in December, when limes bring them good earnings. However, there are also low seasons for which they must prepare with savings. 

She also tells us that she goes with her husband to sell their limes in the market of a nearby community called Tres Valles.

Rosa will use her loan to buy fertilizers for her lime trees.

loans.use: to cultivate limes

location.town: Paso Rincon, San Juan Bautista Tuxtepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase an electric tailoring machine in order to be able to sew more modern cloths

loans.name: Roselen

texts.en:
Roselen is 38 years old and married with two children.  She runs a sari-sari store (a small general store) and works hard to provide for her family.  She has requested a loan of 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan from Kiva field partner NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her shop.

Before this loan, Roselen borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF. She has been running her sari-sari store for two years and also earns income from frozen foods, being a cosmetics dealer, and raising livestock.  She aspires to save money to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as  shampoo and groceries to sell at a small general store

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia una mujer muy trabajadora desde hace 8 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social como es sabido este tipo de casas son muy pequeñas y no tienen la suficiente protección en la parte de enfrente, por lo que ella se ve en la necesidad de construir en la parte frontal una barda para ofrecer a sus 2 hijos mayor seguridad al momento de que salen jugar al patio. Para poder levantar la barda en su vivienda necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra.
Sonia y su esposo trabajan en maquiladora y algunas ocasiones se quedan tiempo extra para ganar más dinero para el sostén familiar.
texts.en:
Sonia is a hard working woman.  She and her husband work in a factory and sometimes work extra hours to earn more money to take care of their family.  Eight years ago she acquired subsidized housing, and as is known, these types of houses are very small and they are not well protected in the front.  For that reason, she feels that it is necessary to construct a fence in front of her house in order to offer greater protection to her 2 children when they are playing in the yard.  

In order to build the fence in front of her house, she needs to buy construction materials and pay for the labor.

loans.use: build a protective fence for her home.

loans.name: Liliam Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 30 años de edad y vive con su esposo y 2 pequeños hijos en una pequeña comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. Esta comunidad no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y su actividad principal es la agricultura y ganadería.

Elizabeth se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino y aves de corral, esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 4 años en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuenta con corrales apropiados y clientela ya establecida en la zona. Su esposo es agricultor con parcela propia en la cual siembra maíz y alquila para sembrar arroz.

Elizabeth solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales pues estos deben tener mejor tamaño y peso para que valgan más. Así mismo Elizabeth utilizará parte del préstamo para adquirir bienes personales.

Elizabeth es una cliente conocida de nuestra entidad que presenta un buen récord de pagos y goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Elizabeth tiene 30 años de edad y vive con su esposo y 2 pequeños hijos en una pequeña comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. Esta comunidad no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y su actividad principal es la agricultura y ganadería.

Elizabeth se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino y aves de corral, esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 4 años en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuenta con corrales apropiados y clientela ya establecida en la zona. Su esposo es agricultor con parcela propia en la cual siembra maíz y alquila para sembrar arroz.

Elizabeth solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales pues estos deben tener mejor tamaño y peso para que valgan más. Así mismo Elizabeth utilizará parte del préstamo para adquirir bienes personales.

Elizabeth es una cliente conocida de nuestra entidad que presenta un buen récord de pagos y goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales.

loans.use: Comprar alimento balanceado y adquirir bienes personales.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 56 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children.

Carmelita has operated a mini grocery store at home for two years, selling all types of food and refreshments. She earns PHP 4,000 per month from this business. She noticed that this is an excellent enterprise for non-working mothers. Carmelita wants to have additional capital to continue this business, so she has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to purchase stock to sell.

Carmelita has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years. In the future, Carmelita wants to expand her store and have a grocery store in her town.

loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 35 years old, married to Joyce and a father of three school-going children aged 15 years, 11 years and seven years. He has owned a garage where he does mechanical work on cars for the past 13 years and earns an income of KES 30,000 per month.

This is Gerald's first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use the loan to buy spares parts, oils, and machines for the business. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and ensure improved services from his garage.

In future he hopes to grow his business and own a big garage in the city.

loans.use: To buy spare parts, oils and machines for mechanic work

loans.name: Rosas De Mercedes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE MERCEDES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Hilaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de galletas y dulces, tienda comercial, albañilería, cerrajería, ayudante de albañil, venta de comida.

La señora Hilaria,  indica que esta es la primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora y su hija. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando desde hace mucho tiempo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de verduras), que compraran por mayor de la ceja y posterior a la elaboración lo venderá en la cancha de su zona. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y la verificación en el consultorio de salud.

En la fotografia existen dos acompañantes de la Banca comunal son familiares de las socias, pero se colocaron en la parte de atras
texts.en:
The “Rosas de Mercedes” community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Hilaria.  The businesses that the members of the group are engaged in are varied and include: selling cookies and sweet treats, a store, construction work, locksmith, builder's assistant and selling food.

Hilaria tells us that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She joined through an invitation from a loan officer and her daughter.  She currently has a business selling food and she has been working in this business for a long time.

Hilaria will use this loan to increase her capital (buying vegetables).  She will buy them wholesale in La Ceja and, when she has made her food, she will sell it at the sports field in her area.  This work allows Hilaria to make money to support her family.  She is married and has six children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training and the check-ups in the health clinic.

* In the photo, there are two people who were accompanying members of the community bank.  They are family members but they stood at the back of the photo.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana tiene  44  años de edad, ella es viuda y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, cuenta con casa propia en la que vive con sus hijos, su casa esta ubicada en un caserío, en el distrito de Morropón, departamento de Piura,

Sabastiana se dedica a la venta de cerveza  y harina molida para la preparación de  chicha (bebida oriunda del Perú, preparada en base a maíz y harina), ella cuenta con una experiencia de 6 años en este negocio, y a adquirido experiencia y clientela fija para sus negocio.

Sabastiana esta solicitando un préstamo a  Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para que ella pueda ampliar sus negocio, comprando más cerveza y maíz en grandes cantidades, para procesarlo y convertirlo en harina

Sebastiana es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 44. She is widowed and has 2 grown children. She has her own home where she lives with her children. Her home is located in a hamlet in the Morropon district, Piura department.

Sebastiana sells beer and milled flour for making Chicha (a traditional Peruvian corn-and-flour-based drink). She has 6 years' experience with this business, and has gained experience and a fixed customer base for her business.

Sebastiana is requesting a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can expand her business, buying more beer and corn in large quantities, to process and convert to flour.

Sebastiana is a very diligent and hard-working person. Her greatest wish is to keep growing as a businesswoman and to be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more beer and corn in large quantities.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor de 54 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual  es propia y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Pacasmayo que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la pesca y al turismo (es un balneario que tiene playas muy bonitas) .

Víctor labora desde hace 4 años realiza servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) la cual trabaja diariamente mañana y tarde, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá solventar sus gastos y necesidades familiares.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1200 nuevos soles y su destino será para realizar mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi que está presentando algunas fallas mecánicas, al encontrarse su unidad móvil en buen estado podrá brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes y aumentarán sus ingresos.  Víctor es un padre de familia trabajador y responsable que con empeño ha sabido sacar adelante a su familia poco a poco, algo que lo tiene muy alegre y orgulloso.
texts.en:
Victor is 54 years old and lives with his family in their own home. They receive all the basic services. Victor resides in the urban section of the District of Pacasmayo, which is part of the Department of La Libertad. The residents of this district engage in trades such as fishing and tourism (there is a resort with very beautiful beaches).

For the past four years, Victor has provided public transportation services using his motorcycle taxi (a vehicle that is used for traveling short distances and has a maximum occupancy of three people). He works every day in the mornings and afternoons. With the income that he earns, Victor is able to cover his expenses and the needs of his family.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN and will use the money to pay for maintenance and repairs to his motorcycle taxi, which has been experiencing a few mechanical failures. Victor needs his vehicle to be in good condition so that he can provide excellent service to his customers and increase his earnings.

Victor is a hardworking and responsible father who has been able to move his family forward a little bit at a time, an accomplishment that makes him happy and proud.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance and repairs to his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a dedicated 28-year-old businessman. He is single. For the last 10 years, he has been operating a barber shop so as to make a living. Previously, he used to sell various assorted merchandise. He wants, in the next 5 years, to be a well-known entrepreneur and his dream is to be an influential businessman. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy two shaving machines and open another barber shop. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now self-reliant.

loans.use: To buy two shaving machines and open another barber shop

loans.name: Ngai's Group

texts.en:
Ngai was born in 1970 and lives in Nhoi Duoi village, Co Loa commune. She is married with three children. Ngai and her family have a shop where they sell glass and aluminum, and also manufacture aluminum doors. She and her husband work producing doors from aluminum and glass. They earn a monthly income of about 7,000,000 VND. Ngai has had her job for many years and has borrowed previously from SEDA to improve her business. Ngai will use her 7,194,000 VND portion of this group loan to buy glass and aluminum to make the doors.

Other borrowers in her group are Be and Xuan. Be is 27 years old and has two children. She will use her 6,322,000 VND portion of this group loan to invest in her restaurant. Xuan is 23 years old. She will use her 6,322,000 VND portion of this group loan to buy shoes to sell in her shoe shop.

loans.use: to buy glass and aluminum to make doors

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
53-year-old Van lives with her two daughters in Ho Chi Minh City. Van has supported her family by running a general store for nine years. She sells confectionery, cheese, lighters, cigarettes, and different kinds of snacks to people in her community. This work provides her and her family with a daily income to meet the family's basic living expenses.

Van would like to take out a loan to expand her business by purchasing a larger quantity and range of basic foods and goods to sell to her customers from her general store. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family and save for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity and range of basic foods and goods to sell from her general store.

loans.name: Jorge Alejandro

texts.es: Jorge Alejandro tiene su negocio que es la pesca artesanal. Hace más de 6 años que Jorge es el encargado de su propia actividad. Inicio desde muy joven pues trabajaba como ayudante en botes pesqueros, fue así que el ahorro en ciertas ganancias y logro compra su propio bote. Él tiene 9 hijos de los cuales solamente 3 están bajo su cargo, y con esfuerzo de su trabajo los ha sacado adelante. El crédito es para la ecompra de motor y combustible.
texts.en: Jorge Alejandro has an artisan fishing business which he has been running for over six years.  When he was very young he used to work as a fishing boat assistant and was able to save enough money to buy his own boat.  He has nine children three of which are still in his care.  Through his work he has been able to support his family.  The loan he is requesting is to buy a motor and fuel.

loans.use: To buy a motor and fuel.

loans.name: Gulbaara's Group

texts.en:
Gulbaara is the leader of this group.  She is 56 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised four children; two older sons are married and live separately with their families, the third son works in Korea and the youngest son is in Russia. 

Gulbaara works as a librarian, and when she has free time she is engaged wholesaling fruits and vegetables. In this way she earns about 4000 soms per month. She saved some money to start repairing her house, but she needs additional funds to purchase building materials, and for this purpose she has applied for the loan. In the future Gulbaara plans to open her own grocery store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS DE RUMICHACA ALTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emiliana; ella tiene 74 años de edad y es casada y tiene 8 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha (es una bebida a base de maíz), ella prepara chicha y luego lo vende en su casa desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, por medio de este pequeño trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y jora para preparar la chicha. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Manos Juntas de Rumichaca Alta Communal Bank, which is located in the Urubamba district of the province by the same name, department of Cusco.

She is Ms. Emiliana, a 74-year-old married mother of 8. She alternates her daily chores with her chicha (a maize drink) business. She prepares the chicha, then sells it from home from 8:00 am until 4:00 pm. Through this small business, she is able to help her children get ahead. She would like to expand and improve her chicha business. The member is requesting a loan in order to purchase maize and jora (fermented maize) to prepare the chicha drink. Ms. Emiliana is happy about the loan, and she commits to repaying it back on time.

loans.use: to purchase fresh maize and fermented maize for chicha drink preparation.

loans.name: Diana Alexandra

texts.es:
Diana Alexandra tiene 19 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC Vuelve la Esperanza está conformada por 13 socios y socias, está ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la Oficina.
Diana se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, soya, cacao, plátano las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, insumos, urea, abonos agrícolas, líquidos para la maleza para los cultivos.
Con la ayuda del crédito mejorara  y aumentará la producción agrícola para obtener mejores ingresos.
El sueño es llegar a tener una finca y animales.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta diariamente es la competencia entre comerciantes, vías de comunicación.
En los tiempos libres le gusta caminar y disfrutar de los carnavales del sector.
texts.en:
Diana Alexandra, 19, is single.  She has no children and lives with her parents in Chillanes, a town in Bolivar province.
The Vuelve la Esperanza community bank has 13 members.  It is located in the parish of San Jose del Tambo, some 60 minutes from our office.
Diana Alexandra has a farming business.  She grows maize, soybeans, cacao and platanos.  She buys and sells the supplies she needs, every weekend, at San Jose del Tambo.
Diana Alexandra will use this loan to buy seed, fertilizers, organic manure, weed killer and other supplies.
The loan will help her to increase her output and, in turn, her income.
Diana Alexandra's long-term goal is to have a farm and live-stock business of her own.
The main challenges she faces are stiff competition from other farmers and the roads to market.
In her free time, Diana Alexandra likes to take walks and go to local carnivals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Narcisa es socia del banco comunal Sentimientos, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, es la tercera ciudad más importante del País, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, es una ciudad de gente amable y de un corazón muy cálido.

La Señora. Narcisa tiene 45 años, es madre soltera y ha concebido 6 hijos de 25, 23, 20, 18, 16 y 12 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, dos de sus hijos trabajan para sus gastos personales y sus tres últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Narcisa se dedica al comercio de todo tipo de ropa, actividad que realiza hace 20 años, trabaja solo tres días a la semana y sin un horario fijo, los demás días se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y al hogar.

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir para comprar blusas, camisetas, pantalones y ropa de niños para  surtir su mercadería.
 
Su meta es  tener un local para vender comida rápida.
texts.en:
Sra. Narcisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Sentimientos” (Feelings). She lives in the neighborhood of Miraflores in the city of Cuenca, which is surrounded by four rivers. It is the third largest city in Ecuador. The people have maintained the culture and traditions of their ancestors. Cuenca is a city full of friendly people who possess very warm hearts.

Sra. Narcisa is 45 years old and a single mother with six children (ages 25, 23, 20, 18, 16, and 12). Her oldest daughter is married and lives independently. Two of her children work in order to cover their personal expenses. Her three youngest children attend a high school in the city. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

Doña Narcisa has been selling all types of clothing for 20 years. She only works three days a week and does not have a set schedule. On the other days, she takes care of her children and her home.

This is her second loan with the Communal Bank. She will invest the money in the purchase of blouses, shirts, trousers, and children’s clothing so that she can restock with more merchandise. Her goal is to have a shop where she can sell fast food.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, trousers, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Thung

texts.en: Mrs. Thung, 44, is a resident from Pouk District, Siem Reap Province. She is a widow and a mother of three single children. One of her children is working as a laborer in a nearby country, Thailand. Her son always got along with her and sends a part of his salary home every month. The other two are students who live under her income. Mrs. Thung has operated a pig-raising business for 11 years. She is an experienced pig raiser. This year, Mrs. Thung wants to enlarge her wooden piggery and to purchase more piglets to raise. She hopes that this project will earn her a good income. Now she is seeking a loan from Kiva partner, HKL to achieve her project. For the future, she wishes to expand this business and to have a medium sized pig farm.

loans.use: to enlarge her wooden piggery and to purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Elvia Marina

texts.es:
Doña Elvia tiene 50 años de edad, vive en Guasaule Choluteca, es una mujer emprendedora y  dedicada a su negocio, que es la venta  de ropa  nueva, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, su negocio lo  tiene ubicado  en  frontera con Nicaragua. sus clientes son personas que viajan de Honduras a Nicaragua y viceversa, todos los dias se levanta bien temprano para abrir su negocio.
Elvia es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad, y en algunas ocasiones le ayudan economicamente.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa al por mayor, con esto obtiene mejores precios y mas ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Elvia en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia.
texts.en: Elvia, 50, lives in Guasaule, Choluteca.  She’s an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business which is new clothes sales.  She’s been in this line of work for several years.  The business is located on the border with Nicaragua and her customers are people who travel from Honduras to Nicaragua and vice versa.  She rises quite early every day to open her store.  Elvia is the mother of three children who are all adults now; they sometimes help her out economically.  She will use the loan to buy clothes at wholesale because she gets them at better prices that way and earns higher profits that she needs to cover household expenses.  In her free time, Elvia goes to church.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothes.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is a 42-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She and her husband run a fishing business. Fishing is the main source of income for Andresa's family. Andresa does her best to improve their business and keep her family healthy.

Andresa has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and other materials. Andresa hopes to have another source of income. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials

loans.name: Virginia Ester

texts.es: Virginia, está decidida a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para darle continuidad al fortalecimiento de su negocio, comprando productos para la elaboración de meriendas como lo son aceite, frijoles, azúcar, cacao, para mantener siempre un buen nivel de productos para elaborar los menus a diario. Ella considera que sus ganancias han sido mejores y que sus clientes también han aumentado.
texts.en: Virginia is determined to apply for a new loan to continue to build her business. She will purchase products used in the preparation of snacks such as oil, beans, sugar and cocoa, so that she can maintain a good supply of products and develop daily menus. Virginia states that her earnings have improved and the amount of customers has also increased.

loans.use: to purchase oil, beans, sugar and cocoa for preparing snacks.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy is single, 29 years old and residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Roy is operating a service-based business providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been 5 years in this business. Each month he earns 5,600 doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 30,000 to purchase additional vehicle spare parts and accessories.  In 2008, Roy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. In the future, Roy wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Kareemeh

texts.en:
Kareemeh is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and her five children in Gaza. With this big family, she thought she would do something to contribute to the family income, as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfil the demands of his family members. So, she started her own business. She has been selling clothes since 2010. She works hard to support her husband to provide good living conditions for her children.

Kareemeh applied at Ryada for this loan to buy shelves, an electric generator, make new decorations to help her display the clothes for her clients properly, and give good lighting to her shop, which will lead to an increase in her income. Kareemeh is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy shelves, an electric generator, make new decorations to help her display the clothes for her clients properly, and give good lighting to her shop, which will lead to an increase in her income.

loans.name: El Encanto Group

texts.es:
El olor a caña quemada, el silbido del ingenio, el tizne, el pitido de los carros que transporta a las cuadrillas de cortadores a las 5 de la mañana, son las pruebas de que la zafra ha dado inicio y con ello aumenta el fluido económico pues la comunidad pertenece a una zona cañera.
En uno de los barrios del municipio se formó el grupo "el encanto" nombre que eligieron los integrantes pues les encantan sus actividades.
JUAN - hot dog y hamburguesas
Carlos - Cosméticos 
Mirna - Producto Naturista 
Karla -Masajes 
Jorge, Luis -Chacharas
Feliza - Lavandería 
Maria- Carnicería 
Doña Feliza es una de las integrantes del grupo, todos le conocen por su nombre y los más allegados a ella le llaman la abuela de cariño, tiene 71 años de edad , doña Feliza es madre de 6 hijos todos ellos mayores de edad, provenientes de Chacal tianguis llegaron a la comunidad en busca de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y fue así como en conjunto con su esposo iniciaron con una pequeña carnicería la cual ofrecía servicio de 6 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde, era atendida por ella y su esposo, a las 6 de la tarde doña Felisa ya estaba en su pequeña refresquería ubicada en el parque donde permanecía de 6 de la tarde a 10 de la noche, de la misma manera su esposo tenían un billar el cual era atendido por un empleado "recuerdo que mis hijos salían a entregar los tamales, longaniza, rellena y carnitas a nuestros clientes y fue así como les inculcamos el gusto por el comercio" expreso con una gran sonrisa en el rostro.
Hace 16 años al faltar su esposo doña Feliza traspaso los negocios a sus hijos y ella puso en casa una pequeña carnicería la cual permaneció activa por dos años pues quien mataba los marranos y preparaba las carnitas decidió ir en busca del sueño americano y fue así como ella decidió iniciar hace 14 años con su pequeña lavandería donde pasa en promedio 5 horas al día con el fin de entregar a tiempo la ropa a sus clientes, los prestamos han significado para ella una oportunidad de crecimiento pues le han permitido comprar lavadoras, detergente, secadoras, tendederos, pinzas y dar manteamiento a las que tiene, "quiero transformar mi lavandería e incorporar máquinas de las que hay en la ciudad donde agregas u a moneda para el lavado exprés así poder atender a más clientes" comentó contenta.
En esta ocasión el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una secadora pues con el cambio de clima y las lluvias repentinas necesita de una nueva secadora para darse abasto y entregar la ropa seca, col olor a suavitel y que sus clientes la sigan prefiriendo.
“dios los bendiga por cada préstamo que nos han brindado, por creer en nosotros y apoyarnos para seguir adelante con nuestras actividades, de todo corazón gracias” son las palabras de los integrantes del grupo.
La fotografía fue tomada en el espacio donde don juan prepara las hamburguesas, hot dog  con ayuda de su esposa, detrás está el cuarto de lavado de doña Feliza quien viste traje floreado

loans.use: Comprara 1 secadora

loans.name: Shakhmurad

texts.en:
Shakhmurad lives in Salyan region Yenikand village. He is 47, married, has 3 children. He likes animals, enjoys looking after the animals.
One day he decided to be busy with a stock-breeding. He did not have a cattle-shed.
Having borrowed a loan of $300 he built the cattle-shed.
Then he borrowed a loan of $500 and bought 10 pedigreed ewes.
For the third time he borrowed a loan of $800 and bought 20 lambs. Having fattened these animals, he started to be busy with sale of lambs and sheeps.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 25 pedigreed ewes to fatten for sale.
He is purposeful person. He has been working very hard to develop his business.
Being engaged in this business, he supports his family.
He has been engaged in this busines for 10 years.

loans.use: To buy 25 pedigreed ewes to fatten for sale

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a very hard worker with a large desire for X. She has four sons. At the age of 14 she began to sell milk because her parents did not make enough to support her going to secondary school. Today she is married and continues her business in order to contribute for her sons' education. Her business has expanded little by little, as well as her clients.

Sara is an enterprising woman who desires to expand her business, and is asking today for a loan of $650. She will use this loan to buy millk products from Ozuluama and Veracruz, with the aim of increasing sales and having a greater benefit. Sara needs your support and sincerely appreciate whatever help you can provide her.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sara es muy trabajadora y con grandes deseos de superación, ella tiene cuatro hijos. Desde que tenía 14 años comenzó con la venta de lácteos porque sus padres no contaban con los recursos suficientes para que ella pudiera asistir a la secundaria. Ahora ella está casada y continuó con el negocio para contribuir al gasto familiar y la educación de sus hijos. Su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco, así como sus clientes.

Sara es una mujer emprendedora que desea ver crecer su negocio, ahora requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 650 dólares que utilizará para la compra de productos lácteos que provienen de Ozuluama, Veracruz, con la finalidad de incrementar las ventas y obtener un mayor beneficio. Sara necesita de tu apoyo y agradece sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas darle.

loans.use: Buy perishable goods

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George O. is Director of Ugandan Communities at LIFE IN AFRICA. He is married with five children. All the children are in school. With his wife and children, George lives in the industrial area Kirombe parish, where he is operating a small grocery shop business that earns a stable additional income for his family.

George is helped at the shop by his aunt whom he pays at the end of the month. George has a stock worth 1,000,000 = (Uganda shillings). He buys the merchandise from Gulu town, and sells it to the community in the industrial area. His place of business is a very busy place because of many activities around which give him a very good atmosphere for his business.

George's plan for his loan is to add on some more stock and he normally gets 60% profit per month. He is requesting a loan of 250,000= (Uganda shillings), and he intends to pay it back within 3 months

Business plan (note that all amounts are in Uganda shillings indicated by the symbol =):

Buying the merchandise:

(sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil, soda, water,).......................245,000=

Transport:......................................................5,000=

Total: ......................................................250,000= (US$ 150)

loans.use: Restocking Shop

loans.name: Senovio

texts.en:
Senovio has a small workshop where he manufactures chamarras (jackets), which he sells in the city of Cochabamba. This is how he makes his living and supports his six children - two who attend the state university and four who attend local schools. He lives in the Rio Seco neighborhood in El Alto.

He requests this loan to purchase raw materials (fabric and yarn). This will be his third loan through IMPRO. His excellent payment history qualifies him to apply for this loan, which will help him increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Senovio tiene su taller de costuras de chamarras, las cuales son comercializadas en la Ciudad de Cochabamba. Esta es su principal actividad y por ende su principal ingreso que le permite la manutención de sus 6 hijos, dos están en la Universidad Estatal y cuatro en la edad escolar. Vive en la Zona de Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para comprar materia prima (tela y fibra). Este será el tercer crédito con Impro, su buen comportamiento de pago de los créditos anteriores le faculta para acceder a otro préstamo para que mejores sus ingresos y mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Cetty

texts.es:
Cetty is a loving and diligent mother. She has 8 children, her youngest three still live with her and attend school at the city education center. She works every day in a shop in her small home, which she set up with the help of her older children. She also counts on a monthly income she gets from selling items in a small village near the Ucayali river, with the help of her oldest daughter who works as a teacher in that town. With the combined income from these activities she is able to take good care of the children who still live with her. After a careful evaluation, she has proposed that she increase the stock in her small shop to meet the requests of the families who live near the river, so they don't have to buy them in the market. With this extra money, the family would be able to improve their quality of life and education. She is requesting a loan of $500, which she will use to grow her business. Let's help her realize her goals with our generous support.

Cetty, es una amorosa y diligente madre, tiene ocho hijos y mantiene guarecidos en el seno de su hogar sólo a tres de ellos; debido a que aún son muy pequeños y se encuentran estudiando en un centro educativo de su hermosa ciudad. Desempeña sus labores diarias en una pequeña bodega que instaló, con ayuda de sus hijos mayores, en un espacio de su humilde morada. Adicionalmente cuenta con un ingreso mensual que obtiene por los artículos que comercializa en un pequeño pueblo que se ubica en el margen del río Ucayali, con ayuda de su hija mayor que trabaja como maestra en un centro educativo de ese lugar. Con la suma de estos ingresos puede otorgarles bienestar a los niños que aún viven con ella.Así mismo luego de haber hecho una evaluación rigurosa se ha propuesto incrementar el stock de su pequeña bodega con el propósito de abastecer los pedidos que realizan mensualmente las familias de la pequeña localidad ubicada al margen del río para evitar comprarlo en el mercado, con este incremento de dinero la familia también podrá acrecentar su nivel de vida y educación siendo éste el propósito primordial de esta sacrificada madre. A razón de este hecho solicita un monto de 500 dólares con el deseo de poner en marcha su proyecto. Hagamos que este anhelo se haga realidad en corto tiempo con nuestra generosa ayuda.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY GROCERIES TO STOCK HER SMALL STORE.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods  for her store

loans.name: Akpédjé

texts.fr:
Miss Akpédjé Q. was born handicapped on 21 November 1971 in Lomé, et lives in Abobo-Komé. Having lost her father, she lives with her mother in a rented place and has no support. With her small means, Akpédjé began in the business of selling fritters. She buys wheat flour and other ingredients on credit and repays her creditor post-sale. To end this situation, she is asking for a loan of $1000 to create a sufficient stock of flour and ingredients needed to prepare her fritters. This will allow her to increase her revenue and better meet the needs of her mother, since she is the sole daughter.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle Q. Akpédjé est née handicapée le 21 Novembre 1971 à Lomé et résidant à Abobo-Komé. Orpheline de père, elle vit avec sa mère en location et n’a aucun support. Par son petit moyen de bord, Akpédjé s’est lancée dans le commerce de beignet. Elle achète à crédit la farine de blé et les ingrédients et après la vente elle règle son fournisseur. Pour mettre fin à cette situation, elle sollicite un appui financier de $1000 pour faire un stock suffisant de farine et les intrants pour la préparation de son beignet. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus et mieux subvenir à ses besoins et de sa maman puisqu’elle est la seule fille.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and ingredients for the preparation of fritters

loans.name: Kiganda D Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 30 years old and married with two children. She sells groceries. She wants to use the extra profits to start up a poultry business. Suzan and Monica both sell raw fods. Stella has a retail shop while Nululati sells fruits and vegetables.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in stock to their businesses.

loans.name: Roberto José

texts.es:
Don Roberto is married, is 35 years old and has three minor age children. He works as a mechanic in an auto repair shop. His work has allowed him to move his family ahead. His wife works as an operator in a tax-free zone. Both parents work all day. The salaries that they receive are small and sometimes do not cover the expenses of the home.

With much difficulty they have been building their house. They have not yet been able to finish it due to lack of funds. Currently the back wall is the priority because it is in bad shape and they fear that their home is not structurally sound. Their wishes are for better living conditions for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Don Roberto es casado, tiene 35 años de edad, con tres hijos, todos menores de edad, se desempaña como mecánico en un taller automotriz, su trabajo le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, su esposa trabaja de operaria en una zona franca, ambos padres trabajan todo el día, los sueldos que perciben esta familia son pocos y en ocasiones no alcanzan a cubrir los gastos de su hogar.

Con mucha dificultad han ido levantando su humilde vivienda, todavía no han logrado terminarla debido a la falta de recursos monetarios, en estos momentos necesitan priorizar la pared de la parte de atrás de la vivienda la cual se encuentra en mal estado y temen por la seguridad habitacional en la que se encuentra su casa, ya que desean que sus hijos se encuentren en mejores condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Purchase cement blocks, iron, sand and rock

loans.name: Foussenatou

texts.fr:
Born in 1978 in Adjengré in the prefecture of Sotouboua, Mrs. Foussenatou Allassani is married and has five children. Her husband is currently in Ghana and she is taking care of the children’s expenses. She sells yams in Agòè, an activity she began in 1993. The income she makes from selling yams enables her to support her children. This first-time loan she is requesting of CFA 300,000 will enable her to buy 11 bags of yams and increase her sales with the aim of improving her revenue.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1978 à Adjengré dans la préfecture de Sotouboua, Madame ALLASSANI Foussenatou est mariée et a cinq enfants. Présentement son mari est au Ghana et les dépenses de ses enfants sont à sa charge. Elle est revendeuse d’ignames à Agoè et a démarré cette activité depuis 1993. Les recettes provenant de la vente des ignames lui permettent de supporter ses enfants. Son premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 300.000FCFA lui permettra d’acheter onze sacs d’ignames et de pouvoir multiplier ses ventes en vue d’améliorer ses recettes.

loans.use: To increase her stock of yams

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children. She and her husband also take care of three other children. Elizabeth sells charcoal, a job she started in 2004. Every day she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal inventory for her business.

loans.name: Salatu

texts.en:
Salatu U., 48, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the villagers/public 2 days per week. She will use part of her loan to assist with her children's school needs. The rest of her loan will be used to buy chemicals, weed killer, bush knives, and a shovel to support her business. Her husband has been fully engaged with the project. He is one of the village high talking chiefs who consider this programme to be of vital importance in the community.

Salatu has had 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (about $US 125). SPBD loans are Salatu’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for a taro plantation.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida baji is the wife of I. A.. (Baji is an Urdu term meaning "eldest sister".) The couple lives with their four sons in a two-room brick house in Arifwala, Pakistan. They have lived their for the past 25 years.

Zahida successfully repaid her first loan from a microfinance institute of Pakistan. She runs an academy where she teaches embroidery to the little girls near her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine. Zahida hopes to earn a profit from this loan and she will open a clothing boutique. She wishes to send her younger son abroad.

There are three other members in her loan group. Sumera baji wants a loan to also buy sewing machine; Musarat baji wants a loan for her wheat trading business and Azizan baji wants to expand her shoe business inventory.

The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and open a clothing boutique

loans.name: Faida (Finesse) Group

texts.fr:
The women of the Faida group, on average 25 years old with 5 children, live in extended traditional families with their husbands and children in the village of Konobougou, Baroueli Prefecture, (Region of Ségou, Republic of Mali).

The group sells diverse items: cosmetics, clothing and especially condiments (smoked fish, dried fish, spices, etc.).

They are essentially linked by professional and neighborhood ties, and by ties of friendship.

Group solidarity being strong, the members of Faida group have decided to continue with Soro Yiriwaso which has given them three group loans so far. The previous loans have all been reimbursed correctly.

The group generally stocks up at the end of the month, buying from wholesalers in the big open-air market in Bamako as far as clothing and cosmetics are concerned, getting their fish in Ségou and spices in their own village of Konobougou. They sell their products either out of their homes or at the open-air market, or as ambulant salespeople. The group generally sells on credit to salaried purchasers but also for cash and retail at the market.

The members of Faida group hope that with 30 kg of smoked fish (bought at 1500 FCFA per kilo and sold on credit at 2500 FCFA per kilo) they will make an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA which will essentially be re-invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Les femmes du groupe Faida, âgées de 25 ans avec 5 enfants en moyenne vivent dans des familles élargies traditionnelles avec leurs époux, et enfants dans le village de Konobougou préfecture de Baroueli (Région de Ségou République du Mali.)

Le groupe fait le commerce d’articles divers : cosmétiques, habillements et surtout les condiments alimentaires (poisson fumé, séché, épices etc.)

Elles sont essentiellement unies par des liens professionnels de voisinage et d’amitié.

La solidarité du groupe ne souffrant d’aucune faille les membres de Faida ont décidé de continuer avec Soro Yiriwaso qui leurs a octroyé trois prêts de groupe .Les précédents ont été remboursés correctement.

L’approvisionnement de ce groupe se fait généralement en fin du mois auprès des grossistes au grand marché de Bamako pour l’habillement et les cosmétiques, Ségou pour les poissons et Konobougou même pour les épices.. Elles viennent revendre leurs articles suivant les cas à la maison soit au marché soit de façon ambulante. Les ventes de ce groupe se font généralement à crédit aux salariés mais aussi au comptant et à détail au niveau du marché.

Les membres du groupe Faida espèrent réaliser avec 30kg de poisson fumé (acheté à1500FCFA l’unité et vendus à crédit à 2500FCFA) réaliser un bénéfice moyen et mensuel de30000FCFA qui servira essentiellement à l’investissement dans l’activité.

loans.use:
Purchase of diverse items for re-sale

Achat d’articles divers

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo Enrique de 25 años, el cual es artesano y su hijo Miguel de 6 años. Nancy se dedica desde hace cinco años al tejido de chompas, pantalones, etc. en su casa donde tiene su máquina de tejer, para luego vender estas prendas en el mercado donde tiene su pequeño puesto.Usualmente vende las prendas confeccionadas los días sábados y en la feria dominical donde gustosamente ofrece la mercadería elaborada durante la semana, lo más difícil de su trabajo es la confección de las prendas, las cuales demandan tiempo y dedicación. El motivo de tanto trabajo es apoyar a su esposo Enrique y su pequeño hijo Miguel de tan solo 6 años a los cuales quiere ofrecer una vida digna y feliz.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Nancy is 31 years old and lives with her husband Henry who is 25 and works as an artisan; she also lives with her son Michael who is 6 years old. For the past five years Nancy has woven sweaters and pants from her home where she has her weaving machine; she then sells these garments in the market where she has a small stand. She usually sells the woven garments at the fair where she gladly offers the merchandise that is produced during the week; the most difficult part of her job is the production of the garments, which requires time and dedication. The reason she is so dedicated to this work is that she works to support her husband and her son Miguel who is only 6 years old since she wants to offer him a happy and dignified life.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material (wool) for the production of her clothing.

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
La Señora Ludith, socia D. Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la confección de  ropa interior y prendas para damas, también vende gaseosas, gelatinas y chupetes. El negocio lo realiza en su casa en el Jr. Tupac Amaru Nº 177. Trabaja en base a pedidos, los clientes suelen ser sus amigos, familiares y hermanos de su congregación, de su iglesia, a quienes ella los trata muy bien y de esa manera mantener la clientela y asegurar las ventas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual cancelará en 6 cuotas, comprará hilos de diferentes colores, telas para la confección de este tipo de prendas, de diversos colores, elásticos, blondas y una máquina de coser, y de esa manera poder contar con lo necesario cuando tiene que realizar los trabajos de confección. También quiere invertir en la compra de gaseosas y golosinas para implementar el negocio en su casa.

Ludith tiene 42 años de edad,  vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos que aún dependen de ella. Es una mujer positiva y emprendedora, su meta es seguir creciendo, tanto en el taller de costura como en el negocio de su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ludith, partner of the communal bank Las Orquideas, lives in the San Martin province, district of Tarapoto. She sews underwear and clothes for women and sells soft drinks, jelly, and candies. She works from her house at Jr. Tupac Amaru Nº 177. Her production is based on the requests she receives; her clients tend to be her friends, family members, and brothers of his congregation, whom she treats wonderfully, securing a stable demand for her products. With a loan of 670 USD, which she will repay with 6 payments, she will buy threads of different colors, fabrics for the confection of clothes, elastics, and a sewing machine. This way she will have all she needs to continue with her business. She also wants to invest in the purchase of soft drinks and candy to consolidate the business at her place. Ludith is 42-years-old, she lives with her husband and her two children that still depend on her. She is a positive and entrepreneurial woman, and her goal is to continue growing with her sewing workshop as in the business of her house.
