Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará hilos, telas, elásticos, blondas y una máquina de coser./ She will buy threads, fabrics, elastics, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Marcela's Group
loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es socia de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Gloria es casada, tiene 52 años y 5 hijos de 23, 21, 15, 15 y 12 años. Tiene 2 hijas gemelas que todavía están en el colegio , sus 2 hijos mayores trabajan.
Gloria tiene su negocio de venta de cosméticos, ella tiene este negocio  desde hace 4 años Gloria trabaja con los productos de( Ebel, Esika, Unique, Avon).    
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos. Para tener en stock.
Gloria desde que recibe los préstamos ha logrado tener varios productos en stock.  
Gloria sueña con surgir mas en su negocio que ahora tiene  y lograr poner un bazar, donde pueda mostrar los productos que vendo.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Communal Bank “Mar del Plata.” Gloria is married, 52 years old, and has 5 children ages 23, 21, 15, 15, and 12 years old. She has 2 twin daughters who are still in secondary school, her two oldest sons work. Gloria has had a cosmetic business for 4 years. Gloria works with Ebel, Esika, Unique, and Avon products. Gloria needs a loan for 400 soles which will be used to buy cosmetics so that she can have stock on hand. Since receiving loans Gloria has been able to have various products in stock. Gloria dreams of growing her business larger than it currently is and be able to open a store where she can display and show the products that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics to increase her stock on hand.

loans.name: Luz De Lourdes

texts.es: Doña Luz tiene 36 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama 14 de Febrero, con tres hijos de 7, 15,17 años de edad, que están estudiando, su esposo se desempeña como contador general en una empresa privada, la Sra. Luz tiene una pulpería y vende ropa, zapatos y cosméticos desde hace cinco años, que comenzó con préstamo que hizo en otras financieras, con esta solicitud es la quinta en Afodenic pues una institución con bajos intereses y le ha sido de grandes beneficios para su capital de trabajo, con este préstamo desea invertir en la compra de granos básicos, cosméticos, para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes y así poder tener mas ingresos con las ventas. A largo plazo es invertir más, ayudar a sus hijos a que progresen con los estudios.
texts.en:
Luz is 36 years old, lives in a neighbourhood called 14 de Febrero, has three children aged 7, 15, and 17 years who are students. Her husband works as a general accountant in a private company. Luz owns a store and has sold clothes, shoes, and cosmetics for the past 5 years. She started her business with a loan which she financed elsewhere. This is her fifth loan with Afodenic, an institution with low interest rates and which has helped her greatly to provide her with working capital. She plans to invest this loan in the purchase of basic staples, cosmetics, in order to fulfill the demand from her clients and therefore make more revenue from her sales. Her long-term goal is to invest more, helping her children as they continue their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic staples and cosmetics.

loans.name: Virginia Mercedes

texts.es:
Virginia Mejía J. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Niño Manuelito II” de la provincia de Huaraz.

Virginia tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 03 hijos, comenta virginia que no ha tenido problemas difíciles que enfrentar, al contrario ella transcurre tranquilamente por la vida y siendo su negocio su mas grande logro que le sirve para apoyar a su esposo y a su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de materiales agregados que recoge de las márgenes del río Santa en el barrio de Tacllán en las afueras de la ciudad de Huaraz, virginia extrae todos los días arena fina y gruesa para venderlos a los compradores que trasladan el producto hasta las obras de construcción; ella comenta que ha crecido regularmente y no tiene muchas dificultades con esta actividad.
  
Con este préstamo de s/.1500.00, que pagará en ocho cuotas invertirá en su negocio, con la compra de materiales para extracción (lampas), así mismo comprará a los más pequeños recolectores de materia prima para venderlos en mayor cantidad a los que trasladan los agregados de construcción.
 
virginia desea recibir capacitaciones para mejorar su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
Virginia Mejía J. is part of the Communal Bank, “Niño Manuelito II,” in the province of Huaraz. Virginia is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. Virginia comments that she has not had very difficult problems to confront, on the contrary, she has gone through life peacefully. The greatest success of her business is that it serves to support her husband and her family. She sells various materials that she collects from the banks of the Santa river in the neighborhood of Tacllán on the outskirts of the city of Huaraz. Every day Virginia extracts fine sand and thick mud to sell to buyers that transport the supplies to construction sites. She says that her business has grown regularly and she does not have many difficulties with this work. With this loan of $500, which she will repay over the course of 8 months, she will invest in her business through the purchase of materials for extraction (lamps). She will also purchase smaller containers of raw material to sell in the large quantities to buyers. Virginia hopes to receive training to improve her business and her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of lamps and other materials.

loans.name: Raul Alberto

texts.es: su nombre es Raul G. se actividad principal es el comercio, cuenta con una distribuidora de electrodomesticos los que distribuye de manera ambulante en los diferentes lugares aledaños de nuestra ciudad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos lo que estan cursando la educacion primaria en una escuela publica, el inició como vendedor en una compañia pero luego paso el tiempo decidio comprar algunos productos y venderlos por su propia cuenta y fue asi como fundo su empresa y poco a poco va creciendo, razon por la cual solicita un credito porque necesita capital pra poder surtir mas su negocio y satisfacer la demanda existente.
texts.en:
Raul G. has a business selling small electrical appliances in the streets of the various towns around our city. He is married and has two children in primary school. He used to work as a company salesman, but after some time he decided to buy various products and sell them himself, and in this way he started his own business which has gradually expanded. Now he would like a loan so that he can better stock the business and satisfy current demand for his products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small electrical appliances and other supplies for the home

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora Rosmery pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el Futuro II”, vive en Jr Bolognesi Nº 835 del distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 36 años y es madre de 3 hijos, todos ellos dependen de ella. Es conviviente, su pareja cuenta con un motokar que es su herramienta de trabajo lo que genera ingresos para la familia. Rosmery con el primer prestamo de S/ 300 decide vender frutas y carbón. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco.

 En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de refrescos en una esquina muy transitada de la ciudad,  trabajo que decide realizar por las pocas ganancias que le dejaba la venta de frutas y carbón.

Con este prestamo de S/ 1,000 que será pagado en 4 meses, comprara baldes, vasos, una mesa, sillas, para mejorar la apariencia del negocio y atraer mas a la clientela.

Rosmery esta muy contenta con el Banco Comunal por la oportunidad que le brinda de salir adelante y sentirse útil como mujer.
texts.en:
Rosmery belongs to Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el Futuro II,” she lives on Jr. Bolognesi Nº 835 of the district Tarapoto, in the state of San Martín. She is 36 years old and is a mother of 3 children, all of whom are dependent on her. She lives with a partner, who has a car that he uses as working capital that generates income for the family. With the first loan of 300 soles, Rosmery decided to sell fruits and carbonated beverages. She has 2 worked with the bank for 2 years. Currently, Rosmery sells refreshments on a heavily trafficked corner of the city, which she decided to realize by using the little earnings she had from selling fruits and carbonated beverages. With this loan of 1000 soles, which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy buckets, glasses, a table, and chairs, to improve the appearance of her business and to attract her clientele more. Rosmery is very happy with el Banco Comunal and the opportunity they grant her to progress and feel like a useful woman.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy buckets, glasses, a table, and chairs, so that she may improve the appearance of her business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad H. is 44 years old. He is married with three children. Ahmad has been a farmer for the last seven years; it is his passion. He practices both dairy farming and mixed crop farming. He says he has chosen farming as a career because the produce from his farm has a ready market. His challenge at the moment is that he is not fully utilizing all of his land; this is because he used up all his proceeds from the last harvest to pay his children's (pictured) school fees and was not able to buy the seeds and fertilizers needed to sow his whole land. Ahmad is requesting a loan of $700 USD to be able to purchase the resources needed to plough the whole farm for the next planting season. He will purchase assorted fertilizer stock, seeds and also cattle. 
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Maofa

texts.en:
Maofa T., 62, is married with three children. She has three years of experience in the general store business. She sells to the public six days per week.

Maofa has had three previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Maofa’s only access to capital because she was not able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Maofa will use her loan to buy timber, cement, roofing materials and all the things used for home improvement.

loans.use: Buy home improvement supplies.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
In addition to being an entrepreneur, Matilda A., 50, takes care of her five children. Three are in basic school and one has not started school yet. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children to the highest degree of education possible. She lives with the children and her husband, a farmer, in their own house at Oda, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband provide for the family. She has been in business for eight years now.

Matilda is expecting higher profits if she receives her loan. She will be adding more products to her grocery stall in the community market. Her grocery products sell almost as fast as she can purchase them. Also, she will be adding slippers and plastics to her store to diversify her trading.

Matilda is a member of the community group called “Suban pa” (translated as "Good Character"). Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bulk groceries for sale.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa O. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters. She says all of her children are out of school and working. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to help her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a cocoa farmer.

Yaa is a businesswoman. She runs a provisions store on one of the principal streets in her community. She also sells vegetables and other food items on a small table top in front of her store. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. Yaa has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Чаборова Барно проживает в районе Варзоба. Возраст 46 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Барно занимается животноводством, т.е. откормом и продажей бычков. Муж работает на цементном заводе. Этим видом предпринимательства занимается более 15 лет. Ей также помогают ее дети. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить бычка, откормить а потом продать. А на полученную прибыль приобрести еще одного бычка.
texts.en:
Brano C. lives in the Varzoba region of Tajikistan. She is 46 years old, married and has four children. Barno raises and sells cattle while her husband works at the cement plant. She has 15 years of experience fattening calves for sale and her children help her with the animals. Barno would like to take out this credit in order to buy an additional calf for feeding and sale at the meat market. With the money she makes from the sale of this calf she will able to pay back the loan and purchase another calf for herself later.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Ray

texts.en:
Ray is in the business of providing solutions to homes and businesses. The 53-year-old computer and electronic services consultant advises clients on what equipment best suits their needs. Because Ray doesn’t install the equipment himself, he needs to hire qualified professionals. He has been experiencing delays in identifying skilled labor to enable him to complete his contracts.

To address this, he is collaborating with another organization to become certified through MECP, a vocational school for installation technicians. He has applied for this loan from ACCION USA in order to be able to fund the certification process. Becoming certified as a training provider would help Ray's business because training and certifying the most talented of his sub-contractors will allow him to have qualified labor at his fingertips as he continues to take on larger jobs.

He hopes to be able to grow his business and offer more training and employment opportunities to youth from technical colleges. For Ray, his business is not just a source of income but a way to create employment and empower the hard-working men and women in his community.

loans.use: Training and certification for his computer and electronic services business

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Grupo: NUEVA ESPERANZA.
Ciclo: 8. (numero de veces que han recibido un crèdito)
Fecha de desembolso: 3/06/2 009.
Monto: 46,000
Plazo de pago: 8 Catorcenas



El señor: PEDRO CHACON L., de 47 años  es originario de acatlàn de Pérez Figueroa  Oaxaca, un pueblo pequeño de la región de Tuxtepec.

 Desde su juventud se ha dedicado al oficio de la carpintería,  el señor Pedro actualmente esta separado de su esposa, pero es responsable de una niña y un niño que procrearon en matrimonio  don Pedro anhela con poder  ampliar su carpintería, contar con mas herramientas que le permitan  desarrollar mejor su oficio y así poder darles mejor calidad de vida a sus niños como el los llama el desea que sus hijos  aprendan que el trabajo digno los hace mejores seres humanos y que aprendan  hacer buenos ciudadanos.   

 Por tal motivo el señor PEDRO CHACON L.  solicito un crédito con el afán de hacer su sueño realidad, ampliar su carpintería. Y será en este caso para la compra de madera, barnices etc. En otras palabras materia prima, que necesita para elaborar sus muebles.

Con esta finalidad el señor: PEDRO CHACON  L., se ha unido  aun grupo de 10 personas al cual le pusieron como nombre de grupo: NUEVA ESPERANZA. Para  solicitar  el crédito grupal a Fundación realidad A.C. las otras personas del grupo son:


Maria del carmen A. C.: venta de cosméticos.
Guadalupe T. M.             : venta de sabanas, cobijas.
Celestina T. Martínez              : venta de abarrotes
Margarita C. García        : venta de comida.
Estela Chacón López                        : venta de ropa.
Martina Ramón Gomes                        : venta de comida.
Petra A. Guzmán                       : venta de carne de puerco.
Zaray M. D.                        : venta de comida.
Estela López Ramírez             : compra y venta de carne de pollo.
texts.en:
Group: Nueva Esperanza. Loan Cycle: 8. (Number of times that they have received a loan.) Date of Disbursement: 3/06/2009. Amount: 46,000 Pesos Repayment Schedule: 8 bi-weekly payments. Señor Pedro Chacon L. is 47 years of age and comes from Acatlàn de Pérez Figueroa, Oaxaca, a small village in the Tuxtepec region. From the time he was young he has been a woodworker. Señor Pedro is currently separated from his wife but is responsible for a boy and a girl from that marriage. He really wants to expand his carpentry business and to have more tools that would allow him to better develop his trade. That way he would be able to provide a better standard of living for his children, as he calls them. He wants his children to learn that honorable work makes one a better human being and he wants them to learn to be good citizens. That's why Señor Pedro is seeking a loan with the desire of making his dream a reality, to expand his carpentry business. And in this case, it will be used to buy lumber, varnish, etc., in other words, the raw materials that he needs to produce his furniture. With this objective, Señor Pedro C. L. has brought together a group of ten people who call themselves the Nueva Esperanza Group in order to solicit a group loan from Fundación Realidad. The other members of the group are: Maria del Carmen A. C. . . . Cosmetics sales Guadalupe T. M. . . . Selling sheets and blankets Celestina T. Martínez . . . Grocery sales Margarita C. García . . . Selling prepared food Estela Chacón López . . . Clothing sales Martina Ramón Gomes . . . Selling prepared food Petra A. Guzmán . . . Selling pork Zaray M. D. . . . Selling prepared food Estela López Ramírez . . . Buying and selling chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and merchandise.

loans.name: Luz De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Nicolaza Margarita M. E.. 
Mi familia y yo tuvimos que dejar el pueblo donD. vivíamos San Damián - Huarochirí a Lima, debido a L. propuesta laboral que le hacen a mi esposo. Lamentablemente sufrió un accidente D. tránsito que le impidió seguir laborando D. albañil por un año. A raíz D. esta situación me veo en L. necesidad D. trabajar por mi familia, lo cual tuve que recorrer las calles con mis dos pequeños hijos, tocando D. puerta en puerta ofreciendo comida y fruta; además lavaba ropa y ayudaba a cocinar en los comedores populares a fin D. subsistir y no dejar en el abandono a mi familia, aún así estos ingresos no cubría los gastos que teníamos. Pronto llego a enterarme por una sobrina que participa en EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD los créditos que daban a personas como yo, microempresaria. Me di cuenta que era L. oportunidad que buscaba para progresar económicamente, es así que logro formar parte D. L. Alcancía Comunal “Luz D. San Antonio”, actualmente ocupo el cargo D. presidenta y somos trece personas que participamos, los cuales nos dedicamos al comercio. Con mi primer crédito que obtuve D. EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD puD. comprar mercadería D. flores, plantas medicinales y medicamentos naturales, lo que generó ganancias que ayudaron en los gastos D. mi familia. Hoy a mis 41 años he logrado hacer crecer más mi negocio, ya no vendo mis productos en forma ambulatoria, sino en un puesto que puD. alquilar con los recréditos que recibí. Para mí EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD fue L. ayuda que necesitaba para progresar y estoy segura que con los siguientes préstamos que obtenga mi negocio crecerá aun más.
texts.en:
Nicolaza Margarita M. E. My family and I had to leave the town where we lived, San Samián – Huarochirí. We had to go to Lima due to a work proposal my husband received. Unfortunately, he suffered an accident in transit. He could not keep working as a bricklayer for one year. At the root of this situation, I see myself in the necessity of working for my family. I had to go up and down the streets with my two small children knocking door to door selling food and fruit. I also washed clothes and helped cook in popular dining rooms to survive and not leave my family abandoned. Even so, these earnings did not cover the expenses that we had. I soon came to learn from a nephew who participates in EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD about the loans they give to people like me, entrepreneurs. I realized that this was the opportunity that I was looking for to progress economically. That is how I became part of the Luz D. San Antonio Community Bank. I am currently the president. Thirteen people participate. We work in businesses. With my first loan that I got from EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, I could buy merchandise like flowers, medicinal plants, and natural medicines. They generated earnings that helped with my family’s expenses. Now, at 41 years of age, I have maD. my business grow. I no longer sell my products door to door, but I have a space that I was able to rent with the loans that I received. For me, EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD was the help I needed to progress. I am sure that with the loans that follow my business will grow even more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Choun

texts.en: Mrs. Choun S., age 29, and her husband, Mr. Vanny Pang, 25, live along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 2003 and have one son and one daughter.  Choun has been growing and selling flowers in her village for 15 years, while her husband has been a chef for three years. She is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase a motorbike to carry her flowers to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry flowers to sell.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Teres De Jesús L. tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad y quienes están actual mente estudiando.
Doña Teresa De Jesús es empleada de una fábrica en el departamento de producción, su sueldo es bajo y no puede cubrir la inscripción de la escuela de sus hijos. 
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así poder pagar a la escuela para que sus niños puedan estudiar esté año.
También planes poner un pequeño negocio de venta de tacos hay en su casa y así poder darles lo mejor a sus hijos y pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Teresa De Jesús L. has two children who are currently students. She works in the production department of a factory. Her salary is low and she cannot cover her children's school registration fees. For this reason she is requesting a loan and in this way will be able to pay the school so that her children can attend this year. She also plans on putting a small business at her house selling tacos and thereby will be able to give the best to her children and pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet M. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 31 years old. Janet is single and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Janet owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Janet is just starting this business.

In 2008, Janet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Janet is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Janet from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is an electronic load retailer in their village. She is 30 years old and she is living with their two children in their village in Punit Benito Soliven, Isabela. Her husband Luisito is currently working in another country as a Project Engineer. Their two children are Michael Angelo, eight years old, and Darlene Gaile, one year old. The couple sacrifices by being away from each other just to meet the daily needs and future welfare of their children who have growing needs. Jennifer hopes that someday, they will be able to send their two children to school and see them earn their degrees in college.

Jennifer retails cell phone loads for Smart and Globe subscribers. Her customers usually buy their load by sending a text message and she will also send the load through a text. She ventured into this business so she can help her husband in supporting the needs of their family. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 from KIVA lenders to be used as additional capital. Electronic loading is very much in demand in their village and Jennifer wants to maximize her loan and be productive in the business. She hopes that her business will be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 52 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and three children. Mhammad has been a carpenter for twenty seven years. He constructs bedrooms, kitchen's doors and all kinds of furniture. Mhammad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials like  wood to make furniture. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his business and get more experience. His clients are his friends and the public. When Mhammad first started his business, he had to face the challenges of having his own business. In the future, Mhammad plans on improving his business and purchasing his own store.

loans.use: To purchase raw material.

She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Bebiosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. Mr. Theng Y., 45, and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Chhoeng, 40, live along national road number one, about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2003 and have one young daughter. His wife was available for the photo. 

Theng has been driving a motor taxi (Tuk Tuk) in Phnom Penh since 2005, while his wife stays at home and does housework. He wants to buy another newer motorbike for commuting. He is requesting a loan of $1200 to make the purchase.

Roselyn H. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz city. She is 27 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Roselyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Roselyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the her children and to cover daily expenses.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta is 30 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Benedicta earns income trading in foodstuffs such as plantain and potatoes. She also sells kenkey and oranges by the road side. Benedicta buys her goods from nearby towns and sells to food vendors in her community. Benedicta has been in this business for ten years and currently needs a loan to procure additional products in bulk.

loans.name: Gaudecia

texts.es:
Gaudencia tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso que adquiere por sacos en la ciudad capital. Para ello, viaja a Lima cada 15 días y en algunas ocasiones envía por encomienda su mercadería. Sus mejores ventas se dan en épocas de feria comercial y en las festividades de las zonas rurales de su localidad.
En sus momentos libre, su esposo y su hija mayor la ayudan en el transporte de su mercadería, para Gaudecia este trabajo le ha permitido tener las ganancias necesarias para apoyar la economía de su familia, sumando a la remuneración por el trabajo que realiza su esposo.
Para el futuro, ella desea tener un puesto más estable donde tenga mayor comodidad e incremente sus ventas.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está contenta de tener un impulso en su capital para mejorara su negocio. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Gaudencia is 50 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own home. For the last 12 years she has devoted herself to selling second hand clothes that she acquires from the capital city. To get the bags of clothing, she travels to Lima every 15 days and on some occasions she has her merchandise sent to her. Her best sales take place during commercial markets and during festivals in rural areas of her locality. In their spare time, her husband and her oldest daughter help transport the merchandise. For Gaudecia, this work has allowed her to have the necessary earnings to support her family, and adds to the money her husband. For the future, she wishes to have a more permanent stall where she can conduct her sales more comfortably and with higher frequency. This is the first time that she has a loan with MFP and is happy to have a boost in her capital to improve her business. With the money, she will buy more clothes to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

texts.en:
Luz L. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 43 years old and she is married. To make a living, Luz owns and operates a specialized retail store selling clothing products in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $200 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Luz joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Luz is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. loans.name: Yakubdjon's Group

texts.en:
B. Yakubdjon is 50 years old. Together with his wife they have raised two children. Yakubdjon is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 30 years. Yakubdjon is baking the national bread “lepeshka” at home. His children and wife (pictured) help him with his business. Having many customers Yakubdjon is selling the majority of his products just from his place. However, he is also running the trading place in the central local market for selling the”lepeshka”. Now Yakubdjon requests $3000 USD. He is planning to purchase the flour at wholesale for his business. Yakubdjon is grateful for all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the flour as a wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Engari Nyekundire Group, Ibanda

L. Ziporah is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She has been a medical worker and birth attendant in Ibanda for over thirty years.

Ziporah is grateful for her loans for they have helped her expand her business as well as enabled her pay her children’s school fees. She is a good lady who knows how to handle her clients, and this has won her many genuine friends. She is able to make 350,000/= in profit a month.

Ziporah is a 52-year-old lady and is married with six children, all in primary school. She also takes care of three dependents. Her major goal is to improve her business by providing quality services and to ensure that her family is happy and healthy.

Ziporah needs a loan to help expand her business by buying more supplies for medical care.

Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es una profesora que tiene 22 años de dar clases en el, colegio el jicarito vive en la comunidad del trabuco del tanque de agua 500 vrs al este.
Los créditos le han servido para preparar académicamente a sus hijos y par su misma salud, ya quec a ella la han operado 2 veces y también los mismos le han ayudado a mejorar su vivienda

She has used the loans to academically prepare her children and for her health. She has had two operations. Also, the loans have helped to improve her house.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle  Ami Boré est âgée de 27 ans et mère d’une petite fille. Elle réside chez ses grands parents maternels à Sanoubougou II, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali). 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer aux études, Ami  s’est vite initiée à la coiffure féminine depuis environ onze ans. 
Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, elle est très sollicitée par les jeunes demoiselles surtout lors des cérémonies (mariages, baptêmes, anniversaires, etc.). L’insuffisance des ressources propres  pour bien mener cette activité constitue l’objet et la justification de sa demande de prêt à Soro Yiriwaso afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. 
Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de deux  ans et est à son deuxième prêt individuel après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
 Elle sollicite ce deuxième prêt pour acheter, 2 robes de mariés, 10 paquets de mèches de différentes qualités à Bamako. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce deuxième prêt, un bénéfice moyen 100 000 FCFA lui permettant de résoudre ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Ami Boré, aged 27, is the mother of a young girl.  She resides with her maternal grandparents in Sanoubougou II, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Not having had the chance to advance at school, Ami was introduced to women's hairdressing about eleven years ago.  With such experience in this domain, she is in high demand by young ladies, especially for ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, birthdays, etc.)  The lack of her own funds for running this business has to do with the goal and justification for her loan request at the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  The loan is for doing better in satisfying the needs of her customers, who are ever-increasing.  Ami has had an association with Soro Yiriwaso for over two years and is on her second individual loan after having properly repaid her first one.  She is requesting this second loan to buy two wedding dresses and ten packets of hair extensions of different qualities, in Bamako (capital of Mali).  Ami envisions using this loan to make an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA, which will enable her to resolve her personal expenses, to help cover family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various goods

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Mrs. Ren K. is a villager in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is 47 years old. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Rorn Tom, is a palm juice collector who can earn a little money from selling palm sugar to support his family.

So to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Ren K. is asking for a loan to buy three piglets and pig feed for breeding, and with the rest of the loan, she plans to buy a cow and fertilizer to do farming. She is a mother of six children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are attending local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Robinson has been managing and operating his mixed farm in Murang'a town in Central Kenya for over twenty years. He has employed one permanent employee and two casual laborers. His farm produces milk and coffee which he sells to the local market. He is also a businessman.

Robinson is 49 years old. He is married and has been blessed with two children, ages 20 and 22. One of them is in college.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 53,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that his income will increase from the sale of milk and he will be able to pay college fees for his son. He says that his biggest challenges have been lack of funds to enable him to acquire a pure bred dairy cow and the poor prices of milk. In five years' time, he hopes to acquire at least five dairy cows producing 100 liters of milk daily.

He says that Juhudi has made him realize his dreams as a dairy farmer and he would like to be the leading milk producer in his division.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ima Sumacc

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ima Sumacc; ella tiene 30  años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de vestidos para todo tipo de ocasión como fiestas, matrimonios y quince años, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar su local para vender los vestidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para refaccionar su local y para comprar mostradores.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ima Sumacc belongs to the Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Wanchaq district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Ima Sumacc is 30 years old and single. She combines her household chores with the business of selling clothing for all occasions like parties, marriages, and 15th birthday celebrations. She works from 9:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She wants to improve the location where she sells the clothing. She is requesting a loan to refurbish her place and to buy counters. She uses this forum to thank all those people who share in her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish the location where she sells and buy counters

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn G. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Merlyn is married and has 2 grown children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro Pablo tiene 34 años de edad , su esposa es Medico General en el MINSA y  ha sido cliente de AFODENIC, tienen un bebe de un añito de vida el que está al cuidado de su abuelita cuando ellos salen a trabajar, el Sr. C. P. labora como Director de suministro del Ministerio de educación desde hace 2 años, tienen buenas referencias de sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo.

Esta solicitando su  septimo crédito para construir una habitación para su hijo ya que necesita mas comodidad.

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su hijo este bien de salud, tener estabilidad laboral y que la familia permanezca unida,
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo is 34 years old. His wife is a doctor at MINSA and he has been a client of the AFODENIC Community Bank. They have a 1 year old baby that is cared for by his grandmother when his parents are working. Mr. C. P. has worked for 2 years as the Director of Supplies for the Department of Education. They have good references from their neighbors and coworkers.

He is asking for his seventh loan to build a bedroom for his son to provide him with greater comfort. His greatest dream in life is for his son to be healthy, have steady work, and for his family to remain united.

loans.use: To build a bedroom

loans.name: Kabungo Women, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
M. Olivia, aged 27 years, is married with a family of four children and has been operating a retail shop in Omungyenyi trading centre, Ntungamo for over 6 years. Here, she trades in a variety of products, commonly household items like sugar, salt, soap, soft drinks, water, cooking oil and much more general merchandise. She is able to earn 150,000 Ugandan shillings on a weekly basis.

Her main drawback is that she has limited a variety of products in her shop that cannot satisfy the customers' demand. Therefore, she is looking forward to increasing her stock when she gets this loan and also to expanding fully. This will help her earn more revenue and sustain her daily needs and further educate her children. 

She also belongs to 'Kabungo Women’s Group ' whose members hold each other accountable  in paying back the loan.

loans.use: purchase  more stock for the shop business

loans.name: Gemma's Group

texts.en:
Gemma C. is from the village of District 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 43 years old and the leader of a three-member loan group offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Gemma is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns a business raising and selling tilapia (St. Peter's fish) to the market. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fish to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Gemma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Jackilyn

texts.en:
Jackilyn E. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 29 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jackilyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jackilyn wishes to have enough income for her family. She does not want her children to experience difficulties.

Jackilyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jackilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jackilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina Q. is a 64-year-old woman from Capatan, Tuguegarao City. Edina is a widow with seven adult-age children. To make a living, Edina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector by raising livestock. She explains that her primary source of income is derived from raising pigs and re-selling them for profits. Edina has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2005, Edina joined ASKI to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she was better able to engage in business activities and to improve her family's standard of living. Recently, Edina successfully repaid a prior loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Edina is now requesting a new loan, this time in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which would be used to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future. Notably, this loan would be her fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas of the country. Its clients mostly consist of farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing and ultimately selling additional livestock

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Sandra Maria tiene 44 años, su actividad es la venta de productos varios. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que inicio como un medio de vida muy importante ella tiene 1 hijo de 21 años que le ayuda en este tipo de negocio ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con sus créditos, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos por lo que se siente muy contenta con esta actividad.  El motivo de este crédito es para la compra de frutas, bolsas, pajillas, hielo, azúcar granos básicos entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Sandra Maria is 44 and she sells different products.  She started with this business more than 8 years ago as a vital part of her financial support.  She has a son who is 21 and who helps her with the business.  She has shown herself to be a very responsible person with her loans.  This is not the first time she has had financing and she feels very satisfied with this type of assistance.  Sandra Maria will use this loan to buy fruit, bags, straws, ice, sugar, basic grains, etc.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny C. is a 49-year old widow who supports her family by operating two business ventures: hog-raising and a general store. She lives in Tagdalungon, Brgy. Rio Tuba, Bataraza, Palawan where she has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her hog-raising and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,600.

Leny is requesting her 14th loan for PHP 18,500 to purchase piglets and feeds. Her previous loan of PHP 16,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Leny aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo V. y su esposa la señora Miriam Ivonne Alcaraz, ya han tenido dos créditos con Kiva los cuales sus pagos son puntuales. 
Están nueva mente solicitando un préstamo para poder reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que por las lluvias se ha estado deteriorando. 
Es por eso que están solicitando su cooperación para este crédito ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Don Gerardo V. tiene dos ingresos uno es como empleado en una compañía de trasportes, su segundo ingreso es de arbito los fines de semana, estos son los ingresos que tiene para su familia y con una parte de estos ingresos pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo V. and his wife Mrs. Miriam Ivonne Alcaraz have received two loans through Kiva, which they paid back on time.  Now they are requesting a new loan to repair the roof of their home which has been damaged due to rainfall.

They appeal to you for your help since they do not have the money necessary to buy the materials nor pay anyone to take care of the repair.

Gerardo has two jobs, one as an employee of a transportation company and the other as a referee on weekends.  These are the only sources of income for the family.  They will use part of this income to pay back the loan.

loans.use: To repair the roof of his home

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old and lives with 10 other family members. After gaining experience in the trading business, Mostafa opened his own food market in 2007. He is well known in his community and has an excellent reputation.

Mostafa is requesting a $2400 loan to install shutters and put up a sign at the bakery entrance. Also, he wants to buy a refrigerator and increase his inventory. He is planning to extend his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To install shutters, put up a sign, buy a refrigerator and increase his inventory

loans.name: Lizza

texts.es:
La Sta. Lizza R. de 26 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres.
Lizza trabaja como peluquera hace más de 3 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2.007; ella creció en la peluquería con su madre, luego de ganar experiencia en dicho rubro, ella habilitó su local propio con la ayuda económica de su madre, en la actualidad tiene ubicado su negocio sobre una de las avenidas principales de la ciudad, tiene clientela formada por la calidad de sus servicios.
Ella utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías (shampoo, acondicionador, cremas, aceites, tintes, bijuoterie)
texts.en:
Lizza R., is 26, single, and lives with her parents.

She's been working as a hairdresser for more than 3 years, since about 2007.  She grew up at the hair salon with her mother, and after getting some experience, she set up her own shop with financial help from her mother.  Now she has her business situated on one of the main avenues of the city and she's gained clientele through the quality of her services.

Lizza will use this loan to buy more merchandise (shampoo, conditioner, creams, oils, hair colors, and jewelry).

loans.use: To buy more merchandise (shampoo, conditioner, creams, oils, hair colors, jewelry, etc.).

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Don Gilberto, tiene 58 años de edad, reside en Gualococti departamento de Morazán, se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas, maíz y frijol, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 20 años y 15 años de edad, ambos estudian. Don Gilberto tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, realiza sus cultivos en sus propios terrenos y  aprendió el oficio de su padre.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar abonos y fertilizantes, este préstamo le ayudara a contar con lo necesario para el proceso del cultivo y dar los cuidados necesarios obtener una buena cosecha.
Su objetivo es que a través de su trabajo su familia cuente con lo necesario en alimentación, salud y educación para sus hijos.
texts.en: Gilberto, who is 58 years old, lives in Gualococti in Morazán department, and grows vegetables, corn and beans. He lives with his wife and two children, 20 and 15 years old, who both study. Gilberto has farmed for 20 years, growing his crops on his own lands and learning the business from his father. He requests the loan in order to purchase manure and fertilizers. This loan will help him have the necessities for planting and take the necessary care of the land to improve his harvest. His goal is that through his work his family may have what they need in terms of food, health and education for his children.

loans.use: Purchase manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de venta de comida. Pero su especialidad es vender “tripita” es un plato con tripas de vaca y ensaladas (muy común en Ecuador). 

Empezó a vender tripita con su mama poco a poco ella fue incursionando en el mercado de las comidas, hasta que ahora tiene su propio negocio. Trabaja desde las 15h00pm hasta las 19h00pm. Trasporta todos los días la comida hasta el Recreo un sitio muy transitado por la gente para vender a un mayor volumen. Para seguir con su negocio y darle una buena vida a su hijo ella quiere construir mejor su casa comprando con el prestamo cemento, arena, bloques.
texts.en:
Flor, 28 years old, is a hard working woman who has a food sales business.  Her specialty is the sale of "tripita", which is a dish made with cow intestines, and salads ( very common in Ecuador).

She started selling tripita with her mother and slowly she began to penetrate the food market and now she has her own business.  She works from 3 pm until 7 pm.  Every day she transports her food to the Recreo, a place with a lot of people traffic, where she can sell more quantities.  To be able to continue with her business and give a good life to her son, she wants to improve her house by using the loan to buy cement, sand and brick.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Cotzalzin Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama coatzalzin, decidieron ponerle este nombre porque así es como se llama la colonia donD. viven, esta historia es acerca D. la señora crecencia C. Hernández, ya que es una D. las integrantes D. este grupo, ella tiene 48 años D. edad, está casada con el señor Anselmo clemente, tienen 8 hijos D. los cuales solo trinidad y María Elena, quienes estudian primero D. secundaria y quinto año D. primaria, ya que los demás todos están casados, ella se dedica a la venta D. refrescos, con el cual lleva 3 años.
Dice que eligió esta actividad ya que tenía que buscar la forma D. sacar a sus hijos adelante y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. la casa, fue por eso que decidió empezar con este pequeño negocio aparte D. que dice le deja muy buenas ganancias, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra D. mas mercancía como son: mas refrescos, aguas y jugos.
La señora crecencia nos comenta que su propósito es el D. seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para hacerlo crecer mucho mas, ya que quiere poner una tienda D. abarrotes, para mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos y con ello poder solventar los gastos D. la educación D. sus hijos, ya que quiere que sigan estudiando para que tenga una carrera y una muy buena profesión.
Ella conoce muy bien a sus compañeras y nos comenta que son personas responsables, gente trabajadora, confiable y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante y superarse.
Da las gracias a los prestatarios D. kiva, por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en ella, puesto que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y asi tener un mejor futuro.
Las integrantes del grupo cotzalzin y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes:
Gloria-venta D. pollos, Fortunata-venta D. refrescos, agustina-abarrotes, francisca-venta D. refrescos, Faustina-venta D. pollos, crecencia-venta D. refrescos, nahu-compra D. refacciones, Olivia-dulcería, marina-venta D. pescados y Emilia-venta D. pasta para mole.
texts.en:
This group is called “Coatzalzin”. The members decided on this name because it is also the name of the subdivision in which they live. The story being presented is that of Sra. Crecencia C. Hernández, one of the group members. She is 48 years old, married to Sr. Anselmo Clemente, and has eight children. Trinidad and María Elena are the only children still in school, a first year high school student and a fifth graD. student respectively. The others are married. Crecencia sells soft drinks, which she has been doing for three years.

She chose this business activity because she wanted to find a way to move her children forward and help her husband with the household expenses. For this reason, she decided to start a small business and now she says she generates good earnings. The loan she will receive will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise such as soft drinks, water, and juices.

Sra. Crecencia says that her plan is to continue investing in her business so that it will grow even more. She wants to establish a grocery store so that she can improve and increase her income to help cover her children’s educational expenses. Crecencia wants them to continue their studies so that they can earn a degree and have a good profession.

She knows the other members very well and says that they are responsible, hardworking, and trustworthy individuals who desire to succeed and improve themselves. She thanks the Kiva lenders for trusting them and giving them this opportunity, but most of all, for believing in them. As a result of this assistance, they will be able to invest in their businesses and have a better future. The members of the Cotzalzin Group and their business activities are as follows:

• Gloria sells chickens. • Fortunata sells soft drinks. • Agustina sells groceries. • Francisca sells soft drinks. • Faustina sells chickens. • Crecencia sells soft drinks. • Nahu sells spare parts. • Olivia has a candy shop. • Marina sells fish. • Emilia sells mole paste.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, water, and juices.

loans.name: Ibragim

texts.ru: Бабакулов Ибрагим проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Его сын находится в России. Сам он имеет высшее образование, бухгалтер. По профессии проработал 8 лет. Сейчас он занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи, сеет пшеницу и сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для покупки минеральных удобрений, топлива и семян арбуза. Он хочет посеять и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Ibragim B. lives in the region of Shahrituz. He is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. His son is now in Russia. Ibragim has higher education in accounting. He has worked in his profession for eight years. He is now in agriculture. He mainly grows vegetables, sows wheat and plants fruit trees. He has been in this business for six years. He is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer, fuel and watermelon seeds. He wants to sow and gather a good harvest for resale.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel and watermelon seeds

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 33 and married with two children between the ages 3 and 8 years old.  He has been selling various products such as rice, sugar, juice, bread, bananas, soap etc. He has two years of experience.

Jean Marie Vianney has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products for his store like rice, sugar, cosmetics and so on. With his profits, he expects to save money for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell like juice, sugar, bread, bananas, soap etc.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es: Bernardino, de 35 años de edad, es natural de la ciudad de San Francisco, convive con Gloria de 33 años de edad y fruto de esa relación tienen 02 hijos donde viven juntos en su propia casa donde reina la paz y armonía del hogar. La labor que realiza Bernardino es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva plantas de cacao, café, palillo y achiote, en total cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno y es conocedor del arduo trabajo que se realiza en el campo. Tiene 15 años trabajando sobre sus propias tierras, y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y  trasladar los productos recolectados hasta cierto tramo para luego ser transportados con vehículos hasta los tendales. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas son muy productivas, generándole ganancias. Manifiesta además que el invierno perjudica su negocio pues abundan los insectos impidiendo el desarrollo de los frutos.  Este es su primer crédito con MFP y agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente ya que desea acceder a otros créditos. Con el crédito solicitado realizara el mantenimiento respectivo de sus plantas como la poda y el desmonte de malezas y con el resto del dinero comprara sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Bernardino, 35, is originally from the city of San Francisco. He lives with Gloria, 33, and they have two sons from their relationship. They live together in peace and harmony in their own house. Bernardino works the land, where he grows cocoa plants, coffee, turmeric, and squash. In total, he owns four hectares of land. He is known for his hard work in the fields and has been working his own land for 15 years.

During harvest periods, he counts on the help of laborers who harvest and transport the crops to a certain point, after which they are moved by vehicle to  drying areas. He feels very satisfied with his work because thanks to his daily efforts, today he enjoys seeing that his plants are very productive and profitable. He also says that in the winter, his business suffers because there are many insects that impede the plants' development.

This is his first loan through MFP and he is grateful to the institution for allowing him this credit. He is ready to make all of his repayments punctually because he wishes to have access to more loans in the future.

He will use some of this loan to perform maintenance on his fields, such as cutting and clearing brush. He will use the rest of the money to buy sacks of fertilizer for his land.

loans.use: to hire laborers and buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Marco Vinicio

texts.es:
Marco de 43 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en la Perimetral. Es separado y tiene 4 hijos de 23, 21, 19 y 16 años de edad el menor todavía estudia en colegio fiscal. Tiene un taller de cerrajería.

Estaba antes en España pero no le iba bien que se regreso a Ecuador hace 4 años volviendo a trabajar en su negocio de cerrajería. Labora diariamente con cuatro ayudante que tiene en su taller. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere invertir en unos hierros para su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias. El anhela abrir un almacén en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Marco, 43, lives in a periurban zone in La Perimetral.  He’s separated and has four children who are 23, 21, 19 and 16 years of age.  The youngest is still in public school.  He has a metal shop.

He used to be in Spain but he wasn’t doing too well so he returned to Ecuador four years ago returning to work in his metal shop business.  He works every day with four helpers that he has in his shop.  With help from the loan he wants to invest in some iron for his business to increase profits.  He hopes to open a store downtown.

loans.use: to buy iron.

loans.name: Lureen

texts.en:
Lureen is a 21-year-old wife who has a one-year-old son. Lureen's husband runs a grocery store in Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Lureen and her husband moved to a new house in a residential complex that had no grocery store at the time so having the store led to good business.
Lureen has taken out a loan from Kiva partner, FATEN, to purchase a fridge for displaying items and goods to sell in the store.
Lureen is a conservative woman, as are most of Gaza Strip inhabitants, therefore her husband is shown in the photograph instead.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge and goods to sell in the grocery store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia sells food stuffs, fruits and popcorn at Elmina.  Cecilia has received senior high school education.  She is married and has 5 children.  Her husband is a driver. 

She supports her husband by providing the basic needs of her family.  Her loan will be used to buy fruits to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 32 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, two of whom are currently in school. John has a wholesale shop business that sells produce such as maize. He has run this business for two years.
To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase and stock more produce for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, John hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase and stock more produce for resale.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie is 34 years old, married and blessed with one child. 

His wife has a retailing business of cosmetics products while Ronnie is a farmer. He is engaged in growing rice and has been doing it for eight years.  They live in the Philippines.

Ronnie is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure, seeds of rice to be planted in his three hectares of farm and herbicides to protect his crops. 

He wants to improve and expand his business to increase his income, thus providing a better future for his family. He also dreams that his child could finish his studies and be able to get a good job someday. That's why he really works hard to become successful in his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides for his farm.

loans.name: Pedro Rafael

texts.en:
Pedro lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where for the last eight years he has made a living by selling plastic goods, paper plates and cups, and flatware. 

Pedro sells his wares at a stand at the local market and has a large web of clients that includes local hotels and restaurants. 

He is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase merchandise. Pedro hopes to keep working with Prisma in order to grow his small business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bowls, buckets, strainers, cups, plates and flatware.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  She is 33 years old and a single mother of three school going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan.  She paid her previous loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Milkah hopes to become one of the leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Dedicacion

texts.es:
Dedicación, de 45 años, enviudo hace dos años de su esposo Maurilio. Ambos tuvieron 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellas: Nora y Candí. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican.
Está valerosa mujer, se dedica a la siembra de tubérculos en la variedad de, papa, oyuco y oca, lo que más le gusta a ella, son los momentos en los que puede bajar de sus terrenos agrícolas a la ciudad, donde después de cada cosecha vende sus productos alimenticios, según cuenta comercializa a muy buen precio, pues cuida con mucho esmero de sus cultivos, escogiendo siempre los frutos más buenos. Ella baja por lo menos una vez a la ciudad de Tarma, donde aparte de vender sus nutritivos tubérculos, también comercializa carne de ovino al por mayor, con la venta puede costear los alimentos de la semana y algunos imprevistos. Ella agradece a Dios, por todo el apoyo que recibió y a pesar de lo pesado que es trabajar en la chacra, está feliz de poder tener algo propio y trabajarlo para sus hijos.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el duodécimo crédito con MFP, donde seguirá trabajando para el desarrollo de su banco comunal, además; como socia antigua promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Dedicación de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para preveer su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
45-year-old Dedicación is a widow.  She lost her husband Maurilio two years ago.  The couple had five children but Dedicación only lives with two of them: Nora and Candí.  They live together as a family unit in their own home which is located in the town of Ricrican.

This brave woman grows tubers (potatoes, oyuco and oca).  What she most enjoys is when she is able to travel down from her farm to the city where she sells her produce after each harvest.  She tells us that she is able to sell at a very good price because she takes a lot of care of her crops, always choosing the best fruit.  She travels at least once to the city of Tarma where, in addition to selling her nutritious tubers, she also sells meat from her sheep.  These sales enable her to cover the cost of her weekly food and some other incidental expenses.

Dedicación is grateful to God for all the support that she has received and, in spite of how demanding it is working on her farm, she is happy that she owns her farm and is able to work it for her children.

Dedicación belongs to the "Mirando a un futuro mejor" community bank and this is her 12th loan from MFP.  She will continue working for the development of her bank.  As a long-standing member of her bank, Dedicación pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  With your support, she will invest the money she has requested in buying several sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of natural fertilizers

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is aged 31 and has been farming in the Kitale area of western Kenya for 10 years. He is married with two children aged 7 and 1. He does timber lumbering for additional income. His farm produces milk and timber for the local market.

Kennedy has requested a loan of 41,600 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional dairy income will boost his income and enable him to buy more farm implements and a power saw for the lumbering business.

Kennedy sees the lack of business funds and animal diseases as the greatest threats to his farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Katina Sarita

texts.es:
Katina es socia del Banco Comunal Unión, tiene 36 años, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 5 años.
Katina tiene un locutorio y vende tarjetas telefónicas, empezó vendiendo queso por menor y mayor de ahí fue creciendo con sus ahorros, en las capacitaciones le enseñaron muchos valores y a poder ahorrar ya que en la casa no se puede, ahora con el préstamo que esta sacando va a comprar mas tarjetas y recargas para su negocio. Su meta es seguir esforzándose y progresar.
texts.en:
Katina is a member of the communal bank Unión. She is 36 years old and has been a member of FINCA Peru for 5 years. 

Katina has a communications call center and sells phone cards. She began by selling cheese, in small amounts and bulk, and from there her savings grew. During training they taught her business ethics and she was able to save, which she could not do by staying at home.

Now she is asking for a loan to buy more telephone cards and recharges for her business. Her goal is to continue her efforts and to progress.

loans.use: to buy telephone recharge cards

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William wants a loan to buy cows for rearing. 

Age 53 years, he hails from the Kyenjojo district and is the father of ten children age 30 to 2 with whom he lives, together with their mother, in a semi- permanent house. 

Having acquired his initial capital from the sale of part of his land, he has been a able to set up a cattle farm. 

He dreams of building a permanent residential house and diversifying into sugarcane growing.

loans.use: to buy another cow.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, necesita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de más sorbetes, paleta, gaseosa, para el negocio, debido a la necesidad de surtir el negocio y contar con nueva mercadería, es que Juan se decidió por el nuevo financiamiento. 
El préstamo anterior le sirvió para inyectar nuevo producto al negocio, mejorando considerablemente las ventas y de sus ganancias pudo cancelar cada cuota del préstamo, ha logrado ofrecer a su familia una mejor condición económica y espera continuar de esta manera.
texts.en:
Juan needs a new loan to buy more sorbets, popsicles and soft drinks, because of the need to stock his business and have new merchandise. 

This is why Juan made up his mind to apply for a new loan. He used the previous loan to put new products into his business, improving his sales considerably.  From his earnings, he was able to pay each instalment of the loan, and has succeeded in improving his family's financial situation. 

This way, he hopes to continue doing so.

loans.use: To buy sorbets, popsicles and soft drinks.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
