Simon is a businessman who also runs a butcher shop so as to earn extra income. He uses his income to support his family and to pay for his two employees. He has been a member of Faulu Kenya for two years. He gives great gratitude to Faulu Kenya for helping him expand his business. He has requested for KES 80,000 for repairing his van. He hopes to expand his business and become financially stable. He sees himself owning five transport vans in the future.

loans.use: To repair his van

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario de Telica Departamento de León, actualmente está trabajando en el Mined Telica, desempeñándose como Asesor Pedagógica
texts.en:
This client is from Telica, León department. She is employed by Telica's Ministry of Education as an Educational Advisor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Ferma

texts.en:
Ferma B. is from the city of Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 54 years old. Ferma is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Ferma owns & operates a business raising "fish pond" fish for sale. Ferma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ferma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ferma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ferma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ferma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Adjouavé Cyriane

texts.en: Adjouavé Cyriane D. is 36 years old. She was born in Benin but now lives in Togo. She has been in business selling cereals for about 10 years. Mme. D. is married with three children. Her husband works in transportation. Mme. D.'s store is situated in the Adidogome Market, next to the Sedok Hotel. With her loan of 500,000 XOF, she will purchase maize, beans, sorghum, and millet. This is her third loan with WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase cereals - corn maize, beans, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely M. is from the town of Villa Marzo Cordon. She is 42 years old. Fely is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Fely owns and operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle transport. Fely has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Fely is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fely from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Sokh

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokh P., 39, is a farmer living in a commune in Kompong Tom Province. She raises pigs and rice crops. She has a life partner in her husband who appears in the photo here. He is a palm climber and also fishes in and around the river. They have three children, two of whom are students and other one is still not enrolled school. 

Sokh P. planted rice crops a few months ago but her rice is not growing well and it may require fertilizer. To solve this problem, Sokh P. requests a loan to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield.

loans.name: Wahab

texts.en:
Wahab is a 42-year-old married entrepreneur from Lebanon.  Since 1999, Wahab has been running a car mechanic business. Today, for the first time, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1500 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to purchase spare parts for his garage. 

Wahab is proud of his experience and his strong reputation in his line of work. He notes that it has been a challenge to secure financing for his business. He decided on starting his own business because he wanted to have an independent job and not to depend on an employer. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina is a 49 year-old married lady with six children who go to school.  She makes and sells laundry soap and detergents to earn a living.  She has been in the this business for six years and her business has really grown through Faulu Kenya.  This is because she uses her savings with a group in Faulu Kenya to invest in her business.  She previously took out a loan of 30, 000 KES to boost the business.  She has requested another loan of 50, 000 KES to buy chemicals and detergents for making soap.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and detergents for making soap

loans.name: Rosa Florinda

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa Florinda Gualtamber es socia del banco comunal Cumbe, vive en el centro de la parroquia Cumbe, esta parroquia es conocida por su exuberante vegetación, es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, mucha de su población joven a migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.
 
La Señora. Rosa Florinda tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos  de 27, 24 y 12 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas son solteras y trabajan para sus gastos y su último hijo este año ingresa al colegio, su esposo trabaja como albañil pero como no hay mucho trabajo ahora esta dedicado a la ganadería, con el esfuerzo y el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica al negocio de animales, vende ganado, borregos y chanchos, trabaja todos los días y los fines de semana se dedican a  su restaurante en donde prepara una gran variedad de platos  especialmente con carne de chancho.

Es nuestra socia hace 3 años atrás pero se ha retirado un tiempo del banco comunal, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, le gusta mucho la banca comunal por que se encuentra con sus amigas, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ganado, su meta es crecer en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Rosa Florinda Gualtamber is a member of the community bank named Cumbe. She lives in the centre core of the Cumbe region. This region is well known for its exuberant vegetation and its cold climate. The population is mostly made up of cattle farmers and agriculturists. Much of the younger population has emigrated in search of better job opportunities. Rosa Florinda is 47 years old, she is married and she has 3 children, aged 27, 24 and 12 years old. The eldest two daughters are single and are financially independent. Her youngest son starts school this year. Her husband works as a construction worker but because there isn't very much work he is also a cattle farmer. With their mutual hard work they were able to build their own house. Rosa Florinda raises livestock, sells cattle, sheep and pigs. At this occupation she works on the weekdays but on the weekends she runs their restaurant where they serve a lengthy menu, especially using pork meat. She has been a member of the community bank for 3 years, though she took a leave of absence. She is on her second loan cycle. She very much enjoys working with the community bank because she gets to collaborate with her friends. The loan will be invested in the purchase of more livestock. Her goal is to make her businesses grow.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Sroin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sroin K. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Nheb Eng, have been married since 1982 and have two children. They live in a small village across the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sroin and her husband are farmers. They grow rice on their farmland in the village. Besides farming, Mr. Nheb Eng is a fisherman as well. Sroin has had several Kiva loans; she is now asking for a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a rice milling machine.

loans.use: To purchase a rice milling machine.

loans.name: Vilma Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma Roxana; ella tiene 27  años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de profesora del nivel inicial y también tiene un negocio de servicio de internet que trabaja desde las 2:00 a.m hasta las 10:30 p.m por medio de estos trabajos puede sacar adelante a su pequeña hija,la socia quiere ampliar  y mejorar el negocio de internet. La socia solicita mejorar el servicio de internet y comprar una computadora.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Introducing Vilma Roxana, a member of the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” Communal Bank, located in Wanchaq, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Vilma Roxana is 27 years old, she is married and has 1 daughter. She alternates her everyday chores with two job activities: she teaches in primary school and she runs an Internet services facility which is open form 2 am to 10:30 pm. Thanks to these activities she is able to provide for her young daughter. She would like to implement and improve the Internet activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy a computer to improve the Internet service she offers. She is thankful to those who will form part of her dream through this loan and she commits to comply with the repayment of her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer to improve the Internet services she offers.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.ru: Шарипова Зайнура проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 32 года. Разведена, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Более 8 лет занимается торговлей на центральном рынке города. Арендует торговую точку, где продает женское нижнее белье. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Zainura S. lives in the city of Kurgan-Tiube. She is 32 years old, divorced and has two children. She completed high school. For more than eight years, she has been engaged in trade in the central city market. She runs a trade stall, where she sells women's underwear. The loan will allow her to expand her assortment of goods.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her variety of goods

loans.name: Wulamatu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Wulamatu. She is divorced and has two children, aged 17 and 6 years. She has one additional dependent in her niece.  

In 2008, Wulamatu established her provisions and cosmetics business. She began her business to assist with home expenses. Working six days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 854,360 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. She is very savvy in establishing relationships with her customers in order to increase her daily sales.  

Wulamatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Wulamatu requires a loan in order to buy soft drinks, cola drinks and general provisions. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 153,784. In the future, Wulamatu plans to expand her shop space by rebuilding her current one. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres La Amistad del barrio Marambure de la ciudad de Luque, se formó mediante la señora Guillermina G. quien acompaño a su hija a retirar su crédito individual, se informó del programa del comité y decidió invitar a sus vecinas y amigas a conformar un grupo de mujeres, para que de esa forma ellas puedan acceder al crédito y poder crecer laboralmente. 
Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el quinto ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y está conformado por 16 integrantes las cuales invierten en distintas actividades.

La señora Ana es una de las integrantes y presidenta del grupo, una mujer trabajadora y activa, dirige y acompaña al grupo en cada actividad que realizan para recaudar fondos para pagar las cuotas y contar con ahorros en caso de emergencia.
Su actividad consiste en vender ropas y así ayuda a su familia. La venta lo realiza  se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de prendas varias para su venta posterior.
La venta lo realiza desde su salón en su casa, pero en los días que  hay ventas ella en el local, ella sale a ofrecer en casa de conocidos, de esa manera obtener un ingreso diario ya que el mismo ayuda a la familia con los gastos de alimentación.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas para contar con mayor variedad de la temporada de primavera – verano, como camisas, blusas, remeras, shorts y otros.
texts.en:
The Friendship of Women (Mujeres La Amistad) committee in the Marambure neighborhood of the city of Luque, was formed by Guilldermina G..  She accompanied her daughter to withdraw her individual credit, found out about the committee's program, and then decided to invite her neighbors and friends to form a group of women so that they could access credit and improve productivity.

Currently, the committee is in its fifth cycle of the program for the Women Entrepreneurs Committee of the Paraguayan Foundation (Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya) and is comprised of 16 members who invest in various activities.

Ana is one of the members and president of the group.  She is an active working woman and she directs and accompanies the group in each activity undertaken, from raising funds for down payments to keeping savings in case of an emergency.

Her business is selling clothes to help out her family.  She is devoted to selling clothes and investing the money to purchase several more items for later sale.  She sells from her living room at home, but in previous days she did local sales by going to homes of acquaintances, thereby earning a daily income to help her family with food expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothes to have a greater variety of styles for the spring and summer seasons, including shirts, blouses, shirts, shorts and more.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, blouses, jeans, pants, and more.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth G. is from the village of Villa Victoria Echague. She is 47 years old. Elizabeth is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elizabeth is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling electronic and card mobile loads in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy electronics products for resale

loans.name: Edson

texts.en: Edson is a thirty-three-year-old married man with two children who owns a house and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has a retail shop and has also been into tailoring and knitting for the last four years now. His vision is to own a wholesale business. Edson needs the loan to buy sugar, soap, and cooking oil for resale in his shop.

loans.use: Buying sugar, soap, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina B. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Camburong, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a pig fattening and motorcycle business. Her husband, Onesimo B., who is 54 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. They have six children who are between 11 and 30 years old. One of them has a family, while three others are working to help out in the house, and the youngest two go to school. Marcelina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. Marcelina B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marcelina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus improving the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her ninth loan, she wants to borrow PHP 15,000 to use as additional capital for the business so that she can continue to save up for the future and support the family's needs. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To maintain plant health

loans.name: Alawi

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old and lives with five family members. 

In 2006, Alawi opened a mobile phones shop in his local area where competition is minimal. He has a good reputation and he is well known.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to install an external ceiling at the entrance of his shop and renovate the store. He is aiming to grow bigger in the future and increase his revenues.

loans.use: Install an external ceiling at the entrance of his shop and renovate the store

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya is a 34-year-old and lives with her 11-year-old son in the Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her son live together in a house with a fence. Her son currently attends a local secondary school. Her husband works for the concrete-block producing company during the summer months. 

Enhtuya operates a meat-trading business out of a rented stall at the local trade center in her town. She started her business in 2006 and has since gained much experience. Today, her working capital exceeds 600,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). In addition, she plants and grows a variety of vegetables to sell at the local market for a profit. 

For the future, she plans to increase her working capital for her meat-trading business and enlarge the field where she plants her vegetables in order to increase her vegetable sales. With her business earnings, she was able to afford to buy her own house with fence. 

Enhtuya is a hardworking and modest person and is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve a large amount of meat in order to sell it during the spring months, when prices for such products traditionally rise.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve a large amount of meat

loans.name: Najem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has three children. In 2005, Najem decided to open his own business as a blacksmith, since he had some experience. He is well known in his community and has an excellent reputation.

Najem is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a big generator so his production won't stop when the electricity is down. He is aiming to grow bigger and increase his revenues.

loans.use: To buy a big generator

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre "Mujeres Emprendedoras" se conformó el 17 de mayo del 2006, mediante las promociones que realizó la Asesora en la zona, se encuentra integrado hoy día por 20 mujeres y siguen trabajando  con el mismo entusiasmo y esfuerzo. Ya se encuentran trabajando en  el 16º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El grupo tiene un excelente comportamiento de pago, y el trato entre ellas es memorable, gracias a esto y a su trabajo solidario siguen  adelante incrementando sus ingresos y  trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
El crédito será destinado a la compra de mercaderías para la despensa y el almacén (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.), especialmente la sra. Marciana, quien posee su pequeña tienda de comestibles para el sustento diario de su familia. Ella desea mucho poder darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar general.
Todas las miembros del grupo participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee named “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Women Entrepreneurs) was formed on May 17, 2006, as a result of promotional events conducted by the local representative. Today, twenty women have joined and continue to work with the same level of enthusiasm and effort. They are working in their sixteenth loan cycle together as part of the program.

The group has an excellent payment history and the members treat one another very well. Thanks to their work as a solidarity group, the members have been able to increase their incomes. To this day, they continue to work with the program.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise for a food pantry such as rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, baked goods, tea, and other items. Sra. Marciana has a small food store that provides for the daily needs of her family. She wants to give her children a better quality of life and provide for their general well-being.

All of the group members actively participate in the weekly meetings and work together harmoniously.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, baked goods, tea, and other items

loans.name: Nohemy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nohemí, D. 24 años D. edad, resiD. en Corinto departamento D. Morazán, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, vive con su esposo don Felipe D. Jesús quien trabaja como vigilante D. una Agencia Alerta Total, no tienen hijos actualmente.  El negocio D. ella tiene un año y medio D. existir, venD. tres días a la semana generalmente D. forma ambulante, el horario D. venta es D. 7:00am a 5:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa, ya que este negocio debe estar en constante renovación, porque las prendas D. vestir van cambiando la moda y los colores que a los clientes les gustan, esta inversión ayudara a tener abundantes estilos y así ofrecer más productos.
Las aspiraciones D. Nohemí es que a través del trabajo que realiza diariamente, pueda ir cambiando las condiciones D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en: Nohemí, age 24, lives in Corinto, in Morazán department. She dedicates her time to selling clothes. She lives with her husband, Don Felipe D. Jesús, who works as a night watchman for a security agency. They do not have children. Nohemí's business has been in existence for a year and a half now. She generally spends 3 days a week selling, going door to door. She is out selling from 7am until 5pm. Now she is seeking a loan to buy clothing because the business requires a constant turnover of stock. The garments have to keep changing with the fashions and colours her customers want. This investment will help her to have an abundance of styles and therefore offer a wider range of products. Nohemí aspires to be able to improve her family's standard of living through the work she does each day.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma D. is from the village of Bolinao. She is 42 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Elma owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Elma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Elma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jaime Ramel

texts.en:
Jaime Ramel D. P. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 42 years old and married.  Jaime Ramel owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, biscuits & candies.  He has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jaime Ramel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jaime Ramel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & beverages. This loan will be his 2nd loan from HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & beverages

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha is 34 years old and married to Milka Chepkemei, a housewife. They are blessed with two children aged three and one. Elisha owns a timber yard in Mutwot trading centre and has been in the business for three years, getting a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

He has asked KADET LTD for a loan of 75,000 KES. This is his second loan; he paid off his previous loan successfully. Elisha intends to use the loan to purchase timbers for resale and the anticipated profits will be used to support his family and improve their welfare.

He hopes to open a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.ar: عمار رجل اعزب عمره36 سنة يعيش في منطقة العين اللبنانية يعمل في بيع الادوات المنزلية والغذائية له في عمله 20 سنة كان للقرض السابق على حياته وحياة اسرته الاثر الجيد فقد قدمة له المجموعة من خلال القرض المحافظة على نمط حياة مستقرة في ظل ظروف صعبة وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل يتميز عمله بالجودة والدقة والشمولية في تنوع البضاعة وحسن المعاملة مع الزبائن يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء ادوات منزلية ومواد غذائية وادوات خاصة بالمطاعم للموسم السياحي له زبائن من اكثر المناطق القريبة يواجه بعض الصعوبات المادية التي تعييق تطوير العمل يملك الخبرة الواسعة في هذا المجال ويسعى ان يكور نفسه وعمله بشكل اكبر وهو في طور تأسيس عائلة
texts.en: Ammar is 36 years old and unmarried. He lives in the Al-Ain region of Lebanon. He works selling home and kitchen appliances. He has 20 years of experience in this line of work. His last loan had a positive impact on his and his family's life. Through a loan from al-Majmoua he was able to maintain a stable lifestyle during difficult times. He received the full support of his family during his last loan. His business stands out in its field due to the quality of his products, his attention to detail, the comprehensive variety of his inventory, and his good dealings with his customers. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy homes appliances, food items, and appliances especially for use in restaurants in order to prepare for the tourist season. He has customers from most of the areas nearby the location of his store. He is having some material difficulties which are hindering him from developing his business. He has wide-ranging experience in his field, and he strives to further develop himself and his business while he is in the stage of his life when he will soon be starting a family.

loans.use: buy food items and appliances for his store.

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es: Viviano es casado de 51 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos su negocio es de venta de calzado lo inicio hace 20 años el nos cuenta que esta muy agradecido con fape y kiva por el apoyo que le han brindado desde hace mucho tiempo con los creditos porque gracias a eso su negocio a crecido considerablemente solicita este nuevo credito pra la compra de calzado en bariedad ya que sus clientes lo piden otros estilos mas modernos, el sueño de el es abrir un nuevo local para poder aumentar sus ventas  y asi poder obtener mas ganancias y darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Viviano is 51 years old, married, and has three children.  His business is selling footwear and he has been in this business for 20 years.  He tells us that he is very grateful to FAPE and Kiva for the support that they have been offering him for a long time through their loans because, as a result, his business has grown considerably.

Viviano is requesting this new loan to buy a variety of footwear since his customers are requesting other, more modern styles.  Viviano's dream is to open new premises so that he can increase his sales, make more profits and provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell

loans.name: Ananias

texts.es: Ananias, de 26 años de edad, convive con su pareja Aída de 23 años y fruto de esa relación tienen una hija llamada Analía de 02 años y juntos residen en su propia casa en la comunidad de Bethel anexo del distrito de Quimbiri. Ananias, aún cuando era adolescente trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres, paralelamente también trabajaba como jornalero en otras chacras. Con el tiempo logró ahorrar dinero y con ello compró su propia parcela, han transcurrido 05 años que trabaja en sus mismas tierras y hasta  el momento cuenta con 02 hectáreas más, en donde siembra cacao y café.  La clave de su éxito radica en las ganas de superarse, por ello puso mucho empeño y conocimientos en su trabajo, es así que aplica técnicas en la siembra, debido a las constantes capacitaciones que recibe de los Ingenieros Agrónomos. Su producto con mayor demanda es el grano de café, por la calidad del producto que ofrece y por ende percibe buenos réditos económicos. Normalmente trabaja solo, pero en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros, de esa manera puede extraer con mayor rapidez sus frutos.  Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción agrícola, así podrá mejorar su condición de vida. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será de mucha utilidad en el progreso de su trabajo, en su banco comunal es un joven que aporta ideas para el progreso de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en las cosecha y sacar la mala hierba de sus campos.
texts.en:
Ananias is 26 years old. He lives with his partner, Aída, who is 23 years old. They have a daughter named Analía, who is 2 years old. They live together in their own house in the community of Bethel, which is annexed to the district of Quimbiri. 

Ananias was working in his parent’s fields by the time he was a teenager; at the same time he worked as a laborer in other people’s fields. Over time he was able to save money and buy his own piece of land. It has been 5 years since he started working his own lands and he now has an additional 2 hectares where he plants cacao and coffee. The key to his success lies in his desire to better himself. In order to do this, he has put a lot of effort and knowledge into his work. He knows how to plant his crops correctly because of the constant trainings he receives from agricultural engineers. His product with greatest demand is coffee beans. He has good quality products and as a result he receives a good income. He usually works alone, but during harvest times he hires laborers so that he can harvest the crops more quickly. His plan for the future is to continue increasing his agricultural production and thereby improve his living conditions. 

This is his fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He knows that this loan will be of great help to him in the progress of his work. In his communal bank, he is a young man who shares his ideas about how to achieve progress in the group. With this loan he will hire laborers to help him with the harvest and to remove weeds from his fields.

loans.use: to hire laborers for the harvest.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Joseph has a food shop and sells chicken and pork barbecue. He  had this business for three years. He requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos to buy raw ingredients like meat and food seasoning for barbecues. He also continues in providing motorela (motorcycle transport) services and his wife manages their food shop.

Joseph has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future,  Joseph  hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like meat and food seasoning for barbecues

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a 50 year-old married mother of five children aged between five and eighteen. Halima owns a retail shop in Macknon, Voi. Her business has been in operation for the last five years. Halima is a KADET client and this marks her fourth borrowing cycle to finance her business. With this loan she plans to add more stock of corn flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan. Halima dream is to own a piece of land.

loans.use: to add more stock of corn flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is 38 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school.  

Scovia has a business of a bar and restaurant, which she has had for four years. She also has a poultry firm.  

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase beer, sodas and food for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Scovia hopes to generate greater profits and provide some basic needs for her family.  

In the future, Scovia hopes to become a popular businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase beer, sodas and food for resale.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is a father of three school-aged children. His spouse is a housewife. He is now 44 years old.
Florencio is a simple farmer working in the Philippines. He wants a loan amount of 27,000 PHP to acquire farm inputs needed in his farming business such as fertilizers, rice seed and insecticides. Florencio will also use some of the loan to pay the labor fees of his hired laborer in sowing, pulling and transplanting rice in the field. In the future, he will exert his best effort to increase his farming income so that someday his family will become economically stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, rice seed and insecticides.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Doña Alba Luz, tiene su propio negocio, la venta de comida con mas de dieciseis años en las ventas, en su especialidad la venta de baho. En donde ha logrado mucha clientela, haciendolo de forma ambulante, aunque se queda en una sola parte todos los dia. Y por las noches hace fritanga en su casa. 
Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, y ambos apoyan  a sus hijos para el bien comun de la familia.
Alba Luz, ha crecido en producir mas comida, gracias a los financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en oncce ciclos, de los cuales parte de estos ha sido para la infraestructura de su casa. asi como el aumento en venta de comida.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo, sera para la compra de granos basicos: arroz, frijoles, azucar, bidon de aceite, carnes de res, de cerde y pollo para elabarorar las ricas comidas, a si como frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Alba Luz has her own business, selling meals, with more than 16 years experience. Her specialty is "baho," a meat and yucca dish, for which she has earned many customers. She sells meals in the streets from one locale in the daytime, then evenings, she sells a stew from her house.

Alba can count on her husband's help, and both parents assist their children for the common good of the family.  Alba's business has grown as she cooks more meals, thanks to loans provided by Afodenic during 11 loan cycles. A part of these loans has been used to improve the infrastructure of her house, as well as for increasing the sale of meals.

Today, with this new loan, Alba will buy basic grains, including rice, plus beans, sugar, a container of cooking oil, beef, pork, and chicken, for preparing rich meals, plus fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to invest in meat, chicken, basic grains, fruit, and vegetables, to prepare tasty dishes to sell.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 27 years old and is married with one child who is two years old. She sells various goods such as: cassava flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice, fruit and vegetables and so. Her business is well-organized. The hours of her business are from 8am until 5pm every day except on Saturday. She has three years' experience in this business and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Olive has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more beans, cassava flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice, fruit and vegetables and so for sale. With any profits, Olive will reinvest in her business, save for her future and she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice and so on to sell.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas, de 48 años, convive con Dionisia, su esposa. Ambos tienen un hijo: Gerson, de 9 años de edad. En unión familiar, los tres viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Ricrican.Por ser una zona alta y muy productiva, comenzó con la siembra de tubérculos como: papa, oyuco, oca y mashua; su principal actividad agrícola y económica, lo que más le gusta a él, es salir todas las mañanas acompañado de una radio, donde al compás de la música cuida, riega y abona sus cultivos, según afirma “el campo es su vida”, desde niño creció aprendiendo las técnicas de cultivo y es lo único que aprendió. Por ello cada cosecha es símbolo de su perseverancia y buenos cuidados; además de poseer terrenos de cultivo en diferentes lugares de la ciudad, por lo que siembra en grandes cantidades. En el mercado mayorista de su localidad, vende no solo la cosecha de sus cultivos, también la carne del ovino que cría; pero a diferencia de sus demás pobladores, él también comercializa la lana de este animal, que es muy gruesa y protege del frío. Ahora Blas, quiere comprar un camión, con el cual piensa trasladarse con mayor facilidad, sus cultivos y los animales que comercializa.
Él pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde se siente alegre; comenta, que gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal, pudo salir adelante. Razón por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Blas de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en  la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, los cuales esparcirá en su próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
48-year-old Blas lives with his wife Dionisia.  The couple have one son: 9-year-old Gerson.  The three of them live together in their own home which is located in the village of Ricicran.  As this is a mountainous and very productive area, Blas started growing tubers such as potatoes, oyuco, oca and mashua.  This is his main business activity.  What Blas most enjoys is going out every morning with his radio and watering and fertilizing his crops to the rhythm of the music.  He says "the countryside is my life".  As a boy, Blas grew up learning how to grow crops and this is all he learned.  Every harvest is a symbol of his perseverance and the attention that he has given his crops.  Blas owns farmland in different places in town which means that he grows in large quantities.  In the wholesale market in his town, Blas not only sells his harvested crops but also the meat from the sheep that he raises.  However, unlike others in his town, he also sells the wool of these animals which is very thick and provides protection from the cold.  Blas would like to buy a truck so that he can transport the crops and animals that he sells more easily.

Blas is a member of the "Mirando a un futuro mejor" community bank and this is his eighth loan from MFP.  He feels very cheerful.  He says that thanks to the support of his community bank, he has been able to get ahead in life.  For this reason, he pledges to make his loan repayments on time.  With your support, Blas will invest the money that he has requested in buying several sacks of natural fertilizer which he will spread over his crops.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of natural fertilizers

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 30 years old and married. His primary business is carpentry and he has been in business for four years. The business gives him a monthly income of KES 5,000.

This is his third loan with KADET LTD . He plans to use the loan to buy more timber for carpentry work. The anticipated profit from the business will help him support his sister and children. 


His dreams and hopes are to ensure that his family is stable financially.

loans.use: To buy more timber for carpentry work

loans.name: Meyer

texts.es: Meyer, de 28 años, convive con Yovana, su esposa. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Jean, Pool y Miaricielo. En unión familiar ellos viven en casa de su tía, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Hace tres años que terminó la carrera de ingeniería zootecnia y desde ahí comenzó a asesorar a los habitantes del pueblo donde nació; y del cual se siente feliz por ello, pues los ganaderos de su zona no tienen pérdidas en el cuidado de sus ganados. Le va muy bien en esto, pues hace poco asumió el cargo de gerente de desarrollo social en el gobierno de su localidad, por el constante aporte que brinda en su consultoría. Desde ahí visita los diferentes pueblitos y caseríos para realizar apoyo en sus sembríos y ganados. Además cuenta que desde muy joven, comenzó a tejer junto a su padre; ese oficio lo realiza desde entonces como un pasatiempo. Pero también como un ingreso extra, pues en su pueblo todos son artesanos y como tal su esposa también teje para apoyarlo en los gastos del hogar. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Telarmachay” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP. Como profesional se siente satisfecho de que existan personas, que apoyen a los que necesitan. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Meyer de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una motocicleta para trasladarse durante sus visitas a los agricultores y ganaderos.
texts.en: Meyer, 28 years old, lives with Yovana his wife. They have 3 children: Jean, Pool and Miaricielo. As a family, they live in an aunt's house which is located in San Pedro de Cajas. Three years ago he completed his studies in husbandry engineering and began advising the people of the village where he was born. He feels very happy doing so as the breeders in his area suffer no losses in livestock. He is doing very well with this and recently was appointed manager of social development in his local government due to the continuing contribution he provides with his consulting services. From his location, he visits different towns and villages to provide support and advise on crops and livestock. Also he tells us that from a young age he started weaving with his father. He still practices this craft as a hobby and also as an extra source of income, as in his town everyone is an artisan; his wife also weaves to help with the household expenses. He belongs to the communal bank “Telarmachay” and this is his 3rd loan with MFP. As a professionnal he feels happy that there are people who support those in need. He also promises to be punctual with his repayments. Meyer, on receiving your support, will invest the money requested to purchase a motorcycle in order to visit the farmers and livestock breeders.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mayada

texts.en: Mayada is a 26-year-old young woman. She is divorced and has one son and one daughter. She has a sheep-raising project and benefits from its products by selling them. Also, she has another source of income from agriculture. Mayada wants to expand her project by purchasing more sheep and fodder. However, the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for this, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Mayada gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase more sheep and fodder. She will be able to expand the project, and the productivity of the project will increase. This will result in increased sales, which will lead to an increased income and better living conditions for her family. Mayada is a conservative woman, so her father was photographed instead of her in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Fresia Sonia

texts.es:
Fresia de 33 años, una mujer trabajadora que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento de su negocio.
Su negocio es la venta de especies como: ajo molido, ají, pimiento, etc.
Escogió esta actividad porque a ella le gusta el comercio, elabora esta actividad con su hermana.
Su trabajo lo efectúa con responsabilidad, su horario es de lunes a domingo, desde las 7:00am hasta las 12:00am.
Su dificultad es la delincuencia, ya que ha sido víctima de hurtos.
Es casada, su esposo trabaja en un taller de mecánico.
Tiene 3 hijos los cuales tiene 3, 5 y 8 años, estudian es escuelas públicas. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir más en su negocio.
Su sueño es construir su casa y que vive en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
Fresia is 33, and a hard-working woman who has ambitions of expanding her business.  Her business is selling spices such as ground garlic, chili pepper, pepper, etc. 

She chose this work, because she likes having a shop.  She runs the business with her sister.  She does her work responsibly. Her hours are from 7:00am to noon, Monday to Sunday.  Her problem is crime, since she has been a victim of robberies.  

She is married, and her husband works in an auto repair shop.  She has three children, ages three, five and eight, who go to public schools. She is applying for the loan in order to invest further in her business. Her dream is to build a house, as she lives in the home of her in-laws.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as ground garlic, chili pepper, pepper and candy.

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en: Yassah is 33 years old and lives in west point. She is single and has three children aged 6 to 13 years old. For the past two years she has been selling biscuits in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more biscuits for her business, so that she can make more profit and have more customers. She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more biscuits for her business.

loans.name: Jacinto Aparicio

texts.es:
El Sr. Jacinto tiene 47 años de edad. El se dedica a la venta hamburguesas, panchos, y bebidas desde hace ya un tiempo. Nos cuenta que él trabajo desde muy joven en esto y que experiencia al respecto le sobra; con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logro y montar su negocio y le gustaría poder seguir creciendo. 
Jacinto ya tiene una clientela bien formada en los alrededores del barrio; con este trabajo logro mejorar su vivienda y darle la educación necesaria a sus hijos, ya que ellos son la razón de su vida y es por ellos que diariamente lucha, pues quiere darles lo mejor y que no pasen por privaciones. El necesita de este crédito para la compra de hamburguesas, panchos, y bebidas, los cuales son esenciales para su negocio. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y construir su propio local. 
Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Jacinto is 47 years old. He has been selling hamburgers, hot dogs, and beverages from some time. Jacinto says that he has worked from a very young age, so he has experience in this line of work. Through great effort and sacrifice, he was able to establish his business and would like to continue growing.

Jacinto already has a well-established customer base in the surrounding neighborhoods. Through his work, he has been able to make improvements to his home and provide the necessary education for his children. They are his reason for living, so he strives each day to give them the best so that they can avoid hardships.

He needs this loan to buy hamburgers, hot dogs, and beverages since these are essential products for his business. Jacinto dreams of expanding his business and building his own shop. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been provided, since this loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy hamburgers, hot dogs, and beverages.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariana is married with one child. She is 62 years old and lives in Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Mariana sells assorted goods such as noodles, shampoo, and canned goods to earn a living and she has had this business for less than a year. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase assorted canned goods, noodles, and bottles of shampoo. Mariana has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 9 years.

loans.use: To purchase assorted canned goods, noodles, and shampoo for resale

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a 50-year-old married woman with six children aged between 13 and 24.

Saturnina sells soft drinks for a living. Her customers are sari-sari stores and restaurant owners. Saturnina earns about PHP 7,800 per month from this business. She has requested a loan to buy more soft drinks to sell so that she can expand her business. 

She plans to use her profit to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell.
